text: Honestly the best pet insurance company! Easy to file claims, great coverage for our two fur babies, and claims are processed so efficiently. For example I just filed a claim on Monday and it already was processed. Could not recommend enough!
title: Highly Recommend!

text: I had called to cancel my cat’s insurance following his death. I had a difficult time talking without crying and the person I spoke with (Terry) was so very kind and supportive. Terry brought compassion to a difficult conversation. The company also sent a very kind email to express their gratitude for our business and condolences for our loss. They also process our claims quickly.
title: Insurance with compassion

text: Reached out to customer support with a couple nuanced questions and was connected with Blair, who promptly and knowledgeably answered everything I needed and more. He was able to quickly adjust our policy and was extremely friendly and polite. Refreshing customer support service, hope anyone who calls in is fortunate enough to be connected with him.
title: Excellent customer support

text: Filed a claim 1/7/24. Today is 4/1/24 and I have STILL not received an update. I've called multiple times, been promised by multiple representatives that they would get back to me directly, nothing. Feel this "insurance" has been a complete waste of my money and will be filing to get the last 4 months of money I've paid to this insurance company back. Feel completely scammed and they have nice people when you call customer service, but zero follow through.
title: Filed a claim 1/7/24

text: The claims process is easy and they’re quite timely in their reimbursement (a month or less). I honestly can’t imagine using any other pet insurance company!
title: Easy to use and fast processing

text: I had the fastest experience ever with my latest claim. I had a 5:00 pm vet appt for my dog on a Friday night, on a holiday weekend. I submitted my claim after I got home and within 2 hours it was approved and the reimbursement was submitted to my bank. There were times in the past where I waited a month for processing. They have really improved in this area! Wow!
title: Lightning fast reimbursement!

text: They do an excellent job at reviewing claims in a timely manner. I haven’t had any issues with them and recommend them to all of my friends with pets.
title: They do an excellent job at reviewing…

text: So easy to make the claim, was contacted immediately that claim was received.  The very next day the claim was paid out.  Amazing response.
title: So easy to make the claim

text: Pets Best is a STELLAR insurance company. Submitting a claim is a breeze. The status of the claim is easily visible, and the payments are prompt.  I have recommended this company to my friends and spread the word to my veterinarian as well. I highly recommend them!
title: Pets Best is a STELLAR company

text: Very easy to use, great customer service and very transparent. No hidden fees or surprises. Great insurance!
title: Great pet insurance!

text: I like the summary of benefits paid. The only thing I dislike is The it takes to get reimbursed.
title: I like the summary of benefits paid

text: Their service is automated annoyance. I have two dogs and they get services from the vet on the same invoice. So when I submit an invoice I put in the comments this service is for this dog . . . Spelling it out for them. Every single time they kick back one because they say the invoice was it provided for this animal. Between that and the time it takes to get reimbursed and the cost of the insurance overall it's like the world's worst necessary evil. So over pet insurance but need it just in case.
title: Their service is automated annoyance

text: efficient and straightforward claim process, near immediate reimbursement. I wish human insurance were this competent. luckily my first and only time using PetsBest so far has been for an annual check-up and vaccines, but I am grateful to have a sense of PetsBest quick processing time for future reference.
title: Efficient and straightforward

text: Out of all the pet insurance policies I’ve had, this is by far the worst one. Processing time will always be 2-4 weeks. Out of 10 claims I’ve submitted, 5 have been delayed. All of which were claims over 100$. They have payment processing issues where if you’re signed up for ACH and that fails, well you’re getting a check in the mail. They don’t attempt a redeposit even though it’s their own system issues. I feel like most of these reviews are fake. They’ve continuously made it harder and more difficult to process your claims. My documentation was always fine at first then i started getting kick back on the same documents because their requirements changed and no one notified me of this update.  I’ve been with this company for over 2 years now and im just not satisfied with how they handle and process claims.
title: Out of all the pet insurance policies…

text: Fast service good EOB as always it would've been nice to more money back but still the reimbursement is good
title: Fast reliable service

text: I was disappointed that my deductible was taken twice on the same claim. The reason said was that the blood work for the surgery missed the yearly deadline by two weeks. I wasn't aware of the deadline. So out of a claim of over $1100.00 only $200 was paid. I understand about the dental cleaning while the tooth was being extracted wasn't covered. Still felt that the insurance wasn't worth having.
title: I was disappointed that my deductible…

text: Pets best has been easy to work with and submit claims.  Claims take awhile to process but they paid according to my policy without a hassle.  I would recommend them.
title: Pets best has been easy to work with…

text: I understand that insurance increases are based on many factors however 47% in a year for a policy holder that has only had yearly wellness claims is outrageous! Further while you boast a 100% coverage that amount covered is barely a factor of the real cost. I have canceled this policy and encourage existing policy holders and clients considering Pets Best to put your premium in a savings account for possible emergencies in your animals healthcare. You will be far better off.
title: Don't waste your money

text: I can’t say enough about how great it is to have this insurance for my fur babies! Easy to use the app. Keeps updating claim status and is very timely! I recommend this for anyone with pets!

text: There are many issues. If i wasn’t stuck in a position where, switching companies would ban pre-existing conditions, I would cancel my policy. Unfortunately, I’m stuck here. The app never works, customer service is horrible, claims processing takes way too long, as well as pay outs. Things are many times denied being payed out, that def should be covered, and paid out for. Overall, this company is poor, at best. Many things need to change here, and yet nothing is being done about it. It’s very frustrating.
title: There are many issues

text:
Pets Best was the best decision I ever made for my dog and cat. My papillon has has 2 major issues in 5 years and this company and its caring employees have made bad situations so much easier for us. Knowing her specialists doing her treatment in the right orders has made claims easier to input. Pets Best has paid all our claims s are t 90%
Thank you…Pets Best!!!
title: Pets Best was the best decision I ever…

text: It takes a long time for their review and then they pay so little!  I am not particularly happy with this company!
title: Takes a long time and pays very little!

text: We pay (now) about $90/month plus WellCare. It bothers me that we bring our dog for a yearly check-up with required vaccines/shots and none of those weee covered. So would like to know why we should have WellCare??? A $383 vet bill and Pets best only paid out $155. Very disappointed.
title: We pay (now) about $90/month plus…

text: What made my experience great was that I didn't have to do much. I went to your website, chose my options from drop down menus, and uploaded the invoice from my vet. I thought it was going to be months before I heard back, but it was just a few days.
title: Convenient and Prompt

text:
PetsBest was phenomenal for our beloved dog Kiwi. Their customer service was efficient and friendly, live support gave us advice and peace of mind after hours, and their reimbursement process was simple and smooth. But most of all, having pet insurance meant anytime Kiwi got into mischief (8 plus times), or suffered life threatening emergencies (2), or needed a ligament repair in her old age, we didn’t have to hesitate. We could have those procedures, treatments, surgeries, and hospital stays for about 10% of the costs thanks to our 90% reimbursement elective. This enabled us to provide our pup Kiwi with the best medicinal care, and save her life when she was septic! 

We got a whole extra year with our elderly lady after that, and she got to enjoy one last cross country trip with us. 

We are thankful for PetsBest and I recommend them to all of my friends and family. As I have had two other pet insurance providers in the past, and they didn’t like to cover much and it was a stressful struggle. I didn’t have any of that stress with the team at Pets Best. 

Thank you from my family and Angel Kiwi for all your help over the years!
title: PetsBest was phenomenal for our beloved…

text: I owned my own Insurance and Financial Services Company for 30 years, and I have to say my first claim experience with Pet's Best was nothing but spectacular.  My two rescue kittens were spayed, neutered, and chipped, and the claim went through without a hitch.  All I had to do was scan and upload the itemized bill from the Vet.  I was stunned at how much I was reimbursed -- truly stunned.  I hope I never have to use Pet's Best Insurance for a major claim, but I feel reassured knowing how quickly and honestly they reimburse legitimate claims.  It is worth every penny I pay for my kitten's safety.
title: Opinion Of A 30 Year Insurance Agency Owner

text:
Pets Best is worst company for pet insurance
They increase the premium year after year even if you don't make any claim
But once you need it for a cancer related surgery, they give you run around.
They don't reimburse anything
title: Pets Best is worst company for pet…

text: We’ve had Pets Best pet insurance for about ten years. Submission of a claim is easy and the company keeps you posted on the claim’s status and/or progress. When I have filed a claim, they cover what they say they cover, and, at least so far, they haven’t given me the run around if I have a legitimate claim. Supporting documents from the vet are important to have when you submit, as the claim needs support. We’ve been through a cancer diagnosis and treatment for one of our furry family members and an illness with another and we’ve been very pleased with Pets Best and also quite relieved.
title: Very happy

text: Pets Best insurance has been a life saver for us. We have 2 English mastiffs that unfortunately needed to be treated for respiratory issues and pneumonia at the same time. Claims were easy to upload and taken care of in a timely manor.
title: Pets Best insurance has been a life…

text: You always expect dealing with insurance of any type to be a hassle, but I've been super happy with my experience with Pets Best. Everything that I expected to be covered under my chosen policy was covered, never had to fight over a claim, and they were all processed fairly quickly. When I had an issue with checks sending to an old address, didn't have to wait long to reach a real customer service rep, and she was super helpful. Also small detail here, but I remember when my Murphy passed I dreaded having to deal with a complicated cancellation process and worried about waiting for claims for the emergency vet to process in case cancelling affected those. However, Pets Best gathered from my claims that he had passed (even though I didn't have cremation covered, it was on that large ER invoice) and they automatically canceled for me and refunded me the pro-rated amount for the quarter I had already auto-payed. Small act, but it actually meant a lot to me to take something off my plate at that time. Will be happy to re-insure again with them when I adopt another pup!
title: Smooth, compassionate experience

text: Absolutely the WORST pet insurance. I've had the for at least 3 years. My dog had a linpoma spot checked at least 2 years ago. ONE SPOT. Last month he had SEVEN checked. Per his policy (even have a screenshot) a preexisting condition is within the last EIGHTEEN MONTHS!!! Not 2 years ago or the SIX other f*king spots should have been covered. I IMMEDIATELY CANCELLED AND WILL NEVER USE THEM AGAIN. ID RATHER PAY OUT OF POCKET THEN PAY A S*IT COMPANY PLUS MY VET!!!!!
title: Absolutely the WORST pet insurance

text: My claim was approved and completed in a timely manner
title: My claim was approved and completed in…

text: I have had this insurance for multiple pets over the years and I will be an advocate of Pet insurance and always have it now. Pets are our family, our fur babies. If I did not have this insurance I would have had to let our dog Maverick go due to the cost of his emergency. But, here we are over 3 years later and he is a strong and healthy dog!
title: Insure your pets like you do your children!

text: Pet’s Best insurance is AWFUL!! What they cover is peanuts! For example, they only pay $50 for an office visit. My vets office visits are $81 so that leaves $31 I have to pay out of pocket. So advertising that the pay 90% is an absolute false! Also, it takes them over a month to process a claim. After waiting all that time and paying the insurance premiums, they only paid $150 for my dogs teeth cleaning. I upgraded to the Wellness plan to have this covered. They didn’t pay the anesthesia or for his labs saying it was a preexisting condition. How can teeth cleaning be a preexisting condition?!? Please beware of this company and go elsewhere. I wish I did!
title: Buyer Beware

text: Refusal to accept veterinarian  letter that my dog is mixed breed though that was proof they asked for. OMG. They replied to this post by telling me to call their customer service # like I haven't already spent fruitless hours talking to them with no help.  Then today I get an email to dear pet parent asking for my name and policy #. As if this is a brand new issue with a brand new customer. I really see no alternative at this point other than to file a complaint with the Virginia insurance commission
title: Refusal to accept veterinarian  letter…

text: Raised our rate, aren’t covering vaccines or basic care like they did the first year. Things they aren’t covering isn’t going toward the deductible either. Processing claims takes forever and they do it out of order (maybe so they don’t have to reimburse you??) Looking for another insurance provider for our pet. Also the app is awful and glitches constantly. I can’t see our information at all now via the main screen. (Not even our dog’s name.)
title: Downhill experience! App glitches

text: Pets best has consistently been an incredibly reliable source of insurance for my pets the past 6-7 years. The claims are processed quickly and have absolutely saved me thousands of dollars over the years. I highly recommend pets best to anyone seeking an insurance plan for their pet. As long as I have pets, I will have pets best insurance.
title: Pets Best is literally the best

text: Their follow up communication is great and you always know where you are in the process.
title: Their follow up communication is great…

text: I have had a pets best policy for only a few months and when my sweet kitty needed surgery I tried to connect with them to make sure it was covered. I’ve tried chatting, leaving them email messages, and tried calling and have not once spoken to a real person for help. It is interfering with my ability to make big decisions about my animal that I care for. Very frustrating. I will keep trying, but I will be cancelling soon if I can’t speak to someone.
title: poor support

text: There is never a problem when submitting a claim.  Directions are clear; it takes very little time to complete the process.  Further, refunds are issued in a timely fashion and any explanatory information is easily accessible.  My husband and I are very pleased with design and workability of the website.  Thank you, Pets Best!
title: Accessibility and Use of Pets Best Website

text: Set up was easy and they were supportive. They want your business! I don’t think their platform is super customer friendly. Their chat service is often busy. If you end up calling for support they are kind but vague in what they can answer. It would be preferential to know what would be covered given a quote instead of having to submit a claim and see. Reimbursement has been pretty good so far based on the plan we selected.
title: Good not great

text: It took Pet's Best 2 months to settle my claims once my cat died.  And my 80% reimbursement rate turned out to actually only be about 58%, thanks to Pet's Best's "fuzzy math" system.  I may or may not purchase pet insurance once I get my next cat, but you can rest assured that I won't purchase that policy through Pet's Best.  Thanks for the "education" - let the buyer beware!
title: Avoid Pet's Best At All Costs!

text: I have had a wonderful experience with Pets Best. My Labrador has had TWO TPLO surgeries this year. Two major surgeries and I had zero problems being reimbursed. In both cases I was reimbursed within a couple of weeks.  Can’t recommend Pets Best enough.
title: I have had a wonderful experience with…

text: I’m so glad I insured my cat! It makes vet trips a lot less stressful for me knowing I have it! Whenever I do speak to a representative on the phone they are so kind and helpful. Only reason I’m not giving 5 stars because my monthly rate went up with no explanation:(
title: I’m so glad I insured my cat

text: After being a Pets Best customer for almost 10 years I have chosen to discontinue coverage of my two dogs and find another provider. This decision was made following the latest denial of coverage for expensive dental work one of my dogs required a few months ago. After paying years of the highest premiums for the best coverage, I consider the return for the cost of my coverage to be negligible.   My pets deserve the finest care and I try to provide that to them with grooming and healthcare. Your rulings & stipulations that determine coverage payments are unfair and inadequate. Now that your company has finally resolved the kinks you had when I first began using your pet insurance, it's a shame that you now operate, like so many other companies, for profit purposes only.
title: Buyer Beware!

text:
Insurance is only as good as their willingness to pay out -- and you never really know if they are going to pay out until after you sign up and make a claim.

I've now had to make two claims with Pets Best and in both cases, they paid out exactly what was promised. I wish their processing went a little faster (they sent an email apologizing for the time it took proactively) but once a claim was authorized, they paid via ACH fairly quickly. 

I picked them because they were the most competitive for a "higher value" policy (unlimited annual coverage, $500 deductible, 90% coverage over deductible, and small adder to cover diagnostic fees). I picked this because I can always downgrade coverage in the future (but you can never go the other way)

My only concern is I have no idea how much the renewal will cost; I'll find that out in 6 months or so.
title: Insurance is only as good as their willingness to pay out...

text: Increased premium astronomically for existing policies, but offered a new policy with the same exact coverages for cheaper. Existing conditions would not be covered under the new policy though. Such a scam. Terrible customer service.
title: Increased premium astronomically for…

text: Pets Best covered all eligible expenses exactly as described - and within the normal processing time - so a great job all around!
title: Pets Best As Advertised!

text: I am not sure what I would have done without pet insurance. I'm afraid I would have had to make some difficult choices. By paying claims promptly, my cat, Ditto, gets the care he needs. Thanks!
title: With PetsBest Insurance, My Cat Gets the Care He Needs

text: The fact that they paid me in a reasonable timeframe without hassle is all I needed from an insurance company. This no-nonsense, no-run-around experience is exactly how easy it should be when submitting a claim and waiting for reimbursement. Everything was as advertised with no surprises.
title: Simple, easy, as advertised.

text: Filing a claim is easy.  Uploading the documents is easy.  Getting the claim approved is quick.  What I should have done was put my bank info on the website.  It's there now but it would have saved time running to the bank to cash two claim checks.
title: Filing a claim is easy

text: Customer service is always great when we file a claim.  They are quick to process and respond if we have questions.

Customer service communicated their actions to me about reaching out to my vet’s office for supporting documents.  I received an email once the claim was processed with the amount I’m supposed to be reimbursed.  The whole process was easy and seamless

text: Great app and great insurance
title: Easy service

text: Pets Best is great! We (unfortunately) have needed them quite a bit this past year and they have always been quick and professional in handling our claims. Submitting claims is easy and seamless, which you need, when you have other things like a sick dog to worry about!

text: Pets Best really cares for our fur baby! They are very transparent with the policy and what is covered and honor it. It is very easy to submit a claim through their app. I will definitely recommend them and insure all my future pets with them :)
title: Pets Best really cares for our fur…

text: Very easy to file a claim and they are quick to respond with a payment. Never had insurance before but now we have two puppies on it and I'm glad we did it.
title: Very easy to file a claim and they are…

text: This is be best pet insurance group we could have possible asked for.  We had to put our little 4 year old puppy to sleep and every time I call the staff are the most sensitive and compassionate you could ever ask for. Not to mention the insurance company stands behind what they say!  They exceeded our expectation.
title: THE VERY BEST!!

text: Every claim I have submitted has been reimbursed within 2 weeks! Amazing 🤩 The App makes it very easy to submit the necessary paperwork to file the claim.
title: Every claim I have submitted has been…

text:
Pets Best has been my insurance for over 3 years now. I really like the ease of uploading claims/forms. I also like that there's an easily accessible app for your phone which saves your pet's information and veterinary information. 
But, their app is often down or not working and the claims take months or more to process. Also, there are a lot of medications or preventative supplements that are not covered and wellness items are limited every year. Additionally, their monthly costs do go up quite often and I can not switch companies since my dog is older and now has preexisting conditions. 

Overall, my experiences have been pleasant but there are a few things that could use minor improvements.
title: Reliable but Not Timely

text:
My experience with PetBest’s claim process for my puppy Cola’s wellness care was disappointing. Despite having an Essential Wellness policy, my claim for a Vetco package, Pup Shield Pro, did not cover services like rabies and other vaccinations, fecal exams, and microchipping, which should have been covered. The package was a cost-effective choice that should have benefited both parties. Under the EssentialWellness Endorsement of my policy, I pay premiums with the expectation that preventative care for Cola is covered. What I am requesting is entirely within the reasonable expectations of my policy's provisions and a standard request that should have been easily addressed. Instead, it led to a tedious back-and-forth with PetBest and Vetco, which was frustrating and concerning for the handling of potential future claims. I urge PetBest to consider this as constructive feedback for improving their customer service and claim process, reflecting the integrity and reliability policyholders expect. 

I just joined Pet Best on March 14 2024, a week later, I’m in the process of find a new pet insurance company. So if anyone has a recommendation, please let me know.
title: Unleashed Frustrations-My Experience with Peter Best

text: Unfortunately my puppy needed to go to the vet, but Pet's Best made it easy to make a claim by simply taking a picture of the vet bill with my phone and uploading it to the website. They reviewed the claim within a week and were already reimbursing me in that time period. I set up direct deposit, which made the reimbursement even easier.
title: Easy and efficient

text:
I’ve (unfortunately) had to submit multiple claims over the years for injured and/or sick dogs. Never once have I ever had any issues getting reimbursed appropriately. And I’ve had some bigger claims- including emergency surgery and cancer treatments. The claim submission process is extremely easy. The customer service reps are always kind and ready to help. I recommend Pets Best Insurance any time the topic comes up to family and friends, and will continue to do so. Thank you to Pets Best for allowing us to give our dogs the best care possible!

**Some things that people need to understand about pet insurance- pre existing conditions are a thing. Do not purchase this insurance (or any other pet insurance for that matter) AFTER a condition is diagnosed and expect to be reimbursed. That’s not how it works. Also, read the fine print and understand how your bill works. There are copays and premiums do increase every year based off of the plan you choose and the age of your dog (human insurance works the same way). In my experience the premiums increase about $50 per year, as the dog ages. And I stress- read the fine print! It’s pretty obvious that the people getting upset and leaving negative reviews about this company are ones who are not reading the fine print and allowing themselves the opportunity to understand their plan.
title: Honest and good company, we’re grateful to be their customers!

text: Customer service representative was patient and kind.  However, a 42% increase from $478.97 to $681.54--a $200+ increase in one year is outrageous for a 6 year old dog who has, until last year, had zero claims.  For the past 5 years, price increases have been minimal ($20-$50/yr).  If I could go to another insurance company with my dog's preexisting condition I would (hypothyroid).  This past year was the 1st year in 5 that I have even submitted anything and it was very minimal.  I get it--I get reimbursed approx $200 and I get an increase for the same amount.  The customer service rep said that my claims were not the cause of the increase.  I'm on multiple dog groups and I haven't heard anyone else having his/her rates increased.
title: 42% PRICE INCREASE in one year!!!

text: I have been with Pets Best for approx. 1 1/2 years insuring 1 dog.   We rescued a 9 year old Papillon and added the dog to the policy.    We did receive some medical records from the rescue group which contained, vaccinations,  blood work,  examinations, surgery for teeth and spaying and I had my vet's exam for the dog.  These records were uploaded.   I was concerned about future claims being denied for lack of complete medical records so I called customer service for clarification.   The response was less than reassuring,  they would have to wait to see a claim and then evaluate.  While I can understand this answer somewhat,  I said it is difficult for a pet owner to continue to pay premiums for perhaps years and then be denied a claim for lack of medical records.    I would like Pets Best to clarify their policy provisions for rescue dogs.   "Other than the canned response we have to wait to see a claim"
title: I have been with Pets Best for approx 1.5 years

text: I have loved Pets Best for a long time and recommended them to all my friends and family. They were super responsive both times my pet had major surgery and customer service had always been amazing. Unfortunately, I will no longer be recommending them to anyone. After 4 years of being with them they suddenly raised the insurance 56%. I asked for a breakdown so I could understand the changes and they refused to send me anything. They told me that it was based on previous claims, breed, age, and zipcode but wouldn't breakdown the exact numbers and reasons for a 56% increase. I have been a loyal customer, always paid on time, and have been marketing them for 4 years. They refuse to be transparent and I am really disappointed with them. I can understand an increase as my dog ages but, to refuse to be transparent on how they increase the cost is incredibly disheartening, unprofessional, and unethical. I would watch out with them. If I would have known I would have gone with another company. Looks like they are for keeping people around long enough to keep them hooked on existing conditions and funnel people into paying more because they know other insurance won't take pets that may have had surgery during the time you are under Pets Best. Just another greedy company. RESPONES to their reply: I have email proof that Pets Best claimed the increase was based on previous claims, on top of breed, age, and vet rates in the zip code. So your respones is inaccurate and misleading to people who are reading these reviews.
title: I have loved Pets Best for a long time…

text: I am glad after doing research for pet insurance companies I chose Pets Best.  I feel like the turnaround time for claims is quick.  I haven't had a claim denied.  Great company and very easy to submit a claim.
title: I am glad after doing research for pet…

text: We used Pets Best for the first time. The agent we spoke with was very helpful & knowledgeable. We submitted our claim & 1 week later we had a response & 2 weeks later we received our refund check. Excellent customer service 🐾
title: We used Pets Best for the first time

text: My cat got very sick and required emergency care and hospitalization. I had to send in the records from my vet a couple of times because they kept requesting them and saying they didn’t get them. Otherwise it was very much the service they advertised. I was reimbursed quickly once they finally received the records. Unfortunately my cat passed away at the end of the ordeal but I will continue to insure my dog with Pets Best.
title: Pretty good service

text: Extremely disappointed that this insurance will not cover required follow-up vaccinations for a puppy if administered by a tech vet. I just found this out and find it crazy that a Vet (at a higher cost) who administers the shots would be covered. I will be shopping other pet insurance companies to ensure this is not in the "small" print. Just ridiculous.
title: Beware of small print

text: I highly recommend Pets Best! They really came through for my family when we needed them the MOST! Our dog Callie, needed emergency surgery at 2.5 years old for IVDD. There was ZERO push back and ZERO reasons NOT to cover Callie’s surgery. Her surgery was 18k and another 5k in PT. We would have been financially ruined if it were NOT for Pets Best! I promote Pets Best at the animal hospital and at PT.
title: Pets Best saved us from Financial Ruin!

text: The company seems to care allot about their fur baby clients, and the pet parents. I do wish they could deposit my reimbursement, to my checking account, a little faster. My husband is in hospice, and my son is ill. My hands are so full. It would be one less worry for me, to be able to pay, Care Credit, for my little one's medical bills.
title: The company seems to care allot about…

text: Do not trust this insurance company!  They are dishonest and even manipulated the invoices from the Doctor claiming no coverage because Arianna passed away so claim is consider “ Post Mortem. “ They are taking your money and not paying claims we plan to file suit so they don’t don’t treat someone else the same way very dishonest company and we will expose them !!!
title: Do not trust this insurance company

text: Glad I chose Pets Best. The claim process is easy, payments are relatively prompt, and the service to talk with a vet or vet tech is extremely helpful. I had one situation where I questioned their refusing a claim and after further info from my vet the claim was paid. Great company! I strongly recommend.
title: Glad I chose Pets Best

text: The claim submission process was easy, basically just taking a picture of the vet bills. The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is because it took longer than I anticipated to process the claim...about 3-4 weeks. This may be because it was my first claim with them, not sure.
title: Easy Claim Process

text: I've been a customer of Pets Best for several years and enjoy the ease of being able to submit claims and haven't ever had much of an issue as all documentation submitted has been sufficient. Great customer service whenever I've called. The only area of improvement needs to be the speed of processing a claim as it has been, on average, about 21 days from the date of submission to receiving an outcome from the submission. Would highly recommend Pets Best!

text: Their coverage plans & prices are good. I like direct deposit, although it does take about a week before the money hits my account. Online filing of claims is easy & convenient. text:
For anyone out there who shares their life with a furry friend, you know the fear of unexpected vet bills. That's why I'm writing this glowing review for Pets Best Insurance. They've been an absolute lifesaver for my dog Zoe and me over the past two years.

Two years ago, my sweet Zoe started exhibiting signs of discomfort and having accidents. A trip to the vet confirmed our worst fears: bladder stones. The diagnosis was followed by a whirlwind of tests, consultations, and ultimately, surgery. Needless to say, the cost was daunting.

Thankfully, we had the foresight to enroll Zoe in a pet insurance plan with Pets Best Insurance. Their claims process was incredibly smooth and efficient. They reviewed the bills quickly, and I received reimbursement for a significant portion of Zoe's treatment within a few days of each submission.

This financial support was a game-changer. It allowed me to focus on Zoe's recovery without the added stress of worrying about the cost. I could genuinely prioritize her well-being, knowing a large part of the financial burden was covered.

Even beyond the financial support, Pets Best Insurance has been exceptional. Their customer service representatives are always friendly, helpful, and patient, answering any questions I have with care and understanding.

Zoe is now a happy and healthy dog, free from bladder stones. Thanks to Pets Best Insurance, I was able to give her the best possible care without facing financial hardship. I can't recommend them enough!
title: Zoe's Lifesaver: A Five-Star Review for Pets Best Health Insurance

text: I got pet insurance as soon as I got my dog - she has always been insured, but I never used it. There are a lot of pet insurance detractors out there who complain and say they are paying for something they never use. But here is the thing - you shouldn't want to use it! That means something is wrong! After years of never using my pet insurance, both of my pets got sick in 6 months and I was so grateful that I had pet insurance. I was able to make the decisions I needed to make for my pets without having to think about the financial part too much because I knew that I was covered. The Pets Best claims process is very easy - just upload your itemized bill and medical records. While it took a little longer to process the claims for my younger dog, I was reimbursed for thousands that I paid out of pocket for her healthcare. For my older dog, I received an explanation of benefits within days of submitting a claim and received the funds in my bank account within a week. I am very grateful to pets best and refer all of my friends and family. I will be a lifetime customer!

text:
The good:
Filing claims is easy
Reimbursement CAN be fast (some claims are filed and reimbursed within one credit card billing cycle) 
Customer service does not seem to be outsourced, are efficient, follow up with your questions, and are not pushy.
It's great to reduce costs when you have a young dog and an emergency situation arises.

The bad:
Fine print - your co-pay comes out BEFORE your deductible so you can end up paying more than anticipated.
Doesn't cover routine dental (other than the case scenario below)
Exam visits are only covered if you choose the higher cost plan/they are a-la-carte coverage 
Doesn't cover annual visits - you need a secondary wellness plan and it's not super cost effective unless you're getting spay/neuter (the spay neuter cost can apply to a dental cleaning but any dental cleaning I've had had been SIGNIFICANTLY higher than the $150 limit)
Wellness plan didn't cover the entire cost of yearly vaccines, and covers some things that aren't standard care/necessary so overall cost savings is marginal bc to use all your benefits you have to do "extra" screenings.
The cost for my older dog skyrocketed between age 7/8 (raised 40%) 


Overall:
It's a decent plan if you have a young dog and have an emergency situation or a lifestyle that is higher risk for sickness or accidents, and you're not good at saving money. (My 1.5y/o dog broke his leg and I was happy I had the insurance bc we just gave carte blanche to do what needed to be done to fix him. However any cost savings will be negated after holding insurance for two dogs for 2 years)
OR
 if you have an older dog where you're concerned about age-related illnesses and don't want to worry about cost of care for potential issues like kidney failure, cancer, etc. 
I would NOT recommend the wellness plan unless you're already interested in doing the full range of screenings/care covered and want a marginal cost reduction.
title: Good plan for catastrophic events marginal for healthy dogs

text: Typical insurance company, has you over the barrel and they take advantage. It has takeen over 60 days to receive refund for claim. Was informed that it was due to inflation, the price when up 49.9%. Then the customer service rep realized the new policy added was not permitted in the underwriting and removed the exam fees policy that was just added. This was the mistake of the previous customer care rep made but, regardless apparently it had to be removed. So if it is not allowed how was it added in the first place? Plus it ultimately increased the overall cost and increased my deductible. Then I spoke with a supervisor whos defense was "well I have a policy and just pay it so my pets are covered." Well Sir I am sure you get a substantial discount and did your policy go up 50%,.over $300 for one policy. I have had Pets Best since 2018 and I am definitely going to be searching elsewhere. I never filed a claim until this year 2023 and I wonder if that is another reason why my policy price went up so much. Be wary if you go to Pets Best, I am beyond frustrated and disappointed and thought I had a fair pet insurance. Seems not.

text:
I am a walking billboard for Pets Best!  as a matter of fact I have sent links to other fur parents in the waiting room of vet hospitals for Pets Best to encourage them to get insurance for their babies so they can get the best care for them without breaking the bank. 

I have had Pets Best insurance coverage for my Phoebe ( purebred Persian cat) since I got her at age 8 months. I did everything I could pre adoption to make sure she was healthy but since we have had her, we’ve had two medical incidents, the latest now chronic and I don’t know how we could have gotten through it without the fantastic coverage and experience with PB. 

I’ll detail the things that are difference makers for us:
1) Affordability - for the coverage we have ( includes breed specific underlying conditions, $250 deductible, $5,000 annual limit) the monthly premium is so reasonable and worth every penny ( we hit our annual limit last year) 
2) Easy no hassle process-  unlike human health insurance the claims submission process is sooooo easy. I just request all my providers to email me the receipt and paid invoice or I take a photo of my cat’s medicine container with the prescription receipt and just forward the email to the claims email along with our policy number. ( no email copy necessary) and they follow up with a confirmation of receipt and you can then look on the website to see the status. On the rare occasion that I had a question because a claim needed more info, I got a human on the phone immediately and they were instantly helpful and they clearly care about you and your pet. I have never had a legit claim disputed which I don’t take for granted. 
3) GREAT FAST coverage-  I didn’t buy the preventative plan but for EVERYTHING associated with the medical issues I have had ( excluding the explicitly stated items like deworming which I imagine is due to care and condition issues that are the owner’s responsibility) no hassles and the claims are processed quickly and i get the checks in a timely fashion 100% accurate which helps with my cash flow given the credit card due date for the payment. 

Be smart and do yourself and your fur babies a favor and give yourself peace if mind and look into getting insurance for your pet and definitely consider Pets Best. I am so grateful I did it. Good luck.

text:
Submitted a claim. My receipt from the vet showed the procedure information and was marked paid in full, $384, at time of service and stated $0 balance. Uploading etc went fine, the website wasn’t bad. But the insurance ended up useless. I feel like they weren’t even trying to read the document submitted and just rushing through denials.
I submitted the receipt and paperwork following all instructions on 11/14/23. I only tried to get reimbursed $70 of the $384 because of the deductible and some things weren’t likely going to be covered. Later I got a message that they denied reimbursing the $70 because the receipt wasn’t showing I paid it in full even though it clearly did. My vet was baffled why they weren’t accepting it. By the time I got the notice, could get back to the vet and get the receipt re-done on my time off from work, before I could resubmit it, they closed the claim on 12/06 and told me to restart the process if I wanted to try again. Now I’ve paid nearly $500 in premiums plus nearly $400 in vet bills, and never received any reimbursement, wasted my time, and wasted my vets time. Instead, someone recommended that I start a little savings account for future needs. Sent that premium to my own savings account each month and not deal with wasted time, paperwork, and unreasonable denials.
title: Never reimbursed. Canceled and started a savings account

text:
I purchased 3 policies for my two dogs and one cat. At the time of purchasing my cat's policy I decided to add a wellness plan since he would be getting neutered soon. It only made sense financially to opt in to the wellness plan if I were able to cancel it after his neuter procedure was complete. I was careful to research that I would be able to cancel the wellness plan before adding it to his policy, otherwise I wouldn't have purchased the wellness plan to begin with. My diligent online research confirmed that I would be able to cancel the wellness plan and keep the accident/illness insurance. 3 months later, after spending $1,400 to cover all three pets, I am unable to remove the wellness plan online so I call in. The customer service agent told me that they don't permit cancellation of the wellness plan until the policy renewal (1 year) which differs from the information I found on their website prior to purchasing the wellness plan. This situation leaves me in a predicament, as I am now obligated to continue paying $57 per month for a wellness plan that no longer serves its purpose. The reimbursement from Pets Best for the neuter procedure was minimal compared to the actual cost I paid the vet, making this experience feel like a significant financial burden and a disheartening waste of money.

I urge you to review and rectify this policy discrepancy to ensure that future customers are provided with accurate information before making crucial decisions about their insurance plans. Transparency and integrity in your policies are essential for building trust with your clientele.

I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and hope for a swift resolution to avoid any further inconvenience.
title: Can't cancel - not worth the money

text: I got Pet's Best for my 3 puppies in 2019. I had previously been with ASPCA Pet Health Insurance.  When I compared premiums and coverage, Pet's Best was better.  Unfortunately, I have had 3 puppies who have been sick.  One had a pancreatic abscess at 11 months and the Virginia Tech Vet School saved his life. Those bills totaled $11,000+ and Pet's Best paid 80% and paid it promptly.  My 2 litter mates have congenital joint issues and both have had CT scans, medicines and surgery.  Again, Pet's Best paid 80% promptly.  Additionally, they covered the rehab sessions and underwater treadmill therapy for both of them.  They continue to pay for Adequan, Librela and Arthramid injections to manage their pain.  Pet's Best IS the BEST!

The vet understood and said unless she has complications it can remain. text:
Allow me to distill my extensive grievances with your abysmal company into 5 key issues:

1) The spay wellness claim was erroneously closed, leading to an exhaustive struggle to elicit acknowledgment. Despite consistent weekly follow-ups, progress with your team remained elusive. Absurdly, it was rejected due to a supposed lack of 12 months of medical records – a baffling demand for a 7-month-old pet. Even after addressing the issue with a manager, it took over 40 days for the claim to be processed, with my insistence that the clock be measured from the original claim date of 10/20.

The medical claim, unjustly denied as a pre-existing condition, was, in reality, deemed non-existent. The absurdity of labeling a perfectly healthy state as "pre-existing" is confounding and calls into question the validity of your evaluation process.

The deplorable state of your customer service is undeniable. The automated chat and phone prompts are not only nauseating but also appear to be deliberate attempts to avoid direct communication. Online agents displayed rudeness, a lack of concern for my issues, and an eagerness to hasten the chat's conclusion. The canned responses of "please allow blah blah days" were not only insulting but also unhelpful. Even phone interactions, marginally better, still represent the worst customer service I've ever encountered. The only redeeming aspect was the acknowledgment and apology from the manager I eventually spoke to.

The inconsistency in claims processing time is unacceptable. The prompt payout of the first claim on 8/18 contrasts starkly with the swift denial of the second, while subsequent claims have languished for months without resolution.

The inadequacy of coverage and the exorbitant cost are glaring issues. Receiving a mere $150 reimbursement for a $500 wellness spay is ludicrous. Despite paying over $1,200 in premiums and medical bills for routine wellness and a single cleared medical concern, Pets Best has approved a meager $255 reimbursement, with $150 still pending. The savings of $20 compared to not using have the insurance at all hardly justifies the considerable time and frustration spent dealing with your subpar service.
title: Absolutely Abysmal Experience

text:
Before signing my dog up with Pets Best I did exhaustive research speaking with my vet and my homeopathic vet- both said Pets Best was the best. Then I compared other plans and the two top runners were Trupanion and Pets Best. 
I did an exhaustive line by line comparison with Trupanion and hands down Pets Best has the very best to offer. 
First, there is an annual deductible and then they pay 90%. Period!
Trupanion has a deductible for EACH ISSUE!! 
That is a rip off.

Anyway, Pets Best has been there for me through three dogs, they held my hand with my last dog that had an illness that eventually lead to his passing. 
Even then, Pets Best was there for me and covered the euthanasia and cremation.
I cannot say enough about Pets Best. Stop searching- you've found the best...Pets Best.
title: You can stop searching...You've found the best, Pets Best!!

title: Super easy and fast

text:
There are pet insurances out there that will actually be beneficial… this one isn’t it. To start off at the smallest complaint, you are never reimbursed in time. It consistently takes a couple months for me to hear back. 
Second, their math just isn’t mathing. I spent $600 at an emergency vet hospital and only got $293 back. Somehow the insurances math is to take a deductible AND copay for each individual treatment even tho it was at one vet apt. Let me explain better. My dog was attacked so he had to get wound one flushed, wound two flushed, wound three flushed, all three wounds looked at, two different medications, a shot and an examine. Instead of doing one copay for the visit the insurance charged me 10 co-pays and 10 deductibles. One copay and deductible per thing the vet did at the hospital. 
Thirdly, my dog received a laceration to the face because he accidentally cut his snout on a corner. Then he got attacked (above) which resulted in a laceration. Now his insurance won’t cover any other cuts/lacerations for 18 more months. 
Fourth, i rescued a second dog and immediately got him insurance as well. 48 hours later i was told that his insurance was active and i could start using it. Great. So we go to the vet for an all over exam and find out that he has a rare form of kidney disease in the very early stages. I did this 10 days after i was told his insurance was good to be used. Well the insurance company won’t cover anything to do with his kidney ever because it was diagnosed before 14 days after his insurance was activated. 
Fifth, three months into my second dogs insurance he got a slight tear to his acl. Pet insurance won’t cover any of it either because it happened before the 6th month mark. 

Plz get a different dog insurance.
title: GET A DIFFERENT PET INSURANCE

text: I wasn't expecting the preventative limits to be so low. Bordetella allowed is only $8. That's pretty low. The exam allowable limit is only $50. No one has exams for that. text: Pets Best is just that, the best. Ellie recently celebrated her fourth birthday. I figured it was time to invest in some insurance. I signed up for Pets Best. Two days after Ellie was fully insured a mass popped up over night.  I brought her to the vet and she was diagnosed with a mast cell tumor. I felt relieved that I had insurance but also very concerned because of the timing. After surgery, pathology, post-op wound, multiple rounds of sedatives, analgesics and antibiotic courses, Ellie has recovered from cancer! Her medical bills were in excess of $3,000. Pets Best approved all of her claims, no questions asked. This whole ordeal has been stressful but I never had to stress over financials because Pets Best had our backs. I got lucky with such a wonderful dog, a wonderful veterinary team, and a wonderful insurance company.

text: On September 24, we brought 1 of our dogs into an emergency Vet, after 3 days of not eating. While there, he vomited and had diarrhea..He spent 2 nights in their care, before we got the call telling us he needed to be transferred to a critical care Vet Hospital. We told them do what you have to do. We didn't want to lose our little guy. After spending 3 nights in the hospital, most of it touch and go, we got the phone call we were praying for! The Vet called and said  "I  have a brand new dog here!" I had told my husband, he needs a miracle,  and we got one! We love our dogs and would do anything for them,  however we are not wealthy people. Within a week and a half after submitting our little guy's bills and receipts, Pet's Best sent reimbursement per our deductible and payback percentage, minus very few medications that aren't covered. ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL COMPANY! Three years ago, after losing one of our long time pets after a heart valve problem, I decided to protect our furry family members, and give us some peace of mind. After alot of research, I decided Pet's Best was the one to go with. One main reason was they don't abandon them when they reach a certain age, like some companies do. Next I liked that you could choose your deductible and payback percentage, which gives you some control over your premiums. Their Customer Service is absolutely AMAZING!!!!
title: Pet's Best is truly the Best!!!

text:
Further to my recent (deliberately scathing) comments re. my two claims against my Pets Best dog insurance policy (policy active for the past six months);

The manager (with whom I remonstrated today and who shall remain nameless, at least fo now) signed-off our conversation by referring me to the Pets Best (Pets Worst ?) appeal process.
The document (emailed to me by this manager) is clearly written/designed to deter and frustrate any complainant/complaint.
It involves numerous steps that require significantly (onerous) time and effort on the part of the policy holder/ the veterinarian practice.
Coincidentally, we (the doggie parents) decided to try-out a pet insurance only because our prior vet retired and we were facing a possibly unknown veterinarian-related future. 
Pets Best insists on correspondence ONLY via their website portal....BUT, if you really want to talk to an agent (ALWAYS ask for/insist upon a manager), ignore the 'phone prompts and keep dialing "0" until you get through to an agent...then demand a manager...the 'phone agents are clueless and you'll never get a sensible answer !!!

text:
My pet has been with Pets Best since 2020, and if I could go back in time to choose a different insurance company, I would. Unfortunately for me, my pet has conditions now that would be considered "pre-existing" to other insurance companies, and therefore would not be covered. So I'm stuck.

Anyways, my main issues with Pet's Best are:
1) Historically speaking, their claim processing is so, so incredibly slow. The average wait time to hear back from a claim would be 3-5 weeks, with a strong likeliness towards the end of that range. 
2) They go through incredulous lengths to prevent you from meeting your deductible. What I mean by this is that they actually apply your co-pays BEFORE you meet your deductible. So let's say your deductible is $200 and your reimbursement is 70%, your plan covers your event and the bill is $175. You would think since that event is applicable, that $175 would be applied to the $200, leaving you with $25 left in your deductible. Simple, right? Nope. With Pet's Best, they will calculate your co-pays rates on that $175, as if your deductible was already met. So that $175 you thought was going towards your deductible is actually just $122.50 (70% (reimbursement rate * $175 (covered event) ). When I shopped around with other insurance companies, because I was dissatisfied with Pets Best, the reps I would talk to were actually surprised by this policy.

I give them two stars because they have decently competitive rates, and the claim process is easy.
title: Maybe best for pets, but not for their owners

text: They have most generally covered all of my claims even when many of those were expensive, and I can't fault them on that.  I rest assured that they will uphold the terms of their contract honorably.  They are however MUCH SLOWER in doing so now than they were 5 years ago.  Where claims were once processed in 5-10 days, customers now generally wait more than 5 weeks to get refunded for the money they paid the vet.  During a recession when budgets are tight, that extra time could cost a pet its life if bills come in one after the other and a pet is ill.  Five years ago when that happened, Pets Best was able to "expedite" bill processing in such an emergency situation, but it would seem that this is just no longer an option for them, and that is sad.
title: Trustworthy, but not Speedy Any Longer

- Continues to increase prices drastically with each renewal (double the price in 2 years, and double what a new policy would cost)
- Starts to deny multiple claims after one expensive claim, makes it impossible to dispute their denial even when it's invalid.
- Does not let you cancel your policy online, auto-renews your policy if you don't cancel it, forces you to call their support line to make changes.
- Ultimately a sunk cost, get a savings account instead and get interest on it instead of burning your money.

Full version:
I hope this information helps someone make an informed decision for their pet and their budget. 

When I started using pets best back in 2021 they were great, but in 2022 they upped the price from 90 to 115. That in itself would have been fine, but after one tooth extraction they started denying every claim I sent in for odd reasons. (example below because I hate long winded reviews -- despite writing a very long winded review) 

NOW, the policy is up for renewal for 2023 and has jumped up to 168 a month. This is more than double what it was when I started. I understand age-related risks, but the whole point is to get coverage early so that you can have security later in life yes? There's no loyalty to a long-term member or long-term coverage for elderly pets.

Ok so can I cancel this policy easily now that its doubled the original agreement? Of course not! No I have to call their support center-- super sus business practice, by the way!

You know what else is wild? I checked to see what the same exact coverage would be if I had a new account, and I was quoted $99.05/month. Much closer to my original quote, even though my cat is 2 years older than when I started. Do with that what you will.

So far I have spent $1833.47 in monthly premiums. Pets best has reimbursed $1247.56 (meaning from just a cost to cost comparison I've lost -$585.91) and I have paid $1178.05 in charges not covered (or wrongfully denied.)

(BONUS) Example of a wrongful denial: 
They claimed my cat getting stressed and not eating after I went out of town (thus needing IV fluids) was a "pre-existing condition" -- She had no pre-existing conditions by their contract's definition when we started, anyways. But that didn't change the result.

Edit: Attempted to use the live chat feature as suggested in pets best's reply. There are "too high of volume of chats" to connect with an agent -- this again, redirects you to calling their support line. (This option doesn't show on certain browsers, if you don't see it try firefox)

And, as they put it, "different underwriters" can cause you to pay double what other members are paying for the same coverage. Again, do with that what you will.
title: Get a savings account instead

text: Simple process and quick reimbursement.  Easy peasy!   If you care for your pets then having Pets Best is the only way to ensure their overall well being is covered.
title: Simple process and quick reimbursement

text: I received 7 emails, 4 telling me my claim was denied and 3 telling me it was approved for a small fraction of what we paid. It also took 2+ months to receive these confusing responses.
title: I received 7 emails

text: The time they took to reimburse is too long. And the premium increase of most 20% for the second year is unexpected. The coverage isn’t even that inclusive that they oftenly calculate each item individually and at the end of day it’s not 80%/90%/100% coverage at all.

Re: reply. Over 6 years my dogs insurance slowly went up 42%. Now, this coming year, it's going up 36% over last year. The increase over time has been okay, this year has just been way more than any other year, just about the same as my over all increase in the previous 5 renewals. This has nothing to do with each dog getting 
a small increase and everything to do with nearly doubling the costs since I got it.

They also are very strict about not covering pre-existing conditions. I am frustrated and worry it's a waste of my money.

text: Want to pay monthly premiums and not get covered when your pet needs healthcare? Like upholding your end of the deal and later realizing the company won’t fulfill theirs? Then this insurance is for you! My kitten developed eye redness after we purchased the insurance plan, and I went to the vet. The vet mentioned in the note that the cat had occasional sneezing (not the actual reason we went there, just as a side note). When it came to reimbursement, the claim was denied because the occasional sneezing was deemed as a “respiratory infection”, which, intern, was deemed a “chronic condition.” The cat had a history of upper respiratory infection prior to adoption, and hence they claimed it’s a pre-existing condition. I don’t know if the people reviewing the claims are smart fraudsters or just stupid, but as a physician, I can attest that it is not how URIs work. You are “allowed” to have them multiple times a year, it is not a “pre-existing” condition like cancer or diabetes; each episode, if spaced out in time, is a brand new instance. Furthermore, this has nothing to do with eye redness (conjunctivitis) for which the cat was treated for with ophthalmic antibiotic and had a corneal exam. Over a dozen hours were spent communicating with the insurance reps and countless neurons destroyed by the stupidity of their reasoning... Needless to say, I’m no longer their customer (they had the nerve sending me an invite to resume my membership; like yeah, why wouldn’t I!), and now I’m putting away the amount I would’ve paid for monthly premiums into a savings account, self-funding my pet emergency account, knowing that if I have an emergency, there will actually be money to cover my expenses.
title: Parody on insurance

text: Pets Best Insurance has literally saved my dogs life!  Without insurance, we would not have been able to afford all of the medical bills she has accumulated.  She is in the middle of chemotherapy for T-Cell Lymphoma and there is no way we would have been able to give her these treatments if we didn’t have insurance.  Thank you Pets Best for allowing us to have more time with our loved one!

text:
I am very happy with the coverage and ease of filing a claim. 

However, my premiums have now increased 45% on a 2 year old insurance policy for a dog that is less than 3. That’s pretty steep and a poor business practice, in my opinion. People will either cancel the policy or make more trips to the vet to justify the cost of coverage. 
The claim reimbursement is also now taking considerably longer than when I first took out the policy. Pretty typical, more money for less service. 

Not sure how much longer I’ll keep the policy. At a certain point you might as well just put what you’d pay in premiums, into a savings account to cover expenses and have your own insurance policy. At least that way if you don’t need treatment for your pet, you’re not throwing your money away.  I understand it’s a business that needs to make a profit, but a 45% increase in just 2 years is a bit absurd. 
If the upward trend in premium costs continue at this rate, I’ll most likely cancel the policy. If not, at this rate of increase, I could end up spending over $30K in premiums (not factoring in a $250 deductible and the co-pay) on a dog with a life expectancy of around 13 years. Quite the gamble.
title: Good coverage. Steep premium increases.

title: Petsbest is a SCAM!

text:
I called WhisperDocs, the after hours veterinary help line for Pet's Best, for my 4 y/o Cocker Spaniel and asked to speak with a veterinarian. I was told that I was speaking to a veterinary "nurse" and that NO VETERINARIAN TALKS TO CUSTOMERS ON THE 1-800 PHONE LINE!!! This vet "nurse" was unable to help me with my dog's issue but would not let me speak to a vet. They are in the building but will not come to the phone. PET'S BEST PET INSURANCE states on their website that they provide access to this helpline when you enroll your pet in their insurance and they further state that "A VETERINARIAN IS ALWAYS AVAILABLE TO SPEAK WITH YOU."  I called to express my concern to customer service & was told she would forward my concern to management. A couple weeks later, I received a voicemail from customer service stating that my issue was sent to upper management and because it is an upper management issue I will not be receiving a call back or any response. I should just know that my concern was relayed to the appropriate people. How can this pet insurer promise a benefit and then not make it available to paying pet insurance customers??? Isn't this fraudulent advertising??? Please help me get the message out. An "A" or "A+" rated business should not be promising benefits which they know they are not providing.  Not sure of exact date of experience with WhisperDocs, but it was within the past two months.   Gayle G. APRN, MSN, MBA
Addendum: After reading the reply from Pet's Best Pet Insurance, it is clear that they do not make a veterinarian available to you as a customer as they state they do on their website. If they did make a veterinarian available, you can bet they certainly would have said so given the opportunity. Beware!!!
title: No Vets at WhisperDocs!

text: Pets Best is truly the best.  We have had pugs in our lives for well over 30 years.  When we got our second pug we also got insurance. We love that we can pick our deductible and % back to meet our budget.  Pugs come with so many allergy, ear and other issues that we never want to be without insurance.  Pets Best makes it extremely easy to turn in claims and the turn around rate on receiving our % back is rather quick.  They are much better than most companies in that there is no limitation to the amount received during the year and many hereditary/congenital conditions are including when signing on your puppy at a very young age.  This is one of the best ways to assure they stay healthy.  I am constantly recommended them to everyone I know as well as all of my friends on social media.  They really are the best.  I hope that we have a very long relationship with them.  We are about to bring home another puppy soon and will be adding them to our current policy.  Also, just a note - their 24 hour chat/call in case you just need to ask a tech - the BEST - sometimes you just aren't sure if you need to go to the ER vet or if it can wait and these people are always there and truly a help.  Our ER vets are over an hour and half away so this has been a lifesaver at times with reassurance that we can wait until morning.  Thank you so much!!!

After several months that claim was finally paid. Now I am working on another claim which I am up to appeal number two. I wish that someone from your company would make a personal call to me so that I can go over the problems that you’re people, do not understand when I write my appeal. My dog does not have peritonitis, and she never did have peritonitis. The last statement that you sent me denied my claim with three pages written about peritonitis. My dogs problem was an infection in a tooth in her mouth that was cracked in half, which was infected and abscessed. The records show, on the x-rays, that the only problem was that one tooth. Why doesn’t someone take the time to either call me, or my veterinarian to explain, why this claim should be paid. While my dog was under anesthesia, I had her teeth cleaned. I did not expect to get paid for the cleaning of her teeth and the potion of time spent with anesthesia. This piece is separate and I do not want to get paid for it. However,  the extraction of the tooth and the medication that followed along with that portion of the time she was under anesthesia and the x-rays should be paid. I am fed up with all this back-and-forth with your company. My yearly insurance is over $800 a year please check my records  and help me to understand why your company provides such poor service.
title: Terrible customer service, tired of writing, appeals …

text: My dog, Shelby, had a rough come up. He was a rescue dog and is very nervous. We brought him to our vet the first day we took him home and the vet labeled him “aggressive”. Understandable, as he was nervous to many new things. We have taken him through extensive training and he has made enormous progress. It finally came the time to start regularly brining him to the vet for check ups and get him up to date on his medical records. After 2 vet exams I submitted my invoices over to pets best. First of all it took over a month to hear anything back about anything, 2nd of all, because of my first vet visit with him back in 2021 they deemed him with “pre existing conditions of aggression” and only reimbursed me <10% of my policy’s reimbursement plan. I had a 90% reimbursement plan and a 100% reimbursement plan. Untimely leaving me with a very sour taste in my mouth. If your beloved pet had any type of rough come up, anxiety, “aggression” or any other nervous reactions to a vet, they will not cover you. The reimbursement plan essentially paid for 2/3 of the payments I made to pets best for the 3 months I was with them making it a complete wash, but now leaving me with over $1000 in vet bills. Makes me feel my pet and I are just purely a number in their system and there are no real human to human interactions. All computerized and only looking out for their pockets.
title: 3 Month review

text:
My toy poodle is now two years and a half and we have been been with pets Best insurance since he was 8 weeks old…

Later on he ate a piece of wood and had to have an xray and followup with the ER (cost around 600$) and lastly he all of sudden started having blood in his poop and had to go to the ER for checkups and was put on some good amount of medication (cost around 500$).

After every incident I simply created a new claim on the pets best app (very simple to use and never failed me). 

I never needed to call anyone in pets best customer service ( I always got my money transferred into my bank account within two weeks of each incident) they where reliable and fast every time with no exceptions.

All I can say that I recommend this insurance for every pet owner to easy your way in dealing with accidents or illnesses you pup goes through.

We reviewed a lot of companies and Pets Best was so easy to understand. The benefits were explained well and it's connected to our auto insurance which is just another convienece. So far we feel very good about choosing them. 

The only reason it's not 5 stars is because sometimes the review and approval takes much longer than I expected. According to my friends with other companies, their wait time is significantly shorter. The first few claims took over a month. We have had a couple come back very quickly. I'm sure it depends on how many claims they have coming in but, based on everything I'd heard and read, I expected closer to 1-2 weeks for responses.

text:
I filed a claim electronically twice and sent the information by certified mail to the Pets Best. They  informed me many times the information that was sent  is illegible. The veterinarian had rewritten the invoices twice, and I still get emails saying the documents are illegible. I have spoken to many customer service representative and they basically tell me the same thing as the emails.
The company needs to fix their system.  Why can't a simple form be filled out by the veterinarian and sent to Best Pets, along with the other information they require? The invoices that are submitted, are clearly printed and have what services were provided. The SOAP notes of the doctor explain why the services were provided. Pets Best is asking for the invoices to be rewritten, not the SOAP notes done by the doctor.  Why do they ask for the doctor's SOAP notes if they are not reading them. If they were using the SOAP notes, the invoices would not have to be rewritten. This claim has been in process for several months. I had the same experience with my last claim. It's like pulling teeth trying to file a claim. Why have insurance if you have to jump through hoops to file a claim. I have been holding off submitting other claims until I resolve this issue. As of today, I need to have the veterinarian rewrite two of the invoices again.
If I could give a negative number of stars, I would
title: The Claim System Needs to be Fixed

text:
Excellent value with deductibles and co-pays that YOU determine at the time of enrollment. I've had this insurance for over two years now, and while the payments under my "wellness" policy rarely cover the charges of New York City vets, I have always appreciated their detailed, comprehensive explanations of benefits.

Filing a claim is extremely simple, basically requiring an email of the vet bill and proof of payment. These are immediately acknowledged, and although at the beginning the claims processing was longer than I would have expected, my more recent claims have been handled much faster. Once approved, payments are made by direct deposit.

I've never had any surprises, never felt that my policy was less than accurately described, never been disappointed with the company's service. I will continue to rely upon Pet's Best for the duration of my 2 year old rescue's (hopefully) healthy life.
title: Excellent Value with Multiple Options for Levels of Coverage

Do yourself a favor and find a reputable company, or better yet, put that money into a savings account and self-insure. These ppl are scammers!

text:
When I first brought my puppy home, I researched through a list of pet insurances-- you name it, I've likely researched and considered it. I settled on Pets Best after looking at the following personal criteria: 1) Cost, 2) Convenience, 3) Fineprint Restrictions, and 4) Value. Another factor was reviews just like this one, and whether people liked using it or not. 

Pet insurance depends on a lot of things, like location, pet type, breed, as well as the age of your pet, but of all of the insurances I looked at, Pets Best covered the most for my dog and the cost was reasonably competitive (at the time I researched it).

For my dog's most recent ER visit in June 2023, I was able to receive the PDF invoice and payment receipt from our provider and immediately use the app to submit a claim. The whole process took only like 5-10 minutes, and the turnaround is normally relatively quick of about 2-3 weeks, but this time around they had some backlog and a longer wait time, and they were transparent and communicated the delay through email.

Being out $1-2k from a pet ER visit is nerve-wracking for me, and a long wait time means that credit cards will charge interest on it. But so far, with Pets Best, I'm relatively happy with their speed of reviewing and approving claims. I've had instances where they approved partial claims-- but normally they're clear about why it's not fully reimbursed etc. As of this moment, I haven't found any issues with their process. I would definitely recommend doing your own due diligence on insurances, but I can wholeheartedly recommend Pets Best as one of your contenders.
title: Trustworthy, convenient, and painless where it counts

text: Whenever I submit a claim, I know that it will be processed fairly and I won’t have to push back on the outcome. Our dog just had to undergo a fairly expensive surgery after he ingested a foreign object, and it’s really comforting that we can be confident insurance will cover what we expect it to.
title: Fair Claim Processing

text:
I have had good experiences with this insurance company up until now. My dog recently had an intestinal blockage that needed surgery to remove. It’s coming up on a month since I filed the claim and all I have gotten is a sorry for the delay letter. When you call, it’s like they are reading from a script, they just keep repeating it takes 15 to 45 days to process claims and more complex claims take more time. I take that to mean the more we have to pay out the more time it takes. They need to keep their clients better informed throughout the claim process of any delays and why they are happening. 
Very disappointing this time.
title: Clam processing taking much longer

text: I got my puppy's insurance about six weeks before an obstruction surgery that ended up costing around $8000.  When I signed-up I opted for a high deductible ($1,000) , being terrified of a huge bill like the one I got. Two weeks before the incident I got an email from Pets Best that Tico, my pup, was now covered.  Friends were skeptical that I would be covered having gotten the insurance within a few months of the incident.  A few days ago I was immensely relieved to find out that PetsBest covered most of the bill, minus the deductible and a bunch of co-pays.  They sent a detailed itemized bill explaining what was covered and what wasn't.  They have other plans that would have coverd more of the costs but I can definitely say that I got the protection I was looking for and was treated professionally.  They also have a fantastic app.  I already sent an email to all my pet-owner friends recommending they get Pets Best pet insurance.
title: Pets Best came through

text: First time purchasing insurance for my dogs as I've had 3 dogs before, all lived to 15-16 years of age and never had any health issues. For the next 3, decided to get insurance esp. since vet costs/prices have been going up (it costs more to treat a dog than a human nowadays) and just never know. Did tons of research and PetsBest was one of the 3 best choice and went with PetsBest for all 3 puppies one after another as soon as I brought them home. For nearly 2 years each of them been doing well, healthy, active. Then one day 1 of my dogs stopped eating, then even drinking water, just laying there without much excitement, stuffy nose. Took 3 trips total to vet and animal emergency hospital to get her help. Finally on the mends after a week of so much heartbreak and worries and enormous amount of money we had to pay upfront. While many vet clinics do not accept PetsBest at the time of treatment and we had to prepay, what blew me away is the 4-6 days turnaround on claims processing. And I'm not talking about few hundred dollars but thousands that we had to expend on hospitalizations, meds, fluids, etc. Been stressed out already having to spend so much money out of pocket at once in such short period of time esp. given the hectic month we have with other things. PetsBest handling and processing the claims in such a timely manner really gave us a huge relief. Can't recommend everyone to get pet insurance and cannot go wrong with PetsBest.
title: Claims processing is absolutely A+
