text: Get any other insurance for your pet. Pets Best traps you by increasing your premium exponentially every year, regardless of how much you've paid into the policy already and you cannot switch to another provider if your pet has ever been diagnosed with anything. My dog's vet has said my dog has developed some "mild arthritis" that is actually very mild considering her age and their "underwriter" was quick to remind me that nothing associated with that would be covered in the future if I changed plans. I was quoted a significantly lower amount if I canceled my pre-paid insurance a month earlier and started out as a new customer starting out with a much older dog than I was just to renew my policy. When I questioned that, they assured me that nothing that had been previously even mentioned as a potential concern by my vet (she has no official diagnosis for anything) would be covered. Don't trap yourself with this terrible "insurance" it is a waste of money spent on high premiums every year with minimal reimbursements even after the deductible and at 90%. They say they pay for prescriptions but they don't pay for prescription diets. Their app is terrible, you cannot use it to submit a claim - it simply doesn't work, you have to go to their website. Also, the claims take double the time to process than they estimate, which is already far too long (up to 45 business days) especially when every other provider pays claims almost instantly and actually has functioning apps through which you can submit the claim. Don't make the same mistake I did. Get your pet decent insurance and do not get trapped by "Pet's Best." Good luck :)
title: Get any other insurance for your pet

text:
This company is a complete scam. Months and months of waiting and repeating a claim process over a simple ear infection for $240. They have made me jump through hoops and still will not complete the claim.  

List of excuses: The invoice can't be hand written, I have it redone, it doesn't have the proper "wording". We need all vet records from the time the pet was born, from every single place they've ever been! My pup is barely a year old. Oh, now we have to start a new claim because you gave us a new invoice. I Start a new claim. Now we don't have a valid address on file for you, we can't mail you anything, please update. It's all in my app and on my invoice! Then, all of the sudden all of the medical info from before they don't have.  Now they want full life history again.  

They've looked for every excuse not to process my claim. My dog has never been ill, never had a reason to go into the vet other than her vaccines.  This company is impossible. Not worth the hassle. Especially if you have a major issue and really need your funds back in a timely manner. Don't waste your time here.
title: This company is a complete scam

text:
What made my experience great is how easy it is to navigate the Pets Best Health Insurance site.  Pets Best was my first pet insurance experience, and quotes were affordable and easy to acquire.  Payment options are also available making getting insurance quick and simple.  

This company makes submitting and receiving claims easy.  Submitting a claim requires answering just a few questions, and there are a few options for receiving payment.  In addition, claims are put towards your deductible.  Customers are also given email updates when claims have been received, in process, and completed.  Lastly, payment is received in a timely manner.  

However, the best reason to purchase insurance with Pets Best is peace of mind.  After sixteen years, we lost our beloved Bella to congestive heart failure.  Losing a pet is the most devastating experience, but having insurance allowed us the peace of mind to make the best health care decisions for her knowing we would be covered regardless of the cost.  

In closing, I could not see my life without the joy of a dog.  When we are ready to add another member to our family, the first thing I will be doing is getting pet insurance from Pets Best.  They are simply "the best."
title: Great experience and company

text: Our eight year old dog recently needed emergency spinal surgery. Her treatment included a specialist and a 4 day hospital stay. Despite all the complexities, the claim process was quick and easy. Many thank yous!

text:
Our family typically has three dogs.  We're down to two right now, but I have learned over the years to ALWAYS have pet insurance.  Recently we switched from another company (H.P.) to "Pets Best."  I was concerned to switch because one of our dogs was 10 years old while the other was 1 year old and I was worried the cost would be exhorbitant for the older dog.  But it wasn't, so we did switch.  We've had this policy for about a year now, but never needed to submit anything.  Well this month we finally had to submit a claim on our older dog.  
Our older Australian Shep (now 11) had to have his gallbladder removed.  That is not a cheap surgery, but we would have done it even if we didn't have insurance.  This particular dog is a therapy dog at assisted living facilities, so he is an important part of our local community.  We did what it took to get him better.  And get better he did!  He is thriving now. So I finally submitted the claims that we had racked up and crossed my fingers to see if they would get paid.  And to my utter astonishment, they DID!!  We will get back about 80% of the monies we put in.  All I can say is that I'm telling ALLLLLLL of my friends about Pets Best.  Thank you!  Thank you!  Thank you!
Marie, Dave, Jack and Teddy
title: Great coverage for my older dog and my young pup

text:
Wow, I am so pleased with Pet's Best.  Our pup had a terrible accident while we were camping, and herniated a disk which left his hind legs paralyzed.  We ended up seeing 4 different vets and he had back/spine surgery.  It was very painful for him, and scary & stressful for all us. One thing I didn't have to stress about was making the decision whether or not to get surgery or treatment.  It was such a relief to be able to say yes to the needed treatment, and not be limited by financial resources.  Pet's Best has helped me with the process every step of the way, and paid out per promised.  We are now just about 6 weeks post-surgery, and with rehab (also covered!!), Jack is walking on his own now!  Not very steady yet, but he is getting a little better every day.  I am so grateful for Pet's Best, and will certainly spread the news. One of my friends has already subscribed.





One of my friends has already subscribed.

text: Upon denying my first ever claim as a customer, they again denied the appeal. Denying an appeal that had my own veterinarian state that the claim should not be denied. Further, they incorrectly stated that my dog had allergies and therefore a pre-existing condition. My dog has never been tested nor diagnosed with allergies, and the mere fact that you use documentation of my doctor "discussing the possibility of allergies" as diagnoses is absurd. Further, they use the diagnoses of Dermatopathy as a pre-exisiting condition and somehow try to link an ear infection to a previous issue of skin irritation on the stomach, two of which are completed unrelated, and I find it laughable that they can use such a umbrella diagnosis of dermatopathy as a pre-existing condition where you can then deny ANY AND ALL CLAIMS of a skin irritation. This is the most outrageous experience I have dealt with an insurance company before and I will be absolutely recommending any animal owners I know to look elsewhere if they are interested in pet health insurance. conveniently, the appeal process took just the right amount of time before my next premium payment was due, 71 days to be exact for an appeal for something as small as an ear infection, Scam.
title: Look elsewhere for your pet

text: There is zero reason why my claims should have ever been denied in the first place. I had to go through hell and have been put on financial strain because someone on your team changed her diagnosis from “unknown illness” to “intestinal parasites” when she was NOT hospitalized due to intestinal parasites. Your staff who decided their own diagnosis of my dog are not her vets, so there is no way they could make that determination. She was seen by specialists and they are the best vets in the field, so your team of technicians are no where near as qualified as the specialists are to diagnosis my dog against what the specialists diagnosed. The first agent I talked to on the phone after the denial was not helpful at all and even gave me incorrect information, delaying my appeal further. The next person I talked to was helpful and heard my concerns, said she would have a supervisor call me back or she would call me back to discuss my concerns but no one called me. Also, your company advertises “direct pay to vets” but it’s not direct pay. It’s reimbursement to a vet after a approval process which no vet would EVER agree to “maybe be paid” weeks after the bill was sent. That is false advertising, which is illegal and is a lawsuit waiting to happen. The ONLY reason I am giving 2 stars is because my appeal was approved. However, I shouldn’t have had to go through all of this. I selected this insurance company after hours of research, trusted you all to support me when I’d need it, and I’ve been faced with deceit and lies. I’m hoping things improve so I don’t have to change insurance plans, so I’m giving you all one more chance. I know I’m just one person out of thousands that you all have plans with, so me leaving doesn’t hurt your business but I hope you at least listen to these concerns and don’t do what you did to me to anyone else.
title: Denied my claim because they didn’t trust my specialist vets’ diagnosis

text:
I got this insurance in 2012 for my dog. My dog was healthy so I never get to use it for about 8/9 years. At the age of 10 she was diagnosed with heart failure disease, her plan max for "incident" ( this is what they call her illness) was only $2500 . 
When I called - they explained that my policy is old and doesn't exist any longer. I asked to change a plan, which has not available?! Only to cancel and get a new plan, which would make me a "new" customer whose dog's heart disease would be treated as an " existing condition". After 11 years of being with this insurance and now paying $270 a month - my dog's pills and cardiologist would not be covered. 
I wish I can leave 0 stars. If you plan to get a new plan with pets best, do yourself a favor and go somewhere else. I am canceling after 11 years. This is why we get insurance - to have it now when I need the most. Utterly disappointed that I have to pay out of pocket for this.

text:
READ ALL THE 1 STAR REVIEWS ON YELP, GOOGLE, AND BEWARE: This pet insurance agency gets you looped into a scam of a policy where if the same accident happens twice, they don't care and won't let you use your policy.

Their team also DISCOURAGES YOU TO APPEAL CLAIMS. When my ER Vet called Pets Best to send in a letter to supplement a claim appeal, the customer service agent directed for the vet to NOT APPEAL even though the same accident happened in a different situation. The fact that someone who works for Pets Best would try to sway a vet's right to appeal is so unethical and proves that their own staff knows this insurance agency doesn't authentically care about it's pets/owners and does not review each case based on individual circumstances. Once I voiced my discontent with this situation, I still waited 6 months to get an appeal answer (while still paying for a policy that I thought would later support me) and was still rejected.

I've complained about this malpractice of discouraging to appeal multiple times in calls with various agents and asked to speak to a supervisor and was then told to email the main customer service email. I asked to speak to a supervisor over the phone again and haven't heard anything in 4 days.

If you're looking for a pet insurance that genuinely cares and empathizes with their clients and makes you feel supported in stressful times of need, like receiving financial support from $5000 in ER bills, DO NOT select Pets Best. They'll take your money ($2,000 in my case) and not blink an eye when you actually need help.

I'm at the point where I just want a refund for wasting my hope and energy, considering I haven't received a single cent in support from my claims.
title: READ ALL THE 1 STAR REVIEWS ON YELP

text:
Rejected $650 claims because my cat vomited before

Petsbest insurance determined my cat's vomiting as a pre-existing condition.
One morning my cat vomited 3 times in a row, so we were worried and sent her to the vet. A month later, the Petsbest rejected $650 claims because they saw my cat vomit before the insurance registration date(from the medical record). If you are a cat owner, you know all cats occasionally vomit due to hairballs, stress, and diet change, which is very normal. Hence, be careful with Petsbest insurance. You are only qualified for it if your cat has never vomited before.
----please check the reply from Petsbest. They require your cat never vomited before/during the insurance activation period, which is BS. All the cats will vomit occasionally. In short, no cat is qualified for the Pestsbest insurance.

text:
Processing this claim took 3 attempts and 4 months. 2 denials due to our vet not providing the requested information, however they provided us with the confirmation from the fax they sent.
I had to physically go to the vet, have them print all the records, then screenshot all pages and submit on the site to get positive results.
If I hadn’t persevered, this would have never been possible. I’m sure many people would just give up, but I pay over $100 a month to cover our fur babies… and it honestly shouldn’t be this difficult, I mean there is no way to talk to a person, and email responses are canned responses that are 0% helpful.
Why is it necessary to supply all records (from the pets 1st visit to current) for every single claim?? Why can’t Pets Best just request the newest records, since they have had the previous records already submitted in the past? 
Not user friendly in any way shape or form!
title: Have to jump through hoops to get claims paid

text:
Their mistake but I am paying for it. I submitted a claim for a visit. In that visit I also paid for medication for a pre-existing condition unrelated to the visit. The representatives admitted the mistake and yet the claim was still denied. I have since had to appeal the claim and it is still
Not paid since 01/30/23 even though three separate representatives stated that I was correct and made the proper notation and my claim was to be covered excluding the medication.

text: The worst insurance company I’ve ever dealt with. I was with them for over a year and they were fine when taking the money out of my account every month, however after 9 months of paying I submitted my first invoice. It took almost 2 months for them to finally get back to me, probably thinking I was going to forget. After calling them a couple of times, they finally replied and denied my refund claiming check ups are not covered. Later, I submitted another invoice and that was rejected again after 2 months of waiting. How could my claims keep getting rejected when I had full coverage? I was paying almost $70 per month for the highest coverage (wellness and illness), why was I denied a small refund by saying I don’t have that covered? This is a complete scam. When I canceled my policy with them, the lady asked me the reason. After I explained to her, she agreed with me. Without saying much, she said “Yes, I understand”. I would honestly go with a different company.

text:
We ordered our policy on the phone and requested the highest level of coverage in 2016 when we got our pup. 
We requested the highest level of payment at 90/10 the lowest deductible at $100 and we requested unlimited coverage and ordered both wellness coverage and accident coverage. They explained that you could always lower coverage but never add on so we requested the best coverage for everything that they sold.  We were assured the monthly premiums would never be based on our claims but rather on the community costs for our location and they assured us 10% increase was the most they had ever had from year to year and sometimes it would go down rather than up depending on the community costs.  This sounds great but it didn't happen.  Our monthly premiums were raised so high each year as much as 35% increase in one calendar year, and they changed our coverage to 5K in error.  When we requested the phone records to prove our higher coverage they would say they were ordered yet they let one year after another pass without helping us.  We filed a better business bureau complaint but they didn't produce the original records and just denied.  They will price you out so that you basically have a savings program instead of insurance financial help.  Our 6 year old was at $137 per month even after we dropped wellness coverage. By the time your dog is 10 you can expect the fees to be so high you won't have coverage.  Our dog got Leukemia and they are paying only after fees and deductions around 2500 when the chemo and treatment will be 26K and stem cell 48K to 86K.  All of the patients at oncology are getting full coverage for their cancer dogs with their trupanion insurance and we are left to pay all the costs out of our pocket because Pets Best falsified our coverage.  We challenged their error in our records for years before the cancer diagnosis and now we will be in debt and asking for help thru go fund me. Don't let this happen to you. You can't change your insurance once your pet gets a diagnosis for any illness as it will be precluded for your new insurance.  Its imperative that you make the right decision from day one that you get your furbaby and I assure you Pets Best is not going to protect your pet.
title: Our lives are forever financially damaged from Pets Best

text:
I got my big dog coverage in August 2022, hoping to be proactive to big dog issues. On November 1, he was diagnosed with Addison's disease, after a bout of sickness that lasted about 2 weeks. I was denied all coverage because one of the symptoms was diarrhea, which he had a couple previous times in his life. (One during food change, another due to an allergy.) After almost a month over the 90 days they had to respond to my appeal, they denied me again. So now I've paid them 4 extra months of payments and I am not getting coverage. This is the WORST experience all around that I have ever had. Customer service is impossible. No one answers you. DO NOT GET PETSBEST. You're better off starting your animal a savings account because this company just takes your money and runs.

***I did appeal. It took 110+ days. As you kept charging me monthly. And since my dog had an allergy also, it’s NOT the same thing. His sensitive belly from food changes & allergies are NOT the same as his chronic condition.
title: Denying claims for no good reason.

title: My claims went in on 2/14 2023

text:
PetsBest Insurance is the worst pet company I’ve ever dealt with. They take forever to process a claim stating they are busy with an influx of claims. In my experience with the several claims I have filed, the lengthy time they take to review my claim is solely used to do their very best to collect any info that might disqualify my claim.
My initial claim sat for 3 weeks with no attention. I called several times and was told they had all the info to process my claim. On my final call regarding this particular claim, I was notified that no one has been working on my claim and after 3 weeks and still, no one had contacted my vet for medical records.
I filed a wellness claim that got incorrectly processed as an “illness” claim (twice) under which the services I received were not covered by my medical policy, but were covered almost entirely under my wellness plan (which is of course an additional monthly charge). I called PetsBest and emphasized it was a wellness claim and the claim AND vet records both reflected that fact. The agent helping me said he would make a note about the wellness claim to ensure it would be processed correctly. However, when I was eventually notified of the resolution of these two incorrectly processed claims (since they were YET AGAIN) processed as an illness instead of wellness I did not receive any reimbursement for the visit. Once again I had to resubmit the vet records clarifying that it is a wellness claim NOT an illness. For my wellness claim to be processed (3 months after the visit and original claim submission) the co then stated they needed an itemized bill of the wellness visit in order to process the claim correctly. When I called the vet to request this info the receptionist said she has never had an insurance company request something like that and she doesn’t understand why the insurance co is being so difficult.
My final claim was partially paid out but of course, all the money went back to PetsBest to be paid against my deductible.
I’ve spent over $480 on monthly insurance payments in the course of 3 months. In that time, I’ve spent over $1,000 in veterinary services that were almost all denied reimbursement for.
Using PetsBest insurance was a HUGE waste of time and money as the only payout they approved went to my deductible so that’s more money I wasted on for the insurance co to take forever just to do basically nothing.
Every agent I spoke to told me different info and they say they’ll call you and update you but no one ever does.
BUYER BEWARE!! Overpriced and underserved.
title: HUGE WASTE OF MONEY - Buyer Beware

text:
I adopted a new rescue in October 2022. We didn't make any claims until the following year. It's been about two months since the first claim, minor ear irritation and it still hasn't been paid. I received an email saying that the invoice isn't enough. It needs to be itemized and show that we paid (which it does). We've submitted about 8 claims now, and NOT one has even been processed yet. 

I'm amazed there are reviewers on here saying that they've had their claim turned around in a few days. I have a different insurance for my other dogs and we've never had a claim denied and the money is in my account in a few days. 

It's starting to feel like someone is just going through and marking "needs me info" when it's the same format I submit to my other insurance. I've even called in after submitting something and asked if that info is good enough. Got a "yes" two weeks ago, and the claim still isn't processed. I can't even tell you if they are good about paying claims because they are just sitting there or asking more info when they have it all. 

I seriously regret getting pets best. Our dog just had a $20,000 bill between 3 surgeries at 2 different hospitals and 2 weeks in ICU. Now it's going to be a pre-existing condition if we leave. But if they end up denying it, (if it ever gets processed) I might as well leave anyway. Stay away.
title: Probably a big mistake?

text:
3/21/23 - account management team: 
"Any condition for which a Veterinarian provided medical advice, the Pet received treatment for, or the pet displayed signs or symptoms consistent with the stated condition prior to the effective date of a policy or during any waiting period is considered pre-existing and excluded from coverage."
The waiting period for an illness is 14 days and 3 for an injury.  I saw the vet 12 days in.  The "stated condition" referred to above is conjunctivitis, and the vet did not note this condition or any symptoms associated with it but said "injury." This "condition" was arrived at entirely by the claims dept.
3/21/23 - was told when I contacted to discuss claim again that even with 100% of other decisions noted as errors made by initial reviewer by Pets Best themselves, decision classifying case as an illness and inserting a diagnosis not even suspected by vet would NOT be considered for even a review without an appeal. I was told a supervisor would contact me between 24-48 hours. 
UPDATED: My experience has been negative. I enrolled in Dec 2022 for 5 pets. I've received conflicting information about 3 seperate things related to the claims process. It doesn't seem the people processing claims are reading closely as they denied claims very clearly aligned with the wellness plan. My initial claim was made Jan 27th and included an injury item and wellness items from the same visit. Records were submitted and confirmed to be received in mid Feb.  It took 4 times to have the wellness plan items annotated and covered correctly despite being clearly itemized on my bill. The injury was classified as "illness - conjunctivitis", which is listed no where on the medical records. My vet used the word injury.
UPDATE:
Wellness plan claims: 
- Originally my claim denied entirely for $80 wellness exam, the $51 fecal testing and the $14 dewormer, the explanation being that those items were not covered.
- I reached out for a review.The exam was covered and other items ignored. 
- Third review added $6 of the dewormer saying that was the max and the fecal testing was overlooked again.  The wellness plan covers both in the amount of $20 and $50 respectively. 
- 4th review initiated by me covered all wellness items. 
Injury: 
- my kitten was taken in because it looked like he had injured his eye.  He had no symptoms that aligned with conjunctivitis. The vet suspected an injury (annotated on his record sent to pets best), but she performed a diagnostic test for $27 to rule out a cornea ulcer.  It was negative. I was sent home with no meds and the reassurance it would resolve in a day or so.  It did.  Pets Best denied the claim being it was inside the 14 day waiting period and classified it as an illness for conjunctivitis, which was listed NO WHERE on his chart.  I was told by two separate representatives that specifically my issue with it being classified as an illness was being looked at.  A week later, the claim is closed and nothing was addressed about his eye injury.  I contacted pets best and was told that wasn't the correct process, and I had to write an appeal that can take up to 90 days. I'm so angry by the constant misinformation and the clear lack of detail on the initial claims reviewer. The reviewer clearly did not look at the claim closely or the wellness items would not be denied more than once.  But now, I have to file an appeal which can take up to 90 days.  Even though the company sees the initial reviewer messed up 100% of the other items on the initial claim, they completely refuse to review all decisions made by the initial reviewer. They clearly do not care about quality control or customers in refusing to at least review it even with the blatant other mistakes, but put the work on the customer to file more paperwork. 
Moreover, this being annotated as an illness instead of an injury now classifies this as a preexisting condition and therefore anything that presents as conjunctivitis (which this did not) will never be covered.  I find it completely abhorrent a company would blatantly ignore language used by the vet - "likely injury" - in favor of words that the vet never used - "conjunctivitis" and "illness". If the vet suspected or noted conjunctivitis like symptoms, that would be written some where.  None of the symptoms listed for conjunctivitis were present. It's especially abhorrent for non-medical professionals to ignore language used by medical professionals and insert language of their own that would deny future benefits.   At best this gross oversight and should not require an appeal to review.  At worst this is a scam.  I am aware of how to contact pets best. I have had to 5 times. My claim is 5850082 should anyone want to do the right thing.
title: Predatory practices: Covered services denied/ vet language ignored and other language inserted to justify "preexisting condition"

text: My dog had an exam and xrays on Dec 27, 2022. I sent the paid invoice and a note telling Pets Best he needed surgery and it was scheduled. text:
Moving forward, this will be a company I will faithfully stick to and choose to ensure any future pet I adopt. 
I had to take my cat to the emergency vet in his procedure ended up costing close to $4000. It is extremely stressful when your pet is going through a medical emergency on top of the fees associated with getting them the necessary medical care they need.

Petsbest gave me a lot of peace of mind because of how easy, fast, the claims process was. I really didn’t even have to talk to anybody, I just uploaded my receipt and was reimbursed a little over a week and a half later. 

On the rare occasion I do talk to customer service personnel they are always very friendly and willing to help me as much as they can.

I think this is a phenomenal business to go through for pet insurance. You just have to be aware of what they do and don’t cover, the customer service representatives are always able to answer any questions I have.

I believe their prices are fair and generally have no complaints with this company, I would highly recommend anybody considering getting pet insurance.

text:
I have now filed my first two claims with Pets Best. They are for my new puppy, who is now eight months old. Pets Best has done nothing but give me the run around and request more and more records from my veterinarian to pay the puppy's vet bills. They continue to request more and more information from the veterinarian and me to determine whether the claims should be paid. Two claims over a 6-month period, and they have paid me not a dime. I have paid them for months. They have paid me not a single benefit. Nothing. My veterinarian now had to go through and rewrite and resubmit documents to their satisfaction.  Then, still nothing.  More Rejection.  More delay.  

I'm not paying a monthly premium for a hassle. And I did read somewhere that they are somehow connected to or financed by Synchrony Bank - an organization I have come to find has not always been on the up and up. I will drop Pets Best the first chance I get, probably today.

If you choose them, it's your choice.  But, you do it now, going in informed as to how they actually operate.
title: Could not be more *dissatisfied* with Pets Best

text: Im disabled and was talked into pet insurance by my vet. It took me years to realize what a waste pet insurance is. I have to pay up front, submit for reimbursement, pay the premium and deductible... even with a high apr on my credit card, i would have saved money without pet insurance, especially when they don't pay for things in the first place. I pay them 800 a year, i pay vet 300 a year, i pay 500 a year for medication and they reimburse me 200ish, due to deductible and not covered so i pay 1400 annual for my pet care versus 800. Pet insurance is a scam.
title: Disabled pet mom robbed by pet insurance

text:
2/28 Edit: they give the most  pitiful and laughable responses to critical reviews with legitimate concerns. Absolutely no company accountability about the error in their own UI and misleading information to their customers. Avoid this company like the plague - read the critical reviews and go elsewhere. I found way better insurance with better customer service and more comprehensive coverage with Lemonade. 

Pets best sucks their customer service is atrocious. 

I cancelled my policy on the app and removed my foster dog. They claim they didn’t receive it when I updated status for the dog to be not owned anymore and they made me pay for over two months of premium for  a dog that I did not have. The representative Alex on the phone was absolutely unhelpful she straight away said there was nothing she would do. 

They wouldn’t back date or refund my money, they absolutely could have made an accommodation for their terrible app and membership experience. 


I immediately asked her to cancel for my dog Athena and the foster dog that was adopted out end of October beginning Nov. Alex seriously needs to be given some coaching and training on actually being a better service professional. I am in support and service and I know more could have been done especially given that I have been a customer for a long time. All they care about is their money not about pet care or their own customers. If they actually cared they would have considered their own UI/UX error and made steps to correct. Instead their rep alex doubled down and said there was nothing to be done. 

Abhorrent experience. Will never recommend to any of my family friends or network for their pet insurance needs.

If you’re considering petsbest, go elsewhere. Read through the critical reviews here, and the laughable responses from the company. They legitimately do not care. 

I found way cheaper insurance with much more comprehensive coverage with another company within the hour after cancelling PetsBest. Never looking back.

text: Thought the idea of pet insurance was a great thing until we tried it and were paying hundreds of dollars per month for coverage.  Very little was actually covered.  We slowly dropped the coverage on multiple dogs and finally dropped the rest when a simple ear infection visit to the vet was not covered......it was considered a "pre-existing" condition since our dog had one a year ago.  How is that possibly a pre-existing condition???  The dog did not continue to have an ear infection for the entire year.  Ear infections come and go.  So PetsBest rep on the phone told us that any issue a dog has had in the past, whether a cold, illness, broken toenail.....is considered a pre-existing condition and is not covered for any instances in the future.  I would NOT RECOMMEND getting PetsBest pet insurance.

text:
This is the absolute worst insurance.   My dog's coverage began in November 2022.  In January 2023, I took her in for hair loss spots.  They gave her allergy pills to try; although, it wasn't confirmed that was the issue since she had no other symptoms.  Claim was denied due to being pre-existing.  I've NEVER taken her in for hair loss.    I took her in twice (back to back) at the end of January because she was extremely ill, throwing up and had flu-like symptoms.  Claim was denied due to being pre-existing.  The first visit of those two days was listed as allergies, also, when it was very clear she was in there due to being sick.   How is it possible for a gastrointestinal illness to be a pre-existing condition?    Needless to say, I will not be renewing this policy.  Big scam.  They take your money and deny claims.

UPDATE:  Because my dog had an ear swab for an ear infection prior to the policy, they denied her recent visit when they swabbed her ears to rule out an ear infection.  So they basically will attribute any type of sickness as pre-existing, even though it's an illness that can happen multiple times and is not related to any previous instances.  THIS COMPANY IS A TOTAL SCAM!!

I wish we could respond to their ridiculous answer, which shows that they are a scam, because any type of illness will always be considered pre-existing, even if it's the flu.   They are a SCAM.  They take your money and deny your claims.  And their "chat" doesn't work.  You sit there forever only to get it canceled and told to call in.
title: This is the absolute worst insurance

text:
My dog Annabelle and I have been with Petsbest for a few years now and it's been nothing short of a life saver. Anna didn't have health problems at the beginning but she was getting older and I wanted her to be covered and safe. 
She ended up having some health concerns a while after our coverage and we were at the vet pretty frequently. Every time I submitted a claim it came back approved. I've never once had an issue filing, and ive had some expensive visits. Going to the vet now isn't financially stressful anymore and I know I'll be covered. 
I have a policy that covers 90% and unlimited vet visits. I do pay a high monthly premium but Anna is worth it. Plus she's a bully breed so you pay based on breed.
There is usually a wait for claims as well. Sometimes it's a week and others take 3 weeks to a month for reimbursement. The high premium and wait time is worth it. 
One other thing, your dog should be in good health and you have a 6 month period for an illness to be covered. Its all on their website.
Highly recommend Petsbest insurance.

text:
Pets Best has been providing coverage for my 2 dogs, Tank and Speedy, for about 3 years. We are thankful we chose to enroll with Pets Best because soon after, both of our pets developed health issues that require ongoing medical care. Their website is convenient for viewing coverage details such as formulary medications and it is also a breeze to use. Submitting claims online or by using the Pets Best app is also quick and convenient. 
I was especially impressed by Pets Best's communication several years ago when I submitted a claim and they were experiencing some delays in processing all claims. Pets Best sent a letter to notify me that they were experiencing this temporary delay and gave me a timeframe I could expect for them to manage my claim. I appreciated their forward communication in an effort to circumvent my frustrations about the delays.

text:
We have been Pets Best customers/members for years and have four dogs insured with them.  Recently we submitted a Vet/Hospital claim for one of our dogs, and ever since we are just getting the runaround. I would not do business with them. This has been a horrible experience. It feels like they keep inventing new hoops to jump through hoping we get tired and give up. They have had no problem collecting our payment each month for years, but when we submitted a claim, we're having to battle. 

Here's what's happening: I submitted a claim for a hospital bill and a vet bill for the same problem for our dog, and ever since we have been getting the runaround. Meanwhile, we are out more than $2500. First, Pets Best denied the claims stating that they didn't receive the medical records, even though the Vet and hospital stated that they sent the records and provided email confirmations that they sent the records. 
That required us to take our time to have the Vet resend the records. That day, I confirmed with a Pet's Best rep that they received the records and had everything they needed. Weeks go by and I don't hear or receive any emails from Pets Best, so I call again, and I'm told they now need SOAP notes from the Vet. Of course, they never contacted me to mention this new request or let me know that they didn't receive the needed additional records from the vet. 
Today we are headed to the vet to request the SOAP notes are sent. I'm hoping there will be no new hoops and they will fulfill their end, but after what we have experienced, it doesn't look promising. 
All in all, find an insurance company that doesn't play games or makes you work to get your claim reimbursed!
title: Be prepared to jump through hoops

text:
I have been a client of Pets Best since 2019.  We had adopted a Great Pyrenees from a kill shelter down South and had him transported locally.  We have been very fortunate to have adopted a great dog...it clearly could have gone the other way.  

From the beginning we investigated various pet insurers and had narrowed it down to Truepanion (also a good firm) and Pets Best.  That said, we felt that Pets Best had the most comprehensive coverage at competitive prices.  Unfortunately, there weren't many reviews at the time and we wound up taking a chance that Pets Best would live up to their promises.  

Well, I have to say that we clearly made the right choice.  "Archer" needed to undergo MPL surgery this year and we were hit with a bill close to $6k.  I submitted the expenses and within 2-weeks had the reimbursement (less the copay) deposited directly in our account.  This insurance more than paid for itself by providing both peace of mind and outstanding coverage.  I've never had an issue with claim denial (even with smaller bills) and their customer service is top notch.  If you are seriously considering pet insurance my advice is take it, but go with a company you can trust.  I would highly recommend them and would encourage anyone to research them.  I noticed that there have been some negative reviews posted, and maybe there have been some situations with others that were less fortunate with their experience.  However, I can say first hand, we have had nothing but positive experiences during our 3-year arrangement with them and I have no reservations about renewing our policy year over year.
title: Honest and they always come through as promised...

text: Easy to use app and website. They cover what they say they cover. They never give you a hard time. I wish human insurance was this straightforward.
title: Easy to use app and website

text: I have had Pets best for over 10 years. They handle claims quickly with no nit picking about prices. I would highly recommend them.
title: I have had Pets best for over 10 years

text:
UPDATE: The company’s request that you call customer service for help with any voiced concerns is a BOGUS and generic copy/paste response. When I called the line, no one had any idea what I was talking about. 

My favorite thing about Pets Best is that they have a 24 hour line for medical concerns that is staffed by a vet tech. Otherwise, financially- What I have been reimbursed over the last four years has been far less than what I pay in premiums. It would be helpful if they made an effort to remind pet owners that certain exams or interventions are due at a specific time in order for any subsequent illness to be paid for (for example, you need to subject your pet to anesthetic dental cleaning starting at 3 yrs old even if their teeth are fine, because if something ends up happening afterwards then they won’t pay for it. This happened to me after my boy went from healthy teeth to plaque fast, and I was told by an agent that I now need to pay for costly dental cleaning on my own). The prescription formulary list is pretty small, medications are rarely reimbursed. You would fare better saving your monthly premium into an account to use for when you need routine pet care. Anything seriously costly after that can easily be paid back using a service like Care Credit. If you have a holistic pet store by you, their consultations are usually free with the purchase of the products to help your pet- do that replaces the vet line and comes from a healthier approach. Save your money.
title: Not worth the cost and uncaring

text: Pets Best has made a clearly unfair decision to my claim. First, it took more than 6 weeks for Pets Best to make a decision. Second, Pets Best based on incomplete information, and partial evidence to decline exams with reason of "pre-existing conditions". "Pre-existing" seems to be a super token for them to decline customers' claims for anything they don't want to cover. It's a gray area, so be careful of what you said to your doctor and make sure your doctor got it right to the medical records.  My dog has never been diagnosed with Urination Inconsistency prior my visit in November, 2022. It was only based on my own words mentioning that I noticed some urine dripping about a year ago, but it went away. There is no medical records to prove that my dog has urination incontinence prior my November visit. It's like if your dog had diarrhea a year ago, they would consider anything related to diarrhea is "pre-existing". Because of they determined my dog had "urination incontinence" as a pre-existing conditions, they don't even cover Urinalysis test. This is outrageous!! Urinalysis is a very common test to see if there's any infection and to seen any abnormal chemicals/ bacteria in the urine. Just based on my own words of "dripping urine", they rejected to pay for the urinalysis for rest of my dog's life!! If my words can be used as a diagnose result, I can be a doctor too. I am not a doctor, why they used my mentioning some symptoms I noticed a year ago as a medical condition.  Plus, Pets Best is very dishonest on calculating the payment amount. According to the policy, after customer has fulfilled the deductible, co-pay should be calculated by multiplying anything after the deductible by the percentage of customer's responsibility based on the plan you buy. However, Pets Best used the whole amount (including the original deductible portion) to calculate the co-pay amount that I owe. I called the customer service, they just said they are complied the underwriting rules.  I need to see the documentation, not anything Pets Best said is a rule.  Be aware of this insurance company! Very dishonest and sneaky. They will find any loopholes of not paying.
title: Absolute dishonest insurance company

text: We got Pets Best almost 3 years ago after my senior dog had a battle against pancreatitis. It cost us about $8000 to save his life. Originally when we got our dogs, dog insurance was unavailable or not very good so we did not opt in and figured in their older age, insurance companies would either charge crazy premiums or not accept them or not cover very much. After that scare with our dog's pancreatitis, we decided we'd try getting an insurance for our two senior dogs. Many insurance companies would either not cover them or charged an exorbitant amount or only cover 50-60% of the bill. Pet's best accepted our 10 year old seniors at 80% repayment at a decent monthly payment, $500 deductible, while covering an unlimited amount of costs. We decided to accept their quote and here we are three years later. We will stay with them until our dogs pass. Our senior dogs have had all of their ear infections covered, all of their eye conditions covered, including a surgery to remove a bothersome chalazion and cataract removal from both eyes. This totaled over $10,000 and they covered all of it. This insurance was completely worth it to us. The people at Pets Best are kind and respectful, work with you on appealing decisions, and get the claims processed in a decent timeframe. We are extremely satisfied with the service and highly recommend any other first time senior dogs insurers to sign up here.
title: Best Insurance for Senior Dogs

text: As others wrote below, If I could give 0 stars i would. Filed a claim on 8/11/2022, claim denied, appealed on 9/20/2022 and won appeal. Got notice that check was cut on 10/13/2022. Called on 10/26/2022 to verify when check was actually mailed. I was told that the check was mailed on 10/13/2022. Waited until 11/4/2022 and called again. Had check cancelled and switched to ACH. I was told that it would be 3-5 days to receive. I received a phone call on 11/9/2022 to verify my mailing address(I don't understand why address needed to be verified for ACH). I received the check during this time. Check was actually issued on 10/27/2022 not 10/13/2022 as I was told. Called back the week of Thanksgiving and was told that I had to wait 21 days not the 3-5 days that I was told when I called back on 12/2/2022 and was not that it was not 21 calendar days, but 21 business days and I would have to take into account of the Thanksgiving holidays. Today is 12/12/2022, still no payment. I called again today. Was on hold for over 20 minutes and then got hung up on when they were checking on payment. I was told that their accounting department was looking into it. So still nothing original claim was submitted 8/11/2022 and 4 months later NOTHING. No answer about when i would receive the payment. No answer when or if they would call me back. NOTHING. Just stall tactics. People pay good money to protect their children with fur and then companies like Pets Best try to screw you over.

title: Scam of a plan

text:
I was in the market for pet insurance for my 3 cats. After careful consideration and extensive research, I decided to go with Pets Best because of what their coverage included and their competitive prices. 

For all 3 of them, I went with an Annual Deductible of $100, an unlimited annual limit, and a reimbursement level of 90%. I pay $90 total a month for this insurance.

A month after purchasing this insurance I had to take one of my cats to the emergency room, he was going to the litter box constantly and couldn't urinate at all. For those unaware, this can be a serious matter which can lead to the death of your little feline within 48 hours if there is a blockage within their urethra. 

The emergency vet clinic performed the following services for my cat:

A Urinalysis, Culture and MIC: $308
Renal (BUN/CRE/PHOS) Panel-Catalyst: $129
Lyte 4, Lytes:  $74
Buprenorphine 0.5mg/ml: $28
Gabapentin 50mg Tiny Tabs: $80
Emergency Visit: $175
Tube check X-Ray: $176 
Hills C/D FelineCanned Food: $11
UrineCollection (Cystocentesis/Catheterization): $54

Total: $1038

After all his testing my cat had a clean bill of health but they did find some crystals forming within his urethra which was the reason why he kept trying to urinate, we were prescribed some pain-killer medicine and a special food diet that would assist in destroying any remaining crystals. A couple of days after, he returned to normal and no longer had to use the litterbox every 10 minutes. We continued this treatment for 2 weeks and he's 100% back to normal. 

[A word of advice for all cat owners reading this, make sure your cats are getting enough water! A lack of water is a huge reason why crystals form in their urethra, especially neutered tom-cats. Cats mostly get their water intake from food and rarely use the fountains they're provided. We now add an extra tablespoon of water to all their meals whether it's dry or wet, this will insure good kidney health and prevent any urinary issues in the future.]

After the clinic visit, I immediately submitted a claim to Pets Best via their app. I submitted the invoice and emailed them the information about the main vet I go to for my cats. From there they began a review of my claim. 

Within 4 weeks I was notified my claim was reviewed and I was able to see the explanation of what was approved and what wasn't (if any) in detail. 

[The new prices indicated are what was paid out to me because of my insurance plan]

A Urinalysis, Culture and MIC: $177 
Renal (BUN/CRE/PHOS) Panel-Catalyst: $116
Lyte 4, Lytes:  $67
Buprenorphine 0.5mg/ml: $25
Gabapentin 50mg Tiny Tabs: $72
Emergency Visit: $157
Tube check X-Ray: $158
Hills C/D FelineCanned Food: $0 (Not covered due to Prescription diets not being covered by the plan)
UrineCollection (Cystocentesis/Catheterization): $49

Total reimbursement to me: $824

Deductible: $100
Copay: $102
Not covered: $11
Original Total Bill: $1038
New Total Bill with Pets Best insurance: $214


I am very pleased that Pets Best worked and kept everything they promised. I know this review may seem a bit lengthy but I only do it to make sure people know what it is they're getting into. There have been some reviewers who have left negative reviews because they didn't fully understand the policy they purchased so they assume it's a "scam". I suggest anyone who is in the market for any kind of insurance to carefully read what is offered and what is not offered so that they know what to expect when they need to use their insurance for themselves or their little furry pet.

If you're reading this and wondering if you should even get pet insurance; consider the following: Would you rather have insurance and not need it, or would you rather not have insurance and need it? Our pets are our family. We should treat them like it and give them the best quality of life that we possibly can. They will always love us unconditionally.
title: The right insurance for your pet!

text: This is a long one…So I purchased my English golden retriever in May 2022. Three days before I took possession of her I decided I would be a responsible pet owner and purchase insurance for her. I decided to go through my car/home insurance (Progressive) which worked with Pets Best. They seemed to have good reviews and I could just add it to my other insurances. I began my policy 3 days before bringing my dog home. Once she was home, it seemed she may have a UTI. I took her to the vet where she was treated for this UTI and she was also referred to Purdue Animal Hospital because the vet thought there MIGHT be something else going on. She did NOT diagnosis her with anything more than a UTI. When I submitted the claim for the UTI it was denied because it was within the first 14 days of the policy start date. Annoying, but fine. Then over a month later (way past the first 14 days) we took her to Purdue Animal Hospital where they diagnosed her with 2 ectopic ureters. She would need surgery which was scheduled for July 5, 2022. 2 MONTHS after I started my Pets Best policy. Now, my husband and myself were not aware of any of these issues when purchasing her. The ONLY thing we were made aware of was that she had an inverted vulva, that was genetic. But all her other issues were just thrown at us by the different vets we took her to. She had her surgery, I submitted the $1300 claim and it was denied for it being a “preexisting condition.” When I contacted them the lady I spoke to seemed annoyed and just said “l’ll email you a dispute form, but it will take at least 90 days to process.” This was obviously discouraging because their regular claims process takes weeks to get completed anyway. As we continued to rack up our credit cards with vet visits to try to get our sweet girl healthy, every single claim was denied. We spent over $4,000 in vet bills on a pure bred English Cream Golden, who for all we knew, had an inverted vulva that would pop itself out in 1-2 heat cycles. Plus we spent our monthly premium to pets best for literally nothing. Oh and the cherry on top. I had one last claim being finished when I already cancelled my policy. Just got the notification that it was completed today. They applied that claim to my $500 deductible!! What!? pretty sure the $4000 we have paid is well over that $500 deductible. DO NOT GET THIS PET INSURANCE. They will do nothing to help and they take forever to process anything.
title: Don’t waste your time.

text:
If I could give them zero stars I would!  I have had my dog covered by Pets best for about 3 years.  Never had any real issues until recently when I found out my dog had a heart murmur & needed an echocardiogram. I sent in so much documentation as did my Vet (who has been my vet for 20+yrs). Closed my claims because I didn’t have the correct info which was complete BS - said they could not read the payment.  Kept waiting for payment & after 7 weeks told me it needs to be paid in full before they can process it.  Why not tell me that the 6 other times I called & spoke to someone or the 10 emails I sent.   I just had my 4th breast cancer surgery so have not been able to work & told them that things were really tight & I needed them to reimburse me what should be about $1500 & keep getting a different answer.  Its in the queue for payment- - its being reviewed for payment- today I get its going to be made a decision on in the next 24-48 hours - WHAT?!!!!  its been 10 weeks now & here is the kicker - you only have 90 days to deal with your claim & then its closed for good!  Its an absolute scam!  I will be contacting every vet I know with a detailed letter letting them know what is happening along with a printout of the complaints on this website so they can be aware NOT TO EVER SUGGEST THEM!  I will also be contacting my attorney as well as the ASPCA & my attorney general.  This is absolutely not ok.  I am about to be evicted because they won’t pay a claim that has been valid & I have never been late with my premium which was $148 a month up until 3 months ago right before I knew about the heart condition - I had to lower the coverage because of my health situation & my financial crisis.  They are incompetent & full of one excuse after another.  They should be closely investigated & I will be starting the lead on finding out more to prove I am correct with my documentation & proof.  I am EXTREMELY detailed & I recorded all of the calls as well!  Also after going to the Consumer Credit website & seeing all of the other terrible reviews especially having to deal with other echocardiogram patients I realize I am not alone which just makes me sick to my stomach.  I’m already struggling with my cancer & now have the stress of their shenanigans & my son(dog) also having heart issues is really just despicable! 
SHAME ON THEM!
title: If I could give them zero stars I…

text: I am a very unhappy customer whose stuck in a bad situation. I switched from another company to PetsBest; little did I know that a vet dermatologist said our dog MAY have a luxating patella. When surgery was required about 1 year later, I was told that this was now a PRE-EXISTING CONDITION. So…my dog had surgery, I’m out $2500 and they won’t cover it. I will never be a happy customer. I’m a stuck one because if I change to another company, I end up starting the pre existing clock again. I’m frustrated and feel cheated. Would I get PetsBest again? I don’t think so. One additional point after hearing PetsBest reply: I had a previous policy prior to this one and had gone through the torment of “pre existing condition” with our dog and had a very lengthy conversation when I took this policy to try to avoid a repeat. I feel I was misled because I couldn’t have been any clearer. I get an “I’m  sorry the person didn’t provide correct or complete information.” But this doesn’t get me reimbursement for the $3000 medical bill. I’ve appealed it and got the same denial. It’s not right.

text: The cost of medical care in the last two years of my sweet dog's life was around $10,000. When I brought home my new baby, I decided that it could make sense to purchase health care coverage for him to offset the big expenses that can occur throughout his life. I knew my baby would grow to around 3.5 pounds, so accidents can happen when they are so tiny. I purchased a Pets Best policy after reviewing it very carefully. Well, my baby was playing one day and his kneecap dislocated. This required an ER visit, and ultimately surgery. I found a board certified orthopedic surgeon and trusted his recommendation. He had a successful surgery. Based on a few negative reviews, I wasn't sure that PB would reimburse me as per the agreement, but they absolutely did. Staff were VERY nice to speak with, seemed concerned about my dog, and they processed my claim in 2-3 weeks which I consider timely. The EOB was easy to understand and consistent with the policy I purchased. It's VERY important that you review the details of your policy so you know exactly what you are purchasing. This avoids any disappointment when you do have a claim. You must understand the deductible, the co-pay, and any excluded expenses.

text: Beware that you can take your pet to the only specialist (a soft tissue specialist) that can tell if your pet actually has Brachycephalic Syndrome and they decide that's not good enough proof to justify paying a claim that is supposed to be covered. The soft tissue specialist has to check your pet under sedation so instead of wasting my time with a general vet who does not have the training or the correct equipment, as my dog is high risk to be under sedation, I took my pet to a specialist that also had an ICU just in case my dog reacted badly to anesthesia. They decided not to cover it even though the soft tissue specialist found that the surgery was needed and proceeded to fix the problem, because it was not recommended by my general vet who I see only for vaccines and accidents. Why pay or take the time to go to an unnecessary appointment for them just to refer me to the specialist I took him to? Well if I knew it was the only way they would actually cover what they were supposed to I would have. When speaking to the representative she said it should have been covered but her hands were tied because it was denied. She said I could appeal but that was a long shot.

text: I have never in my life had an experience with a company SO FRUSTRATING and ABSURD. Ill start by saying that every single claim we filed got turned down, no matter the content, until I called and complained, at which point they’d admit their fault and change it. The final straw was my most recent claim, which took over two months to process because they kept sending me the same automated email (4 times) asking for “more information” on the pet’s medical history, despite the fact that from the very first email I told them there was none since she was adopted within a year. By the time I got the fourth email and called customer service (again) to explain, the woman filed a complaint on my behalf because even she didn’t understand why they wouldn’t stop asking me the same question. Today they finally finished processing my claim - meant to cover treatment for allergies, which is something they SAY they cover under illness on their website - and told us that it was a “preexisting condition”, because when we adopted her she had allergies too. I can’t stress enough that this company has no desire to help you, only itself. Find insurance elsewhere, trust me. It isn’t worth the stress.

text:
Pet's Best is the absolute scam of any insurance. I am calling the BBB, the California Insurance Board and anyother place I can urge people not to do anything with this company. 
They buy their reviews, I have a 10yr dogson he hasn't been to the vet since the pandemic went into this awesome vet that my friends recommended this was just an initial wellness check up, met the vet get blood drawn see what shots he needs etc. While there Vet listened to his heart and said it sounds like he has a heart murmur, he needs xrays and blood later we will need an ecogram (650.) left there with blood work, xrays everything was actually really good. I spent 650 dollars for that mind you I'm thinking they will reimburse (from what the reviews say) 80% within a week. FIrst it took 45 days of which I paid Pet's Best 100. a month for 3 months already, my deductible is 500. lol which is a joke. Everytime I called up there were countless excuses they even used the hurricane as an excuse told me they called me vet and they never got them the paperwork (yes they did) I even got them the paperwork personally along with the x ray which showed my dogs heart was good. Last night I received an email saying they were going to reimburse me 8.00 lol cancelled the policy immediately, refused to returned my 300. I paid for nothing. Also just to note they used VET TECH's to determine your claim not Veterinarians DO NOT USE THEM.
title: Pet's Best Buys Their Reviews

text:
Read the fine print!
I've been a customer for years and when I finally needed insurance to help, I was left on the hook.
I took the cat for her annual checkup and dentistry appointment, unfortunately she needed an extraction. I thought I was going to be fine as insurance should have covered it. But, as stated in PetsBest's policy: "your Pet's teeth must have been cleaned and examined under general anesthesia by a Veterinarian in the thirteen months before the date of service for the Periodontal Disease claim". Her last examination & cleaning under anesthesia was 14 months prior thus my claim wasn't covered. I barely missed the window by just a bit and now I'm left on the hook for the ENTIRE bill. What a shame, unless you're putting your pet under anesthesia on a yearly basis (not a great idea if you've an aging pet), it's very possible that you'll miss the window to file claims as well. It feels almost unreasonable that they set these strict criteria for coverage. I did find the process to submit a claim rather easy though, so I'll give them that. 1.5 stars
---------

In regard to your reply,
Thank you for responding. However, this boiler-plate response is representative of my qualms with the company policies. My pet was indeed free of any signs of Periodontal Disease prior to the Policy Effective Date and waiting Period. And since the age of three, my pet's teeth have been cleaned and examined under general anesthesia by a veterinarian routinely. However, this last date of service for the Periodontal Disease claim where an extraction was necessary was 14 months ago and thus missed the mark just barely. I feel that your policy of 13 months is set to give minimal leeway to patients and deliberately absolves you of your responsibility.
title: Read the fine print!

text:
I bought the premium insurance that covers approximately 90% with a $200 deductible as well as wellness. Approximately two months ago, I submitted a claim for an allergic dermatitis. My vet gave a steroid as well as some antibiotics, which came out to approximately $200 and a referral to another dermatologist for further evaluation. The dermatologist proceeded to prescribe two medications and two shampoos in order to treat the condition and the bill was approximately $700.  It took approximately three months for a decision, and I was denied on all parts because either it wasn’t covered or there was more medical records that were needed. During this process, I have called the help center multiple times, and I always get the runaround or broken promises on follow ups. For example, the service desk said that they would give me a call for updates, which never happened, and that they would follow up with my vet, which they never did. I have uploaded the medical records from the vet, but they say that these particular records did not provide enough information. For contrast with a different pet insurance, the same medical records that I uploaded were able to be processed, and the decision was able to be made with dispersement within two weeks.

Please do not use this company! Although this claim was only a few hundred dollars, I’m nervous, that if there was a larger expense, I would not be able to get the appropriate reimbursement. I thought this was a good deal, because they included wellness as part of their insurance, but it seems as though this is a scam. Additionally, I’m worried that if I go with a different pet insurance, I would not be able to get insured because of my pets, pre-existing condition. I’m upset that I didn’t do more research into picking the right insurance, but I hope my review will prevent you and others from having the same frustrating experience as I’ve had.
title: Horrible pet insurance

title: Pets Best is amazing

text:
When I was shopping for pet insurance, I found Pets Best website was very easy to navigate and it provided all the information I needed. They offered many coverage options and the quoting process was so easy. 

Since my 6-month old puppy was eating and chewing everything in sight, I decided it would be wise to purchase accident and illness coverage in case she swallowed something and needed surgery. Never in my wildest dreams would I have expected her to break her leg, but at 10 months of age, she stepped in a hole while running in the back yard. It was a horrible experience. The break was so bad she needed emergency surgery. The bone had to be held together with a plate and screws. 

Needless to say this was very expensive and I was so glad we had purchased insurance. Now came the test to see how well our insurance company would handle this. I submitted the claim with all the appropriate information and waited. It was a very easy online process. 

Much to my surprise, they paid the claim exactly as was stated in the policy without any resistance, arguing, or phone calls. They sent me updates via email regarding their process, and when all was said and done, a deposit appeared in my bank account. Because of the severity of the injury, our pup needed follow-up visits and additional x-rays on several occasions, but they were all covered. 

I am more than pleased with the exceptional service provided by Pets Best! It was a welcomed relief after experiencing that horrible injury and the ordeal of recovery.

By the way, our pup is well on her way to a full recovery and she is so happy to be running again. : ) 

Thank you, Pets Best!
title: Great service and easy website!

text:
Buyer Beware:
Be sure to ask if they have a repetitive behavior clause buried in your prospective policy!  Our new dog had two claims in 6 weeks for swallowing things he shouldn’t eat.  Now I was told they will never cover this issue again because he had two claims for the same thing within 18 months.  I am in the process of switching to another company that understands Siberian Huskies better and does NOT have that clause in their policy.
#AVOIDPETSBEST #BUYERBEWARE
title: Buyer Beware:

text: We've had PetsBest coverage for both our dogs for years now. PetsBest really came through for us with our older dog when he had TPLO surgery several years ago. Our recent experience with PetsBest began as my wife and I were driving with our two dogs to visit family out of state. On the first day of our drive, our younger dog started vomiting. Unfortunately, even after we had reached our destination and she had several days to settle, her vomiting didn't stop. Being over a thousand miles from home and our primary vet made for a stressful situation. We ultimately made the decision to take her to a Vet ER where she received excellent care and recovered slightly with anti-nausea medication. However, once we returned home, our dog continued vomiting and her weight kept dropping. So, we went to our primary vet and he recommended an Ultrasound which could only be done at our local Vet ER. Thankfully, the Ultrasound was negative. We now have our dog on a new food and are hoping this will be the answer. Currently, we've submitted 4 claims for our dog's current illness and all have been reimbursed. The process for submitting a claim to PetsBest couldn't be more easy. The piece of mind from this experience has made us so incredibly thankful to have PetsBest coverage for our dogs!

text:
Pathetic Part 2

Well, we did as your response to our original "Pathetic" review, we called your customer service.

They claimed it was denied because of our Bulldog  having "Stenotic Nares".   Hmmm, to correct Stenotic Nares the dog would have to have his nostrils widened via surgery.  Every Vet web site outlines this quite well. 

As previously noted in our original "Pathetic" review our dog needed a reduction in soft palate.  Below is taken from his ACTUAL MEDICAL RECORD ON THE ENCOUNTER DATE ...

Physical Exam:
5)  Respiratory:  Increased upper respiratory noise, elongated soft palate, MILDLY stenotic nares – no Nasal discharge tracheal palpitation unremarkable, pulmonary auscultation clear bilaterally with referred laryngeal sounds

Plan

Recommended palate resection

Hmm, don't see any mention of "Stenotic Nare" surgery... maybe because his assessment was MILDLY.  And, by the way, he did have a Palate resection.

Now we are waiting for you to send us your "appeal" form.  

I'm assuming you will be getting a "Pathetic 3" soon after.

Hey... just a thought regarding customer service... call our Vet... she would be more than happy to educate you
title: Pathetic Part 2

text:
Pets Best is no different than your typical human health plan. They offer limited coverage amounts for SOME needs, with categories quickly meeting their limit (even for a healthy pet!).
We're in the process of getting our 18-month-old Newfie spayed. I say "in the process" because when we brought her in on the day she was to have the procedure the vet ran pre-op blood work and determined she had a low platelet count. We postponed the operation until we could determine the cause. Suspecting it was Lyme, the vet tested. Negative. They ran a few other tests to determine the cause. While we waited a few days for the results, I submitted the claim to Pet's Best. Two weeks later they finally responded of the $300+ bill they covered $30. The items for which the vet billed us either weren't covered by our policy (we have both Best Wellness and BestBenefit plans), or we had reached the maximum allowable limit for the particular service. The allowable limits are laughably low ($70 for blood tests), so those get burned through pretty quickly. 
Like most insurance companies, Pet's Best uses that infuriating language that's unique to their industry. Co-pay, co-insurance, deductible, etc. This is maddening when you're just trying to get some help with your pet's well-being and you're stymied by what the documentation says. I'm convinced the real problem with healthcare in our country, be it for people or pets, isn't the providers. It's the insurance companies.
We're scheduled to have her spay done in about a month. We'll see if Pet's Best will pay out the whopping $150 they say they'll cover for a spay. We'll still have to pay close to $1000.
title: Just as Bad as People Insurance

text: Absolutely awful service. My brother UNEXPECTEDLY passed away recently so we called to inform the company we had taken over ownership of his dogs & needed to change the account over to our names + payment information. We were then told since we did not have paperwork stating our new ownership via him nor did we have power of attorney they would have to cancel the policy under his name immediately & we'd have to start a new policy. Then we asked if the preexisting issues that were covered under his policy {because he bought this shortly after adopting} if they would be covered. We were told no they would not. So anything having to do with his hips, kidneys & back would not be covered. They then told us this was because their policy changed. We have access to my brother's email as well as his Pets Best App where we found NOTHING stating needing a POA or paperwork being needed to transfer ownership to another person after someone passes in order to transfer the policy over. We have passed the policy onto our attorney whom will reach out to the company for breach of contract|malpractice & hopefully resolve the lies they have spewed by not honoring a policy when nothing could have prevented his death in the first place.
title: Absolutely awful service

text: Loved Pets Best when I started out until I started having claims.  Recent claims are for a dog that is older.  But, I am paying for that!!!!  His most recent wellness visit resulted in the vet finding a UTI.  You processed it as the reason for the visit then denied half of the wellness benefits (the urinalysis and bloodwork).  So, does this mean that you will continually deny the bloodwork and urinalysis from wellness visits (their annual check ups) if the vet happens to find something?  In addition, he has been having a reoccurring muscle soreness in his back legs resulting in limping.  each time we brought him to the vet.  there was no real diagnosis (which is stated on the title of the claims I submitted) and you denied the medication and vet visits saying that it was a pre-existing condition.  Yes, he had a muscle strain previous to me starting his policy.  But, they are random.  The muscle would heal, just as in a human who strained something because they ran to long (which is what he did).  Then you might pull another muscle in the same area, just like he did!!  So, does this mean every time he has any issue with his back legs, you will deny the claims because he has had some kind of issue before?  The vets have clearly said that there is nothing wrong with his joints, tendons or other.  Just strained a muscle.  could even be a different muscle in the leg.  But you will now consider anything related to that leg as preexisting.  Will likely cancel all policies.

Pets Best is the worst I've dealt with.  Reasons stated below:

3) they answer the phone, but can't give you any information.
4) Left word with to have supervisor call me regarding the " lost claims"  and the denied claim - never returned calls.

Worst ever coverage - and you have to fight for every claim - which takes weeks.

NEVER would recommend this company.

text: About 2 weeks ago, my 8-year-old Dane mix Abby was rushed to the emergency vet where she was diagnosed with a hemoabdomen bleed. Subsequently, she was transferred to an emergency hospital where she had surgery and stayed through the weekend. Unfortunately, she was diagnosed with cancer. Obviously, we are totally heartbroken over this development as she has been a happy and healthy girl up until this point. One comfort in this process is the knowledge that Pets Best is on our side. We enrolled her 2 years ago when she obviously had no health issues and I'm so glad we did. The tier of insurance we got for her means that after reimbursement, our out-of-pocket cost will be a very small fraction of the actual cost of her care. Knowing that made it so much easier for us to move forward with surgery and we'll continue on with chemotherapy; we just want as much time with our girl as possible as she is so sweet and precious to us. If we didn't have this insurance, I don't know how we could have covered the cost of her emergency care and surgery, much less ongoing treatment for her cancer. It breaks my heart to think we would have had to make a very different call due to our financial situation. I can wholeheartedly say that because of the wonderful doctors who cared for her and Pets Best, we are now lucky enough to have more time with our baby girl. Thank you Pets Best!
title: So Grateful for this Insurance
