title: SO glad I got it

text:
Here's my feedback/review after 360 days using this pet insurance. 
If you're searching for pet insurance right now, like I was doing a year ago, Pets Best offered pretty comprehensive coverage for a dog older than 5 y/o. Unlimited annuals, 500 deductible (reasonable), 80% co-insurance - all for $60 a month(2021). I thought, ok, let's go with that. 
Half way through the year my dog had an illness I wanted to have checked. After roughly a month since I submitted a claim they, took that out of the deductible so I paid out of pocket - around $300.
A few months later another thing came up with my dog, minor accident playing at the park resulting in a paw injury. Went to the vet, had her patched up and then submitted the claim. Again, took forever and finally got a response that I had successfully reached the deductible. No reimbursement. By then I was out of a year's worth of insurance plus the out of pocket expense to go to the vet. No return yet. 
I figured since my renewal was coming soon, I would continue with them hoping that claims would be faster now that there was a history. 
All of a sudden, a letter comes in the mail. Premium goes up by $20 starting the new policy year. Now they want to charge $80 for the same amount of coverage. The reason: "premiums in my area are up because of rising vet costs". 

I was honestly giving them the most patience and trying my best to not have to go to another insurer. I tried to get a good answer as to why they would increase my premium by that much if none of the claims I submitted resulted in a pay out. I asked to reduce the premium but the best they could do was to offer to reduce coverage or increase the deductible. 
Closing thoughts: After a lot of research, I'm moving on to another policy. Pet insurance in general is a big scam and these companies are charging higher fees each year while also avoiding payouts with loopholes. Unfortunately this company missed the mark by jacking up the prices by a significant amount to loyal customers and to me, that means they are ok without my business. I've chosen a new policy and will be cancelling my PetsBest policy before it renews at the end of the month.
title: Transparent, sensible review

text: Let me start off by saying they are a competitive and legitimate company. However their claims process is very long and your first initial claims are handled poorly. Your claims are also handled depending on how competent the staff is which in my experience is a very minor few know what their doing.  I was told so many contradicting things by agents and made me extremely stressed and questioning why I bought this insurance. However through all the hassle and wait time I went through my claims were eventually approved. My pets medicine is also approved which is a big help. I'm concerned on where my rate is gonna go when my policy is up for renewal as I don't have full trust in this company with terms of that. I feel they might lure you in with a lower price to be stuck with a higher one later on yet I cannot speak to this yet but have heard stories that the rate increase was high. I want to note when signing up it was agreed to a 21 day processing time, but then changed to 39-45 days average time for processing. I'm not sure that is all that fair to the customer. I also made sure to provide all documentation needed for my pet from when adopted with all vet records on file and still had long processing times. When I spoke to an agent pets bets told me they didn't have this information and I had to resubmit all my documents, further taking away my trust. Again, All my claims have been approved so my rating is solely based on compensation and their plans. They have the  highest reimbursement limits, lowest deductible, and lowest annual cost. But processing time and customer service needs work, for transparency to customers and to gain faith their protected. Im going to see where my policy goes and get a good idea how this policy will hold up in the long term with more time. Hopefully they gain my trust and faith I can keep long term.
title: Honest Review

We are so thankful that we had Pets Best insurance for our dog. Her surgery was very expensive and they covered everything just the way I read they would. We've never had pet insurance before and it seemed too good to be true that for the low price we pay for coverage, they would actually pay so much, but they really did! We had compared many other plans and this insurance was 2-3 times LESS expensive then all others we found, but yet it offered better coverage.  
Also, if your pet is under 2 when you sign up, from what I understand dental is part of the policy at no extra cost - that is a very nice benefit for those of you who have younger dogs.
I tell everyone that has animals about this company. 
It is nice that they have their plans set up so you can buy what is best for your situation and pet.
They are also great at communication, letting me know where we were in the claim process.
All I can say now is THANK YOU PETS BEST! You really are what your company name says ; )

Additionally, several commonly used medications are not in their 17 page formulary. So my vet will now have to look through 17 pages anytime she prescribes a medication. In NY state vet techs are licensed, unfortunately Pets Best doea not cover even a rabies, heartworm, lepto vaccine if given by a tech which is fairly common practice. So read, read, read.....lots of misleading information given by reps during the sign up and LOTS of very fine print. We are researching and will drop our policy within the next month as I know there are better options out there.

text:
Avoid this company, they are sketch AF.  I had a quote in front of me for adding a second dog to my existing policy for $143, New dog $60.43 and existing dog $89.09.  I was concerned because I recognized that my current monthly cost for my existing dog was $172, so I chatted with support.  Shortly into my chat with the representative the rep is telling me that my price for my existing dog is showing $172 and a total of $230 for both dogs so I opened a second window and sure enough it was now showing this new price and $0 discount for multi dog.  I don't know what this rep did behind the scenes but I find this to be very sketch and concerning.  I screenshot both views... and then signed off on the lower price one.  Sure enough when I looked at my account information the price reflected was the $230.

The customer rep just chalked it up to the one quote was wrong and the other was right.  My concern is, imagine how I would have felt had I not noticed this and contacted support before accepting.  Would I have received the $143 price, did the rep do something behind the scenes to correct the quote once I reported the issue, I'll never know but I know had a month come and gone and I saw a draft on my bank account for nearly $100 more than what I approved I would have been pissed.

Next issue, Pets Best recently got a new underwriter with more favorable pricing.  However, existing customers can not take advantage of this without starting their policy over, meaning all grace periods are in effect and any pre-existing conditions are not covered - this means any condition that your pet may have been treated for under the prior policy would no longer be covered under the new policy because it's now pre-existing.

I encourage you all to shop around, find a pet insurance provider that is more honest and transparent.  I am now removing my new pet from this policy and will gladly shop around for a better price, even if my total is $230 between the two separate providers, I'd rather pay that than pay a company that won't honor a quote.
title: Avoid this company

text:
The amount of time it takes to get reimbursed takes way too long. I once waited 2 months for my claim application that I didn’t even get any cash back from. text:
I cannot say enough wonderful things about Pets Best. I have never had pet insurance before- but after our two old pets passed away I knew I wanted to look into coverage. One had needed a monthly prescription and the other needed prescription food- both were incredibly costly. 

When we adopted a lab puppy, I decided accidents alone with that breed would be a given. I'm a researcher and I researched all my options for a week or two- you know- the spreadsheet type. 

I finally settled on Pets Best for several reasons:

1. When I called I was able to always promptly reach a person who was able to answer all of my questions.

2. As a former sales person, I can spot when someone is "selling" me from a mile away. Unlike some of the other consultants with other companies, I did not get that sense from my representative. If anything, they were able to help me weigh the pros and cons of their plan compared to the others I was considering.

3. The cost and coverage seemed the best balanced. 

Within a few months of adopting our dog, we adopted a cat. The dog ended up getting Lyme disease and the cat ended up developing a behavior disorder. Within just a few months of taking out our polices, we had already made our premiums back and then some. And we got a pro-rated discount when we added a second pet!

I cannot tell you what a relief it was when our dog got super sick, and the vet had to run a bunch of tests and then started talking about expensive treatment plans, just how nice it was to be solely focused on our dog, and not at all focused on the numbers. That in and of itself was such a gift. We didn't have to make any tough choices or consider "wait and see"- we were able to just do what he needed to have done. 

If I had one complaint it would be that it can take a few months for the claims to be processed- but in the end, that's not a big deal. They may be a slow pay, but they pay. Filing a claim is super easy, there is always a human to speak with if needed, and their website and app are so easy and comprehensive that you rarely even need to speak with someone. 

I will never again not have pet Insurance and I am very pleased with Pets Best. They stand by what they say - no hoops to jump through, no hidden loopholes or "catches" to deny coverage. Just a straightforward and easy process. 

If you are looking for affordable yet comprehensive coverage that you can count on, Pets Best is the way to go!
title: I cannot say enough wonderful things…

text: It took over a month for them to complete my claim. That's way too long for this to be taken care of. They are quick to collect monthly payments but not to complete claims and pay customers backs.
title: It took over a month for them to…

text:
Pets best is the best. We got all of our claims reimbursed. We started our insurance the very same day our pup arrived home at 7 weeks. 

They take some time to get to your claim. I don’t remember the max wait time for me as I never worried about it. All I cared about was if I got my reimbursement as per my plan. I can say roughly 3 - 4 weeks and sometime less than 2 weeks. 

They are the best in the market in the scope of things they cover for price you pay. I feel they reimburse almost everything unless it is pre exiting

I would 100% recommend pets best
title: Pets best is the best

Once they fully processed it though, they sent me a very detailed itemized list of what they were paying for and what my expenses were and the deposit didn’t take long at all.

text: The insurance is okay but they take a very long time to process claims.  In addition, seems like much of what you would think to be covered is not.  They take a long time to tell you if additional paperwork is needed from your vet which then delays your reimbursement (if they decide to return anything).  You do not have an area on the website, where you have itemized, in the aggregate, details of your coverage, deductible balance, copay payments, etc.  The customer service and 24/7 access to a vet tech is good though.

text:
Claim took an extremely long time to be reviewed. My dog is on the wellness plan and this claim was for a physical exam which required blood work and fecal/urine test to get my dog established at the vet for the first time.
The review that came back only covered the vet's manual examination or $70. This is not what was understood from your advertising and promotion.
Very disapointed

text: The process is simple and user friendly, and usually, fast and well explained. So far the insurance have been super helpful and worked well for us. text:
Please please stay away from the company. I called and asked lots of questions - after I signed up for Pets Best wellness, I scheduled a routine yearly visit.  I’m so shocked by what happened next- this horrible company denied 100% of the claim -said it was an illness visit when it was a routine visit. I had already paid three months of 80/mo. insurance because it took about 50 days to process the claim. 

Have all paperwork from the vet stating it was a routine visit and my pet is healthy- and they still denied my claim saying he wasn’t covered yet - that I needed to have waited two weeks for the illness coverage.  They wrote multiple paragraphs of pure gibberish trying to explain but even my credit card company saw it was bogus and is working with me to get my money back. 

This company openly stole my money- they didn’t even do it well- it is very obvious that this is some kind of scam, and they hope people won’t follow up. I’m so shocked and feel extremely personally  violated by my experience with Pets Best insurance.
title: I’m so shocked by what happened to me…

I have dropped wellness, check ups, holistic off my policies because it lowers the cost as the age it goes up, so I’m tying to keep my monthly premium at a price we can afford and not be so high that I could start a separate monthly savings for this. The staff is always so very polite.

text: Pets Best definitely has great coverage. The only thing it did not cover was my dogs' periodontal disease (which I believe they should cover, it was random and unexpected). The process of getting the case reviewed was long and unclear; we received notifications that information was missing but never exactly what information that was, if they were doing something to obtain it themselves, or if there was something we needed to do. I found myself calling multiple times to move the claim forward. All in all, I'm glad around 60% of the claim was covered and quickly paid once it was approved.
title: Decent coverage but slow and unintuitive

text: I pay for the wellness benefit for my pets.  This includes $150 for dental cleaning every year.  I submitted a claim for my dog's dental cleaning and was denied saying that it wasn't supervised by a vet even though the cleaning was done in my dog's licensed vet's office.  They covered the claim for the same service on the same day for my cat but are not willing to cover my dog.  It's frustrating to pay for services that the company is not willing to pay out.  This is the second time a wellness claim has not been paid.  Last time it was not willing to pay for the wellness vet appointment stating that it was not for a wellness check even though it was our annual wellness appointment for vaccines.
title: Unhappy with my claim result

text: Everyone that I speak with over the phone is very pleasant and helpful. However, it is difficult to submit certain claims d/t covid and not being allowed inside the vets and all invoices/receipts being emailed. Pets Best seems to be unhappy with all of my "Proof of Purchases", even though if you actually read the forms uploaded, everything is present. It is also difficult to figure out which claim Pets Best is having issues with if you have multiple claims open for review. If you do not keep track of what has been uploaded under which claim number you are screwed and virtually have to start the process over. I also can't believe that once your dog is diagnosed with something then the following year they up your monthly charge... drastically
title: Issues with Claims on Repeat

text: I've had my ups and downs with Pets Best but, in the end, I'm pleased. Going in I knew that reimbursements could take up to 45 days and so I can't complain about that, but people should know what to expect. Their premiums are less than most others and I felt a delay in reimbursement is reasonable for the price. They've paid out on most all my claims and they've also reimbursed the biggest claims I've submitted. As with any insurance company, please read the policy very carefully to understand pre-existing conditions and what's covered and not covered. My rates were increased $400/year after a few claims including a $4k hospital stay. Not happy about that, but it's understandable. Customer support is ok, nothing special but they get the job done. The biggest issue I have with Pets Best is not their coverage, it's the fact that a bank (Synchrony) owns the company. Ethical? Maybe, maybe not. Provided your expectations are reasonable, I recommend Pets Best Health Insurance.
title: Ups and downs, but still pleased

text:
We have been very pleased with Pets Best insurance.  Prices on packages for insurance are very reasonable. 
The app also makes it very easy to submit claims and they take care of them quickly usually between 7-10 days and the direct deposit into your bank account on reimbursements is Awesome.  Love that they also have a vet online call 24/7 and customer service where you can actually talk to someone. Very happy that we chose Pets Best over the other insurance companies out there.
title: Pleased we chose Pets Best.

text: I feel like PetsBest has changed radically since the pandemic. Claims are taking FOREVER to get reimbursed, or denied. My dogs juvenile cataracts were completely denied, with the explanation being that there weren’t enough records of her eye health? Who takes a 2 year old dog to an ophthalmologist just for the heck of it? There’s never a health issue until there is, and that’s when you take them to the vet, as I did. It’s a disingenuous way to avoid paying a valid claim and the surgery they probably feared was coming. For me it meant thousands out of pocket when I was already paying $200/month for 2 dogs (wellness included). Furthermore, the last rate increase was horrendous-a near 50% increase for same coverage. Up to $276/month. That’s absurd if they’re just going to deny claims anyway. The last one to be denied was an ordinary bill for vaccines from a vaccine clinic. PB didn’t like the format of the invoice apparently. I mean COME ON. Lastly, when I called about the rate increase the customer service was flat-out rude. Check recent BBB activity on this company. NOT what it used to be. They’ll pay for random illnesses, accidents etc., but beware if your pet has anything that might become chronic or expensive. They’ll deny the condition up front to get out of paying for it long-term. You know-the stuff people buy insurance for. Been paying them thousands each year for years and years without any significant claims? THEY DO NOT CARE. And once you’re signed up, you’re stuck. I’m now paying $90/month for a 6 year old mixed breed who’s never had anything wrong but one tooth problem. But any other pet insurance company will now categorize any dental as preexisting, so I’m loathe to switch. I’ve come to feel PB adjustors and leadership are crooks, liars and thieves. If you have a young pet, start them elsewhere. PB is riding on its old reputation while adopting shady insurance biz practices and jacking rates to unmanageable levels each year. For what they charge I can get the same coverage plus alternative therapies at two other companies who’s staff aren’t rude.
title: PetsBest is no longer the best or even close. Beware.

text:
Good but not great coverage. For your average pet owner, pet insurance is something we expect to cover repetitive expenses: dental cleanings, shots, physicals, fecal floatation, anal gland expression, etc. Most of that is covered but only if you buy the Best Wellness plan, and even then, the maximum payout per period is so low and so specific that most routine care isn't actually covered. For example, the dental cleaning is "fully" covered, but that just means the dental prophylaxis is covered, not medical waste, anesthesia, ampicillin, vitals monitoring, dental radiographs, endotracheal intubation, IV catheter/fluids, Hospitalization, dental exam, or bloodwork. All together, our total bill is just over $900. PetsBest reimbursed us $270.

For accident and illness, the plan is great. We have the 90% reimbursement and $250 out of pocket. However, most of the time we have no accidents or illnesses and, like I said before, most treatment falls under the wellness plan, which just doesn't cover enough.
title: Good but not great coverage on routine care

I had pet insurance for my older cat . The website was so easy to upload my vet receipts. After I hit my deductible Pete best paid 80 percent and I received the difference back to my account within a couple weeks .  My cats passed away and the closed my account for me and even reimbursed a monthly amount back with a nice email about my loss .  This was my first experience with pet insurance and I did a lot of research !  I found the best and was so thankful I had them until the end !  Thank you 
Sheri Henggeler and Bean ( forever in my heart)
title: Just Amazing

text: I have been with this company for many years for my 3 dogs.  Every year the price increases several hundred dollars per dog eventhough there has been no major issues.  My 11 yo dog had a mass growing on his cheek and the vet determined that he has an infection in his gums and 2 teeth needed to be removed.  Prior to this, the vet did not see any issues with his mouth/teeth.  We had the surgery for him and removed the 2 teeth.  I filed the claim and it was completely denied because they said I had to have had his teeth cleaned 13 months before this issue, not the same day as the surgery.  Well if I could have forseen the future to know that he would have issues with him gums/teeth, I would have.  They said anything going forward regarding any issues with his teeth or gums would not be covered at all.  Sooo I am paying over $1000 per dog per year for what exactly???  Plus a $500 deductible.  At this point, I do not even spend $1500 yearly on any health issues.  This company used to be good but unfortunately has gotten greedy and is putting profit over care of animals.
title: BIG DISAPPOINTMENT!!!!!!!!!

text: My dog needed surgery, and I panicked thinking about dealing with insurance for her. I was very happy with everything, from submitting the claims to the resolution. text:
I have a general distrust of insurance as the common theme is to try and find reasons to exclude you from your benefits for whatever reason, but PetsBest has proven their worth and value above the rest. I have spent time on call with different associates to help get me a better understanding of my benefits, advice on filing claims, explanations of claims results, and even just general emotional support of dealing with your pets concerns and the financial burden of emergency situations. I have full faith in what they do, that my money is going to a good cause, and that they fulfill their roles as an insurance provider.

All that being said, their claims filing process takes WAAAYYY too long. I understand that the state of the pandemic has played a role in this in that they are short staffed, but it took about close to 40 days to get my claim resolved. Luckily I was financially secure at this time to work around it, but it was a very close call of having to rearrange my funds to make sure the reserves I used for my situation were refilled before other bills took place. 

That's all to say, minus 1 star for the extended wait time, but boy, did they ever do everything they could to help me understand the situation regarding my claims and support me as best they could during this process. 100% will and do recommend this to my friends because PetsBest has effectively earned my trust in a world of insurance distrust.
title: Fantastic support, but VERY long claims resolution

People reading this review should also note that wellness coverage by Pets Best (that is, annual physicals and preventative medications) is separately charged, and is not particularly comprehensive.  So far I have chosen to pass on wellness coverage.

text: I know many people complain about the wait times and feeling like they were misled by Pets Best. However, this is all due to people not reading their contracts thoroughly or understanding pre-existing conditions. My experience with Pets Best had been excellent and easy. I’ve submitted invoices from my vets, Pets Best has gone about obtaining the documents they needed without any issue, and I received payment in the form of a direct deposit for all charges that are covered by my contract. There’s been no contesting of medical procedures deemed necessary by my vet or requirement for me to gather documents, which is common under other pet insurances. Now if you are someone who got pet insurance late and have ANY indication of health issues from previous vets, you should understand anything slightly related won’t be covered (pre-existing conditions). This is the case with all pet insurance and is not unique to Pets Best. I’ve read through BBB complaints and many relate to this, saying Pets Best is fraudulent when they are making decisions based on what is outlined in the contract that was signed. Pets Best is an affordable insurance that does what they say they will albeit slightly slow (not surprising for the cost as they likely hire less staff; trade offs). Moral - read the fine print and know what you are paying for. They are a great option for pets without pre-existing conditions or even with pre-existing conditions if you understand related health issues won’t be covered.
title: Affordable and easy pet insurance; read your contract and understand what you are paying for

text:
Wishing Pets Best was able to help, but had to leave this group to search for another way to receive financial help when you are caring for an animal with a pre-existing condition.  Under these circumstances, in order to provide the proper care my dog needs, PetsBest is not offering any help.  Wish there was something like a 12 month waiting period but that does not even exist...

Thank you for your response. My point exactly ... there's no point wasting money with any insurance company when none go to the extreme to cover pre-existing condition. I will always recommend to everyone to save your money to help your pet directly instead of wasting it on pointless things such as insurance companies! Heck... even humans get a break on pre-existing conditions. There should be companies out there that offer to help pet owners with a waiting period of 12-18 months then make exceptions on pre-existing conditions...especially on rescue animals when we try to provide animals with a loving place to care for them instead of neglecting them as you insurance companies are teaching others to do.
title: Do not recommend for Pets with underlying "preexisting condition" - regardless of age or condition

text: ​Jolie's Story: If you would not spend a large amount of money to save your dog's life, you probably don't want to read any further. We took our 8-year-old shepherd mix to the Vet for a routine check-up. To our shock, he felt a lump on her thyroid gland that turned out to be cancerous. Our Jolie was a beloved ​member of our family and we would never fail to do anything we could to save and prolong her life. We are not a wealthy family, but can afford to spend a few thousand dollars to save our dog. Anymore would create a financial hardship, but I know for sure we would have not let that stop us from trying. We were blessed with the fact that a year prior, I decided to purchase Pet Insurance with Pets Best. After taking Jolie to Texas A&M Animal Hospital for treatment for Thyroid Cancer, they discovered a heart mass. To make a long story short, in a period of a few months both Thyroids were removed, open heart surgery, 20 days of radiation and five days of Chemo. The first bill from Texas A&M was for over 10 thousand dollars. I never hesitated to proceed,  even though we had to pay upfront. We summited our claim to Pet's Best. I have to admit I was not sure how legit pet insurance was, as having never insured any of my dogs before. As stated in my policy they would have to investigate back many months to make sure Jolie had not been diagnosed or suspected of Cancer. Did they pay? We spent over 40 days at Texas A&M over a period of two and a half years, and she remained Cancer free. On May of this year she was diagnosed with a disease of the spine. After several tests to determine if surgery or any treatment would help Jolie....the answer was NO. By July she had fought her Final Battle. It is with tears in my eyes I write her story and I have always considered myself a tough guy. I have to Thank Pets Best for staying with us to the end. They may take a little longer to pay than you feel necessary, but pay they will. Jolie's medical bills were somewhere north of 30 thousand dollars and yes, they paid the lion's share of these bills. I highly recommend Pets Best so please do your pets a favor and purchase Pet Insurance for them.
title: Jolie's Story

text:
Ok so we have used this insurance on our animals many times and they pay out whats necessary. Good Job.
What is very unfair and I have a feeling this is across the board for all Insurance companies for animal is that they know now our animals are older and have current medical problems we cannot go to another insurance company and have current medical problems covered. With this noose they know we can't leave and have our fur babies fully covered so they put the premiums and monthly charges up so ridiculously high most people can't afford the cost therefore the customer either has to lower coverage to lower the cost of coverage or cancel it all together.
Clever stuff on their part i say.
That being said they do pay out when needed but it comes to a point that after a year of paying extortionate monthly payments and the premiums for each animal in the end is the coverage worth it.
When your fur baby is young and healthy its cheap.
Beware when your fur baby gets old and/or you have to use the insurance, they will push up the cost of customer payments very high and send a letter with a very poor lame excuse for doing so.
Very Disappointed and trapped with this high cost insurance! 
Clever them!
title: Beware of aging pets and cost to customer

text:
The issue started when my pup who had a mass cell tumor on the top of his head that was diagnosed and removed all within a three weeks timeframe. My claims for the visits, diagnosis, and the surgery were denied due to what they said was a pre-existing condition. Note: previously my pup had a lump under his jaw and it was diagnosed as a fatty lymphoma but that was diagnosed over two years ago (Information that was provided to Pets Best back then as I send everything related to my pets heath, no matter if it is covered or not). The lymphoma under my dogs chin was the reason the my pups claim was denied and I was told that this was a pre-existing condition and the bills totaling roughly $1200, none of would be covered. 

I then had to go down the extremely lengthy process of appealing each claim individually, getting a formal letter written by my vet stating it was not pre-existing, providing the biopsy notes from the lab that determined what type of mass cell tumor my pup had and writing a timetable for them to follow as the event happened. The appeal process took so long (Note: I provided all of the above requested information to them within a two weeks timeframe) that the 90 day follow up I had scheduled with a specialist to make sure the tumor was not popping back up was also denied because of the “pre-existing condition” that I was already appealing. I then had to open up ANOTHER appeal claim for the specialist visit. It took roughly 4 months all in all the finally get the reimbursement from Pets Best. The worst part is, is that I am now stuck with the company because if I were to go to a new insurance provider, EVERYTHING would be a pre-existing condition and at that point, I should not even have insurance at all. 

Needless to say I was extremely upset that they assumed that I was such a bad pet parent that it took over two years to get something removed rather than actually reading the forms that were provided to them and seeing the entire process my pup went through, diagnosis and removal took three weeks total.
title: Ok if you never use the insurance for major issues

text: The claim processing is too slow and not transparent. It took forever almost 45 days ! This is really frustrating experience.
title: The claim processing is too slow and…

Also they’re good at finding loopholes not to cover the silliest things. I understand how pet insurance works and have no choice but to accept it. text: Honestly my cat (Pizza) would not be alive today if it weren’t for Pet’s Best Insurance. A friend had suggested them to me a couple years ago and I joined because the plan is only around $20-25 per month (not much more than a Netflix subscription). Pizza didn’t have any preexisting conditions at the time and was only about 3-4 years old. This year during the pandemic he stopped eating so we took him to the vet and they found he has Chronic Kidney Disease (at only 6 years old!). After about 5 days in the ER the bill was over $7,000. I was so scared to try the insurance for the first time and worried they wouldn’t pay but all I had to do was submit photos of the receipt and bill and they paid 90% of it just like the plan specifies! Since his diagnosis he has had to go to the vet almost once a week, which comes out to around $300-$700 each time. There is no way we would be able to afford to continue to care for him if it weren’t for Pet’s Best, especially during the pandemic when both my partner and I lost most of our work as freelancers. Pizza is still so happy and active and has no idea that he is terminally ill. Now we can enjoy all of the moments we have left with him without worrying about the vet bills and he can get the absolute best care without cutting corners. I’m so thankful for this company.
title: Pet’s Best is truly THE BEST!

text: Cat had to be taken to the emergency vet for a skin condition, end the end everything turned out okay.  I filed my claim and it was denied a couple of weeks later.  I look as to why and it said that there were multiple tries to contact the vet for the records.  I called my vet, they said they sent them in.  So when I refiled my claim, I uploaded the records from the vet instead.  Same result: denied.  Called PetsBest and it turns out they were looking for vet records from a vet I went to over a year ago.  I release the records to them and they said that they have re-submitted the claim on their end and I should hear back within a week.  A week comes and goes so I call back a few times and they say it is still processing.  A month later I call again.  The rep tells me that it takes time, but I won't hang up until she has spoken to someone higher up.  Turns out, they had never resubmitted my claim in the first place!  I was told multiple times that it was still pending, but it hadn't even been submitted!  Same day I get an email that it has been submitted and a few hours later I get an email confirming they accepted my claim; literally months of waiting and many phone calls and gaslighting later...

text:
Here are the facts. The company fell victim to their initial success (caused by having a great product and great customer service) by being sold to a giant banking conglomerate. Now they increase their rates every year by about 30%. Mathematically speaking, if your dog turns 10 and you started with the advertised $20, you'd end up with $215 monthly and most dogs get significantly older. Greed isn't the only issue, incompetence is rampant as well. You cannot get a hold of customer service no matter how long you wait on hold while millions of people are looking for remote work during the pandemic. On top of that, they deny claims for made up reasons and when confronted, you are told 'take it or leave it'. This business feels like a giant fraud, as did my experiences with the business that owns this business. The apple doesn't fall far from the tree. There is a chance that all pet insurances work like that since this is the only one I tried but the market should clearly wipe this one out in favor of more competent ones. 


By the way, their website claims 'fast 5 day claims processing'. Check the reviews, the lie detector found that was a lie. It also claims not to raise the price of the policy because you filed a claim. How is raising mine then every year 30% and sends me an email that age is the reason?
title: Here are the facts

text:
So far, I am very pleased with Pets Best. The claims process is easy (literally you go online and upload a picture of your receipt,) everything I have expected to be covered has been, the Explanation of Benefits breakdown they send is easy to understand, and I find their premium/deductible very reasonable. 

I have been a veterinary technician for over 16 years and have researched and worked with MANY pet insurance companies over those years. When I got my new puppy last year I knew I was going to get her insurance but it took A LOT to decide on a company (I literally spent HOURS getting quotes and reading policies and fine prints). I finally decided on Pets Best for a number of reasons, including: their premium is reasonable especially for unlimited coverage which is an amazing piece of mind for a worrier like me and (a big one) their premium increase with age was the least drastic compared to other companies. I know if my pet ever develops an issue, that that issue will now be a preexisting condition if I ever switched insurance companies, I wanted to find a company I could stay with long term and be able to afford the coverage. Also, if my premium does get too high as she gets older I can downgrade my coverage or increase my copay to lower my rate and I will not need a 'new policy.' 

The veterinary industry is VERY busy right now resulting in many people submitting a lot of claims.  That being said, you WILL have a long wait for your claims. People seem to bash the company for taking a long time to process claims and not covering pre-existing conditions, that is how pet insurance works. My claims on average have taken about a month (only 2.5 weeks for my last one though). People don't seem to understand pet insurance DOES NOT cover preexisting conditions, so if your dog just ruptured its cruciate ligament and you think getting insurance will pay for you to fix the problem, it won't. If you're mad Pets Best's 'customer service doesn't care and claims take too long to get your money, so you're going elsewhere,' just be aware if you've submitted claims your pet likely has a problem and now that's a preexisting condition that will not be covered at this 'new insurance' you're switching too.
 
Pet insurance is an amazing peace of mind for those who want to know that in the event of a FUTURE problem, you are covered. I know if anything happens I can do EVERYTHING to save/help my pet and will not have to worry about costs in the end, totally worth it for me!

Update after their reply on 6/15/2021. You can clearly see they use a rubber stamp reply to reviews. They claim I have to take up "pre-existing" issues with my vet? HA!! Since when is an emergency condition pre-existing? And secondly, this was the very first visit to the vet..so what BS are they trying to get away with? I guess that's their way of worming out of coverage. Using the bogus excuse that things are pre-existing. Don't believe them folks. 
Original Review: I had high hopes for this insurance coverage for our little 14 yr Elvis. I opted for the highest 90% coverage and even added the wellness coverage. Unfortunately, after one visit to the vet for a sudden illness, an approximately $750 bill paid out to the vet, was reimbursed by the insurance for only $59. They back charged so called co-pays (not specified in the plan docs) and also claimed that some of the medication given was for a "pre-existing condition" prior to the date of coverage. Absolute BS!!! Save your money, put it in the bank and use that to pay your vet bills. I shelled out almost $1200 for what I believed to be very good coverage for my kitty only to be slapped in the face. They can keep their stickin $59.

text:
Service Date(s): 04/09/2021 - 04/13/2021

Before you sign up with this insurance company BEWARE, read all the 1 star client reviews.  Horrible company, they WILL NOT COVER YOUR PET! You WILL wait 2 hours on hold, and they don’t care!  Highly priced and outright crooks.  I transferred from another after 5 years (big mistake) thinking I’m getting a better company and better coverage when in fact this company DOES NOT have the best interest of my pet!  Denied all my claims. I thought my dog was dying, not eating lethargic, had X-rays done.  It showed a dark looking mass near his pancreas, three days of torture and 1800.00 later for more testing, blood, ultrasound etc; they are now claiming “pre existing conditions” on my pet, when in fact there was NEVER anything of the sort! Let me make it clear that each time he went to any veterinarian anywhere we were, it was for a different reason. The fact that they can group all the visits together and claim a pre-existing condition is fraudulent. None of the symptoms were the same. None of the reasons I took him to the vet were for the same thing. This company IS NOT a good choice!  If you love your pet PLEASE DO NOT BUY THIS INSURANCE. You will be sorry!  Extra money spent monthly which adds up to hundreds and thousands of dollars yearly that you will never be able to claim.

text:
They used to have a great reputation, but idk what happened. 

I went with pets best because of the price and wellness plans etc. I currently have 5 outstanding claims with them and nothing. Full disclosure, they range from one calendar month to one week ago. However, they’re all marked as “received” or “waiting for vet info” despite attaching the full vet notes on letterhead with detail…. My vets office has confirmed that they haven’t even contacted them btw. I keep getting “sorry we’re taking so long” automated updates and they claim they’re hiring more staff. The bbb “resolution” about this has not been updated since March of last year. 

Also, their “direct pay” is misleading…. Unless your vet will take payment plans/arrangements, it’s just a paper. That your vet agrees to receive payment from them directly. Well that’s great…. But no vet will keep you or continue this if they’re taking 35-40 (business) days to process claims. You also need a prior approval for anything over 1k, so hopefully if you have an expensive emergency….. your animal won’t mind waiting 30-40 days. Otherwise I guess they’ll deny the claim for not having pre approval. 

Pros: affordability for young animals, optional wellness plan, uh…. Handy app (like everyone else)

Con: you will not receive payment any time soon, they have terrible customer service. So if you have a line of credit/payment option/interest free plan and can afford to wait almost two calendar months for your claim to be reviewed, it’s great. I guess.

title: Happy customer!

text:
Terrible Terrible Terrible Customer Service. Its impossible to get in contact with them. This Pet Insurance like many will take your money and not help you! I had Pets Best for close to a year, submitted one claim and was denied, and never communicated when it was or why. I had to call back myself many times to get an answer. Their entire business model is setup around it being difficult for you to get ahold of them and submit claims. Their user experience is so bad on purpose they want you to give up and forget about claims. My dog had some neuro issues with his back legs. The vet wanted to do an MRI to rule out a genetic disease, which they tested for but were waiting the results back. He was in pain so they wanted to do the MRI as soon as possible. Pets Best took weeks to even get a pre authorization form in for the MRI. I couldn't wait any longer and got the MRI myself which was expensive. The results came back and all he had was virus you can get from local lakes, and all he needed was some antibiotics. I called pets best back to get let them know I didn't need the Pre Authorization anymore. They had already closed it deeming it Pre Existing and they wouldn't cover. Once I mentioned to them it wasn't that it was a virus they said I would need to resend all the claims again but it won't be covered anyways because that can also be considered pre existing with a boxer breed. WHAT?! If the Pre-Authorization for the MRI had been covered I could have had this paid for and handled right away. As it was deemed not the genetic disease rather a common virus in puddle/lake water. Instead Pets Best did not help me in a time of crisis, like an insurance company should! Please do not give them your time or money. They need to re-brand to Pets Worst!

Here are my experiences and reasons to not go with this insurance:
- They give you quite the runaround to submit claims. They never tell you if you are missing anything or need something else. You need to call back yourself to find out the status.
- The wait time on the phone is crazzzzy! Each time I called I was on hold for an 1hr plus. One time equalling 2.5 hr phone call. What!! My dog was in a bit of an emergency or I would never wait that long. 
- They will claim almost anything a "Pre-existing condition"
- They will not pre-authorize in a time of crisis if you need it. The runaround for this is insane and expect to send in tons and tons of documents with no response or updates. 
- Once you get ahold of a real person they are not able to answer your questions. There is a disconnect between them and the people actually approving claims. They seem to be just a phone answering service. 

Hope this helps the next person considering them. Definitely do not! Find a good insurance that actually cares for your pets needs, they are hard to find, but this one does not no matter how much their marketing team claims they do! 

PETS WORST
title: Terrible Terrible Terrible Customer…

text: I am a veterinarian and I have had my furbabies insured with PetsBest starting in 2013. Through all of these years, PetsBest has come through for my pets and has never been unfair in their coverage. Within the past 1.5 years, my cat Summer was hospitalized twice (once for gastrointestinal upset and once for a ureteral obstruction with emergency surgery for SUB placement), and has had to have multiple rechecks to ensure her SUB stays functional. Once I hit my deductable, they covered everything up to my annual limit! Her entire SUB surgery was paid for, which saved me thousands of dollars (even though I get a discount as a veterinarian!) I feel confident that for the years to come, Summer will continue to have all the care she needs to maintain her SUB. My cat Rosie was also hospitalized for a gastrointestinal issue and then was diagnosed with a mosquito allergy. Both were covered. My dog Pepper ate a whole bag of ant poison (COVERED!) and then ate a lethal dose of chocolate from under our Christmas tree (COVERED!). I recommend PetsBest to my clients, friends, and family. They have saved me thousands of dollars. Even if your pet has a preexisting condition, it's still worth it! They won't cover that condition (which makes 100% sense) but they will cover anything new that comes up.
title: I am a Veterinarian and I trust PetsBest to cover my furbabies

text:
Although most people have had a good experience with Pets Best insurance, I was financially and emotionally devastated by their lack of communication, support, and compassion for me and my dog. I signed my dog up for Pets Best insurance after a dear friend of mine recommended them to me. My dog was approaching 7.5 years old and had no current health issues, so I thought it best to sign her up before she developed any. My dog presented with lameness during the waiting period, and it was unclear to me and my veterinarian what the cause was. The diagnosis was unclear, but it was suspected to be an injury based on the X-Ray. About three months after the waiting period ended, my dog was diagnosed with osteosarcoma (bone cancer) and was recommended to undergo chemotherapy and an amputation of the diseased limb, which would have given her another year of life as opposed to two months (without treatment). I thought to myself, “thank goodness I purchased pet insurance!” Actually, I have no one to thank and definitely NOT Pets Best. Pets Best settled that the cancer was linked to the lameness that presented a few months prior during the waiting period, so they labeled the cancer as a pre-existing condition, even though my veterinarian records revealed NO EVIDENCE of a cancer diagnosis BEFORE or DURING the policy waiting period. Pets Best even had my veterinarian records to prove that there was no evidence of a pre-existing cancer diagnosis. Therefore, I would have been stuck paying for all medical costs IN FULL. The limb amputation alone would have cost me $1,000-$2,000 and chemotherapy would have been $400 per session. My dog needed at least weekly chemotherapy which meant that I would be paying, out-of-pocket, $1,600 per month, or $19,200 PER YEAR, JUST FOR THE CHEMOTHERAPY. That is half of my net salary! I am a mental health professional working in the non-profit sector, so this is a HUGE burden on my heart and my finances. I had to make the heart-wrenching decision to euthanize my beautiful dog because I could not afford her care. Pets Best discriminated against my dog without full consideration. My dog had a healthy medical record with NO EVIDENCE of pre-existing conditions, and they had the veterinary records to prove it. Based on Pets Best treatment of me and my pet, I don’t believe that Pets Best cares about the well-being of their customers and their pets. It’s clear to me that Pets Best will find any way that they can to NOT pay for your pet’s medical treatments by prejudicially asserting that any presenting accidents/illnesses were due to a pre-existing condition. I have lost trust in Pets Best and will NOT insure with them, ever again, and will NOT recommend them.

P.S. Thank you for your reply. Pets Best had my dog's veterinary records that proved that there was not a history of cancer issues in my dog. Therefore, it was NOT pre-existing.
title: Unfair Judgement of Pre-Existing Conditions

text:
A year ago, I purchased what I considered to be a major medical policy for my 3 year old Golden Retriever.
The terms were $1000 annual deductible; 90% payment; and unlimited dollars.
The month before the expiration of the first term, I received a declaration page for automatic renewal.
The policy premium increased by about 30% and the original discount was reduced from 10% to 5%.
I have filed NO CLAIMS.
I expected some increase in the renewal policy, but I did not expect a 35% increase.
After some long waits to talk to a customer service rep, I was told that age, price increases in vet costs, etc.were the reason for the 35% increase.  
I was told that increases could be expected each year that the dog ages.  
While I expected some increase, I did not expect, nor did I believe it was reasonable, to experience a 35% increase having filed NO claims.
My final thought -- prospective buyers should be better informed about the large premium renewal increases year to year.
title: Buyer Beware

I spoke to multiple reps and each one apologizing about the confusion, assuring me it would be taken care of. Now on April 3, almost 4 months later, I receive an email saying they will cover $52.40 and the rest was not covered because of possible “pre-existing symptoms”. Completely untrue and unacceptable! Time to lawyer up!

Beyond Horrible Pet Insurance! If zero stars was an option I would give them zero stars!  They don't even deserve one star.  Total rip off, in my book complete thieves!

They refused to pay for my claim because they state that a symptom which hadn't had a diagnosis because no vet had come up with one was considered pre-existing.

So basically if the dog sneezes and you take them to a vet then later do a claim for that visit they refuse to pay for the claim stating to me that the symptom is pre-existing!  

Also takes them close to 45 minutes to get a rep on the phone.  They also made me send them a bunch of vet notes called SOAP to be denied later because in my case the vet was still trying to figure out what was wrong with my dog and why she was getting diarrhea.  It honestly seemed from the many request for the same notes and x-rays that they were digging to try and find an excuse not to pay for the claim.  

Stay far, far, away from this company get Nationwide pet insurance instead at least they pay the claims and not make you feel like if you're trying to take advantage of them.  Yeah the representative I spoke with made me feel like if I was trying to rip them off!  I have never been so ill treated by a company like this one.

Hope this helps someone never pay them one red cent they are truly the definition of horrendous service!

The reply from the insurance company below is a complete lie!  No where on the medical notes from the vet does it say that she had a pre existing condition let me know if I should send screen shots of these notes which they already have but won’t show anyone a copy of course!

Also, take note how they are not even offering to contact me to fix this situation if they were being honest then contact me and tell me where the hell it says that the condition of my dog was pre existing! Train your customer service better! Trust me everyone don’t let this company rip you off!  Acting all innocent almost a month or more later wow just wow!

The hold time to reach a rep was really long and slow (ie 20+ mins every time).  The processed the 3 claims within a week with no issues.  It all went to the deductible.  The signficant hospital claim took over 30 days. Thankfully they did reimburse as expected per the policy with no issues, denials, or requests for further info.  I would have given them 5 stars other than the long hold times and slow reimbursement which was a financial strain.

text: I have had this insurance since my cat was 2. Never any claims but always paid my monthly payments for coverage. My credit card company that was on file was changed due to a buy-out. I got my new card, activated it. however, My old card was to be good for another month. I tried to call also because they said that my account was past due. My older card is still in effect until next month. There is no reason for it not to be paid.  I was on the wait for 2 hours to talk to someone and never got thru. What is this? I am questioning whether I should keep this insurance. I have never let it go past due at any time. This is frustrating. Covid or no Covid there must be someone to answer the phones. Online is not always the answer. Customers need to talk to someone when it is necessary.
title: I have had this insurance since my cat…

text:
Overall I think it's a good insurance for Illnesses and Accidents.
Except they really wanna find something in the past so that it can be taken as "pre-existing" condition. My dog has been to a dermatologist before we start the insurance and tested by pricking the skin. He showed allergies against dust, cat dander, some types of grass. Doctor reported as Atopic Dermatitis. Being said he had an ear infection and they didn't wanna cover it because the dermatologist report. Even though my dog's own vet don't believe it should be related, but Pets Best did.  Also he gets staph infections he won't get covered, why? Because of atopic dermatitis he might be more prone to get staph infection. Not to mention they covered his cytology tests twice before but then stopped covering it.

I also don't recommend their Wellness plan, If you live in an urban big city. Your bill is higher and the coverage is worthless as in whatever discount they offer in the plan. It's literally the total sum of your year long premiums. 

Other than that they are good. I do recommend them. If you get your pets insured as they are puppies you won't come close with any bumps on the road with them.

Update: Dear Miss or Sir, I know the difference between insurance and a plan. I made my review very clear...We appealed twice with our vet's letter, thank you very much.
I have a license as insurance adjuster so thanks.
title: Overall I think it's a good insurance…

text: it was very easy to file a claim for my dog.  Zero issues and they direct deposited my money into my bank.  Made it a lot easier to get my dog the care she needed.
title: it was very easy to file a claim for my…

text: I always get great service from PetsBest. The only thing I wish is that they had an "uncapped" option for insurance. My Tiffany is undergoing chemo and we reached our cap so we now have to pay out of pocket for all ongoing chemo until August. I would love to stay with Pets Best for my future dogs but I may need to move to another plan with an uncapped option.
title: Excellent service and one suggestion...

text:
BEST RATE: YES. 
SNEAKY SHORTCUTS: YES
CUTTING CORNERS: YES
Basically, they will try every way possible to not cover some stuff on your bill. LIKE ANESTHESIA on a surgery ( as if it wasn't essential to perform surgery). Believe it or not. I have done an appeal for every claim. So it is a hassle to get the reimbursement they promised.
title: Very Sneaky and cutting corners. Many appeals

text:
The worst experience ever! ZERO stars! My cat was hospitalized for bleeding from his mouth, when it occurred for the first time ever, which is clearly stated in his medical documentation. He was diagnosed with an extremely aggressive cancer (oral squamous cell carcinoma) with a median survival rate of 87 days. I did not get reimbursed for ANYTHING because - according to Pets Best - "stomatitis and hyperthyroidism" were pre-existing conditions. He was hospitalized (and diagnosed) for CANCER, and not stomatitis and hyperthyroidism... As an example: the claim for the histopathology exam - to diagnose which kind of oral cancer my cat had - was denied due to a "pre-existing condition"!!!!!!!! He was never diagnosed with cancer before and if he had had oral squamous cell carcinoma at the time I got the insurance for him, he would have been dead long ago.

The entire experience has been outrageous and offending. I regret bitterly ever choosing this company.

The wait on the phone to talk to a customer service representative takes hours, making it practically impossible to get any information. This is not the worse pet insurance I have dealt with, but one of the worse companies that I have ever dealth with!
title: The worst experience ever

text: Pets Best has been great! Their claim processing time is a little bit long (2-3 weeks) but it's accurate and I haven't had any issues with things being covered. Their price was the best by far, especially for my older dog. Very happy with their service!
title: Best for the price

text: I have tried calling for months regarding claims that I have submitted and NO ONE answers. There is no customer support email addresses, so I send them issues I have with their so-called "claim findings" to the claims department with no response. Now they needed to check with the vet for records and it was a specialist the vet referred us to. I told them the real vet and then another email saying they need to get the records from that vet, dragging the process out longer. Typical insurance, doesn't mind taking your money, but use every excuse to avoid paying anything.
title: I have tried calling for months…

text: Cheaper than most, but beware. The deductible is higher than posted because of the shady way they calculate it when submitting a claim. I had what I thought was a $1,000 deductible, but when I had $1,500 in vet bills. I only received roughly $200 back. I have 80% reimbursement so I expected $400 back which I calculated as I pay the first $1k and then I am reimbursed 80% of the remaining $500. The way they calculate that is misleading and borderline shady. Basically, with a $1,000 deductible and 80% reimbursement, you need almost $1,300 in expenses before they will pay anything out which is more of a $1,300 deductible. will say they are cheaper than most and the claims process was easy. I just wish they would calculate a deductible like most places do.
title: When a $1,000 deductible is really $1,300

text: They are a Wonderful Company ❤
title: They are a Wonderful Company ❤

text:
I’m disappointed at the way my submitted claims have been handled by this company. I submitted a covered wellness claim for a dental cleaning almost two weeks ago and instead on working on that larger return of $150 dollars first, they decided to work on a smaller claim of $12.50 submitted after the first claim. Are they waiting to get $150 worth in premium payments from me first? They should have worked on the first claim.

** UPDATE: I found out that my claim for a wellness dental cleaning was processed as an “undiagnosed illness-acute.” When I asked why is a dental cleaning considered an “undiagnosed illness”? They said there was an extraction. Meaning they’ll deny the claim because there was one extraction. That extraction will be considered a pre-existing condition, which means they’ll deny my claim. Do you see how they get you?! These are the little clauses that are not mentioned in their policy when people are signing up for insurance. People beware!!! This company is notorious for denying claims by using the “pre-existing” excuse. Stay away from PetsBest! I canceled before they take any more money from me!

**RESPONSE: The extraction was NOT illness related; it was a broken tooth I asked the vet to extract while a routine cleaning was being done. You cannot assume these things to determine payment on claims.
title: I’m disappointed at the way my…

text: I had pets best for my 3 year old English lab. After a night of playing with his friends, he had a heat stroke. We had to take him to the ER where he received plasma infusions for 24 hours. After this, it was stated that he had a small chance of survival. We were given the option to put him through dialysis. After the worst week of my life, and 3 dialysis treatments, we found out that my poor Wallace didn’t have functioning kidneys anymore. He came home for a couple days and passed away. After all of the treatment, we paid about $26,000 of medical bills. Pets best paid for the majority. All said and done, we only paid a couple grand. I can’t believe they covered as much as they did. I was traveling and saw that I had the final $16,000 direct deposited into my account. Pets best really made this terrible accident a lot less painful. All I can say is thank you.
title: Pets best paid $25,000+ of medical bills

text: Submitted claim for my dog who I recently adopted. The claim was for his first vet appointment for a wellness visit and vaccinations. Pets Best did not reimburse the charge for the exam because they said since they found the ear infection it wasn’t a wellness visit. So if they didn’t find the ear infection they would have reimbursed? That makes no sense. I called to advocate that that charge should be reimbursed. Agent said she would look into it but it seems it should have a non-issue to reimburse the first and only exam my dog has had.

text:
We are very disappointed and frustrated that the medication used to treat our dog's giardia is not covered.  While I understand that the medication CAN be used to treat worms (a wellness condition) it is also used to treat other illnesses, such as giardia.  According to our vet, this prescription was the best and most effective prescription to treat our dog's severe case of giardia.  It makes no sense that our policy covers the illness but not the medicine to treat it.  Our policy would have covered a more expensive, less effective medicine, since this alternative was not on your "wellness" medication list.  When a drug can be used for numerous conditions, including ones that ARE covered, it should not be labeled as a "wellness" drug.
FOLLOW-UP-I submitted a letter appealing the decision and was told they that would NOT cover the cost of the prescription, very disappointing!

text:
I am reading the reviews and although I usually do not review I want to make one thing clear :
PetsBest is NOT fast. It takes a minimum of 3 weeks for them to process and reimburse any claim, even the most straightforward. Many will take maximum a week.
I compared and think the coverage is very well positioned for the price compared to competition but ‘Fast’ does not define the service.
Also the detail of benefit is not always clear and it is very hard to tell why this or that or covered or not. I think this is the same with most others.
If you want a good pet insurance for a reasonable price, maybe. But if you want a fast one, this would not be your first choice.
title: Good, yes, maybe. Fast, definitely not

Customer portal communication through the app, as I said in my original response is not any better. It is as terrible as waiting on the phone. Communicating to Pest Best is however, is only 1/2 the problem. The other 1/2 is the  rate of reimbursement.

text: I thought Pet Insurance would be a good idea after I had to pay $6K for one of my three dogs to have his Gall Bladder removed, so I investigated pet insurance and I chose Pets Best partly because they would cover my 14-year-old schnoodle and partly because their prices were good for the coverage. I paid the premiums for about a year for my three dogs which amounted to about a $1K. I felt good thinking I would be covered if he needed any big expensive surgeries. My schnoodle suddenly got sick and was dying, and I took him to the emergency vet and sure enough they said he needed his Gall Bladder removed. I said go ahead thinking I was covered. Well I was SO relieved that my little dog made it through the surgery and recovered and the bill came to over $6K again. I turned this claim along with 12 other smaller claims thinking I would at least be partially reimbursed for the expenses. It took Pets Best about 40 days to finally settle the claims and I spent hours submitting the claims and resubmitting them every few days. I started looking through the claims, and they didn't pay me one cent for any of my claims. Let me warn you Pet Insurance is NOT like our medical insurance it is a "scam". They have loopholes to get out of paying almost any claim you can think of because they exclude pre-existing conditions. If you think about it almost every dog or cat over 10 years of age is going to have a pre-existing condition. Only young dogs are not going to have a pre-existing condition, and then they are probably not going to have any medical problems anyway. The only way they can't weasel out of paying a claim is if your dog swallows a bone, gets hit by a car or jumps off a table and breaks his leg. In other words a freak accident that is not likely to happen like an illness. They ask your veterinarian to send in medical records, but it is not YOUR vet that makes the decision if the condition was pre-existing it is their vets so guess what they are going to decide! Everything CAN be considered pre-existing. Having this Pets Best insurance caused me a lot of stress, and it was a big relief when I cancelled it because I know that unless my dog swallows a ball or gets run over I am never going to get any money out of Pets Best. Save your money and put it in a savings account for your dogs medical expenses because pet insurance is not ready for prime time. With our insurance Obama Care made it illegal to not cover pre-existing conditions but with pet insurance they use this exclusion to get out paying 95% of the claims they receive. Also, Pets Best is next to impossible to get in touch with by phone or email, and they never answer your emails. It is a shame that they are allowed to continue in business with all the complaints against them. I am an honest person and this review is exactly what happened to me. Luckily I only had Pets Best for a year so I didn't lose thousands of dollars in premiums so please reconsider if you are considering pet insurance. You WILL be sorry as I was. Pets Best is making a big mistake denying EVERY claim. If they had at least paid a couple of my claims I wouldn't have cancelled them. They should learn from the gambling industry. You have to let the people win some time, or they will quit gambling, and you will lose all the people that are paying insurance premiums, and you will be out of business. Pet insurance for the most part is a scam right now.

text: READ YOUR POLICY. Insurance is a scam. They hook you with lower prices and empty promises. I put insurance on my dog when she was 3 months old. Fast forward to 3 months later, my 6 month old puppy tore her cruciate ligament. I was fully aware of the injury and illness waiting period and fully expected her injury to fall under injury coverage I had purchased. It was specifically spelled out on my Policy Application under "Your Pets Coverage Begins: Illness: 14 days [...], Accident: 3 days [...]." After waiting 42 days for them to process my claim, it came back rejected. Thats when I found out about the 6 month waiting period for cruciate tears. After calling customer service it was described to me as "an anomaly" that she even tore her cruciate at 6 months of age. Despite it being an anomaly, it can not/will not be covered because it happened before my waiting period. I argued although I havent held the policy for 6 months it should be covered based on the fact that I was a responsible pet owner and purchased insurance as soon as I could for her. Despite my efforts to work with PetsBest they rejected coverage because the injury occurred before my waiting period was up. Footing me with a $6,000 surgery scheduled for the 28th and my monthly insurance payments that have not caused me any financial relief. If they cared about pets and prided themselves on their coverage they would have a heart to work with me and make things right in this rather unusual and rare situation. I fully recommend not purchasing a policy from them. Do not let their low prices hook you like they did to me. I have done some more research and came to the conclusion "Pumpkin" is a better option. They are more expensive, but from what I have seen all of their waiting periods are shorter and they have less things excluded.
title: Do NOT buy PetsBest Insurance

text:
One understands that a 20% copay kicks in once the deductible has been reached.  I.e., for a $1300 vet bill with a $1000 deductible and 20% copay, the insurance payout should be:  
(1300-1000) x 0.8 = $240.  

Not by PetsBest math.  

PetsBest applies that copay to the entire bill.  I.e., the customer pays the deductible AND an additional 20% on those deductible dollars.  So in the above example the payout is:
((1300 x 0.8) -1000) x 0.8) = $32.  

In effect, this makes the copay $1250 as not a single payment will be made before (vet bill x 0.8) > $1000.  

Hard to believe, but true.  This was our actual calculated experience.  

Nowhere on the website is this unusual calculation and interpretation of copay/deductible explained.  We are not renewing our policy after this year and strongly recommend against others falling victim to PetsBest math.
title: PetsBest math is deceptive

text:
I'm not exaggerating when I say that Pets Best is hands-down the WORST company I have ever had the displeasure of dealing with. After several claims, I have NEVER had a SINGLE claim resolved without an astonishing level of incompetence and significant commitment of my time and effort to resolve. Pets Best has a strategy of deliberate negligence and incompetence that is designed to dodge their responsibilities and discourage customers from pursuing legitimate claims. 

Here are some examples of the kinds of experiences you can expect from Pets Best:
*Mixing up the details of claims that were submitted separately, and being unable to separate them again, leading to a chain of subsequent mistakes, lost threads and erroneously closing claims without payment
*Losing claims
*Not responding to claims in the period of time required by state insurance regulations nor the timeframes set out in PetsBest's own documents
*Strict refusal to put anything in writing when explicitly requested
*Refusing to tell customers what documentation is needed to resolve a claim to make it easier to decline payment
*Giving different information in writing than what was unambiguously stated on the phone
*Not responding to requests for additional information
*Multiple other practices that qualify as acting in bad faith according to California insurance regulations

Here is just one of many stories that give you a sense of how this company operates: Six weeks after submitting a claim (PB promises claims take 15-30 days to process), I received an email notifying me that Pets Best was having trouble reaching my vet for medical records. I called my vet (a small practice with only 2 doctors and an office manager), and found out that the office person was on vacation. I made arrangements to call back, and didn't notify PB of the steps taken because I know from experience that they don't read their emails and the phone queue is in excess of 1 hour. A little over a week later, ON THANKSGIVING DAY, I got another email from PB again requesting my assistance in reaching my vet. I responded the same day with a description of the steps I'd taken, the reason for the delay, and when they could expect a response. The following night (i.e. the Friday after Thanksgiving) at 9:58pm Pacific time, I got notification from PetsBest that they had closed the case and wouldn't be honoring my claim on the grounds of lack of response. I called them first thing Monday (by which time I had the documentation they needed), and it took 90 minutes on hold plus another hour on the phone to get them to reopen the case. Then it took them more than two weeks (more time than they gave me) and a threat of legal action to get them to approve the claim. Every single claim I have submitted has met with similar levels of incompetence, poor business practices and negligence. The people on the phone are sweet as pie and slick as used car salesmen.

I would NOT recommend PetsBest to anyone under any circumstances. Pass it on.

Edit: In response to the the comment below - You expect me to share personal info over the public internet?! Are you joking? Do you want my SSN and mother’s maiden name too? Boneheaded judgement and lack of common sense like this is what leads you to be such an ineffective company that can’t solve basic administrative problems. The above is a real complaint from a real customer; I couldn’t make this stuff up. You can verify the circumstances by searching support emails using this (my maiden) name, or ask Gina Carter or Penny, who should both be familiar with the situation.
title: By far the worst customer experience of my life

text: I have my Cavalier King Charles Spaniel, Daisy, on the BestBenefit Plan and it has most certainly paid for itself so far. Daisy was diagnosed with a luxating patella in March 2020 (exam and diagnosis was covered), and I was told it is in her best interest to get a surgery consult by an orthopedic specialist. In July 2020, she had her evaluation and it was confirmed that she would need surgery (surgery consult was also covered). Daisy finally had her knee surgery for Grade III Patellar Luxation in November 2020, which to my pleasure, was also covered by her plan. The overall cost of Daisy’s diagnosis, surgery consult and the surgery itself was around $3,320. In total, I’ve only paid about $550 out of pocket for all of this, which has saved me from financial turmoil. I highly recommend Pets Best, as it is super easy to submit a claim, they fairly evaluate each claim per your pet’s plan and the coverage options are better than any other company! Truly incredible.

text:
I have been a long-time customer and, unfortunately, my pets are too old to start again with another company.  I am now paying almost $1700/ annually for one of my pets with a multi-pet discount. 

Years ago, calling customer service was a seamless process and reimbursement was sent within days. Now, reimbursements take forever and I have currently been on hold to speak to a customer representative for over half and hour.  You   can only blame Covid for so long. With multiple pets, the insurance is necessary, but I would never use this company for any pets going forward.
title: Steady Deterioration in Service

text:
I cannot fully express what a blessing and relief having Pets Best Insurance was to me when I needed it. My cat suddenly came down with Chronic Kidney Disease and the course of discovery and treatment cost a fortune. The only thing that made me feel like I was able to take the steps to take care of him and get him well again was that I had insurance.

The Pets Best site made it easy for me to upload what felt like an endless stream of bills and invoices onto the site for approval and after the approval process I was given clear breakdowns of what was being covered. It saved my finances and my cats life knowing that I had this support.

I have watched many of my friends and family forced to put a price cap on the care of their pets when I know they would have preferred otherwise and I completely understand that pain, but it was a huge relief to know that there would be some support to get me though those expenses.

I have recommended insurance to everyone I know who has a pet and I will continue to do so and advocate for the amazing support I received from Pets Best.

My only actual complaint was the app is far harder to manage and use for filing claims, its often better and clearer to use the website directly. Make sure to educate yourself on coverages and know what you are getting and why. I had Accident & Illness which was key to my cats support.
title: More peace of mind than I can ever describe.
