text: Well if I had to leave a rating on how Pets Best coverage worked with me as far as what my plan is and how they covered it, it was great and I would have gave it a 5 star. But when it comes to customer service and waiting to see if something is covered, or trying to speak to a person on the phone I would rate it a negative 1 star if I could. When you call Pets Best, just plan on getting in a workout or watch a movie and keep it on speaker phone because you will be waiting a very long time on hold listening to "elevator music". They will take about a month or longer to process your claim even though you did everything electronically and sent veterinarian invoices in right away, it doesn't matter. Just one example, I sent in all the necessary bills and documentation from my dogs surgery on September 29, 2020 and the next day it showed Pets Best receiving the claim. I just received my reimbursement from them on November 3, 2020. I couldn't even blame it on "snail mail" because everything is set up electronically for "faster and more convenient service" Also Pets Best advertises a "more convenient " pay directly to your veterinarian . This is a joke, nothing simple or convenient about it. I tried with my vet and it was such a big hassle that I had to cancel the process and pay the bill myself and wait the 35 days for reimbursement . My vet did everything they had to do, not only faxing the bill directly to Pets Best, but also calling Pets Best about payment. When my vet was told payment to them could be at least 30 days or more, they were not too happy with that and told me that my bill would remain as outstanding and charged interest if not payed in 30 days. So I didn't take the chance and paid my bill in full and waited the 30 plus days for my reimbursement. Anyhow, when all said Pet Insurance is the way to go and it will save you money in the long run. Pets Best did cover everything laid out in my plan and I still would recommend them for that reason, but you must have a lot of patience because their customer service / processing sucks!
title: Coverage great , customer service not!

text: After significant research, I enrolled our family's 9-year old pomchi for Pets Best earlier this year and I'm happy I did. The claims processing period was around 4 weeks, which was a bit longer than expected but understandable given the pandemic. I received the reimbursement via direct deposit shortly after approval, net of the deductible and co-pay. In short, I am very satisfied with the service I received and will continue to use Pets Best for my pet insurance needs.

text:
I honest believe all these reviews were written by fake reviewers they paid. 

I got pets best when I got my kitten in July. 
I called and they told me the insurance is active and I can start going to vets. I took him in for vaccines. It ended up being not covered because I gotta wait 7 days before I can visit vets. 

Then the month after I took him in for another vaccine because he's only 6 weeks old he had 3 vaccines planed. Nothing was covered again except for $20 out of my $300 bill. 

And then they said my vaccine claimable amount has reached its limit even tho the plan I bought for $40 a month is supposed to not have a limit. Oh also, $40 a month they don't cover accidents or illness, or examination fees, or pretty much anything.  It's literally more expensive than any of the top 10 pet insurance you can find on review sites. I only got them because I thought Progressive was a large reputable company so maybe their pet insurance is good. NOPE!

They cover nothing, and when I asks for refund they said they can give me a pro-rated refund, meaning they'll refund me the money they haven't charged me yet for the month after if I had cancel before my next payment. What a huge scam!!!

DO NOT GET THEIR INSURANCE!!!!

You pay your vet bill upfront and then submit them for reimbursement. Every single time I have done this over the last 2 years, it has taken them almost two months to reimburse me. Recently I submitted a bill from a sick visit for my puppy that totaled roughly 350$. It has been over 4 weeks, and I still have not received any correspondence regarding the claim except that it has been received. However in that 4 week period my premium became due so I ended up shelling out another $400 to Pets Best, even though they owe me $315 from the claim. When I call to inquire about the claim I am told that they are understaffed due to the pandemic. This may be the case now, but this delay was happening well before the pandemic hit. title: They we're very efficient when it came…

text:
I got this policy, because of other great reviews and compared to other insurances, it seemed like they had the least wait period and had no lifetime limits. I paid $599 & some change for a 6-MONTH policy. My dog needed extraction for an abscess, which cost $692. With pet insurances, you pay UP FRONT COSTS directly to the vet and then I guess IF your claim gets APPROVED, after paying your deductible on top of what you’ve already paid for the policy, you will get some reimbursement (which most likely will not cover all the extra bs miscellaneous costs that vets charge.)  HOWEVER, the disclaimer comes with a long list and the statement IF IT GETS APPROVED. If I had money to pay up front, there is NO REASON for me to NEED this insurance!! 
I also know it’s the pandemic, so they took about a month to tell me my claim was DENIED. Their reason is that my dog needed cleaning for at least 13 MONTHS, but even the website says they don’t cover pre-existing conditions & periodontal disease. I’m not sure about anywhere else but in the state of FL, the biggest issue in pets is periodontal disease. Long story short, they PROVED to me that insurances are SCAMS. A guy recently posted that because his dog had a preexisting condition & fell, it wasn’t covered either. I’m really NOT sure why I pay insurances for. If I just saved the money I paid into it, I would never need them. I think all insurances just want our money but they really don’t want us to use them. That’s how they profit. It’s sad that pets are being profitted too and it’s even more sad that animals get abused, abandoned, & euthanized simply because they can’t afford expensive vet bills and insurances they can’t use. I recommend saving your money for emergency funds, visit non-profit vet hospitals instead of wasting it on unnecessary insurance that you can’t use when you need it. Believe me, I don’t want to use it and I hope to never need it, but to deny conditions that you know is prevalent in these animals is really “clever.” Bottom line: DON’T WASTE YOUR MONEY & TIME, because insurances are a SCAM. They don’t really want you to use it. Sadly, they do not care about your pets; they just want your money like the rest of insurance companies.
title: Do NOT waste your time & money! Save emergency funds; insurance companies do not care about you or your pets

text:
INTRO:

I try to never write negative reviews, but this just has to be presented at least so they can make some changes, if possible. I can’t give too low of a rating because I have had good experiences overall, but in this new year it’s really been tough for me to see any of the prior positives.   

BACKGROUND:

I’ve been paying this insurance for a few years now, and honestly it was great. I didn’t file many claims, if any really, and the ones I did file got handled well. In truth, I spent more on the premium then I spent at the Vet. But that’s how it is with insurance sometimes; so no harm no foul.

MIXED EXPERIENCE: 

Until this year, when our pup got sick. Calling for a rep takes over an hour every time! If you don’t believe it you can literally just call the line yourself. Walk away for 10 min and for the most part expect to hear the elevator music still playing when you get back. I get it, a lot of places are short staffed, but that just means treating your customers in a positive manner and making them feel like they matter when you are able to finally get to them. Needless to say my claims kept getting closed (denied) simply because they say they can’t read it. Decided to get more documentation from the Vet, and walked a representative through everything. A few weeks later checked and it was closed again specifying inability to read. How is that possible when we spoke and everything was agreed upon?!

Called them back again to ask about this and literally, in oh so many words, got told “go figure it out it’s not on us”. Wow. I’m not sure what was happening with the rep that day, but waiting for a rep for an hour and to be talked to in such a manner was horrendous! Asked to speak to a supervisor and was told in many words, “Yeah, sure someone might call you in a few days, need anything else?” Another WOW! Also, never did get that call back, so I gave it another shot and got a rep that truly was positive and I really appreciate her assistance, and also putting in a note about my last experience. I hope we can get back to a good place.

MOBILE APP:

The mobile app is basically a browser, maybe? It’s not the most intuitive, but it’s functional so it’s whatever. 

FINAL THOUGHTS:

May be worth a try, but be very wary of the things that were outlined in my experience since it seems that it is a reoccurring theme with a few of the negative reviews.


 Also, I did enjoy my experience with two reps Penny and Shea. I hope they are well taken care of! They are assets to the company.
title: Some truths that I’ve experienced

text:
I purchased pet insurance 2 months ago with Pets Best because of good reviews online. I submitted my very first claim on July 6th, 2020. When I checked my claim status online two weeks later, it showed "waiting on vet info".  Thinking that my vet had not submitted the requested information to allow for claim processing, I called my vet to inquire.  It turned out that they had submitted the requested information. Just in case, I requested the vet to submit it again. Then, I called Pets Best to ask about my claim, waited for almost an hour, and was still not connected to an agent. So then, I decided to use the internet chat option in hope for a faster response.  I still had to wait 45 minutes before finally being connected to an agent. The agent told me that it will take up to 25 days to complete the claim and advised me to call back by the end of July.  
Today is August 4th, 2020, I checked my claim status again and it still showed "waiting on vet info". I called Pets Best again today and this time I used 2 different forms of communication, at the same time, (by phone and by internet chat). I was waiting for over an hour on both platforms. Finally, I was connected to an agent on the phone, but online chat was still no response. While I was waiting on the phone, the automated system said "claim will take up to 25 days", but this agent told me that it will take up to 39 days. That being said, I have to wait for another week.
I am very disappointed that a simple office visit claim would take so long to complete. My previous pet insurance took 3 to 5 business days, the longest claim took 2 weeks. If it should take this long again for my next claim, I will be sure to cancel my policy with Pets Best.
title: I purchased pet insurance 2 months ago…

I must say this insurance is A1 and so far so good!!!!!!!

In addition, their support people have always supported me and my pets, and I especially like their latest addition of free vet / vet tech advice which I have used several times and been very happy with. This year, the time it takes to deal with claims has gotten very long compared to the past but, for us, that hasn't been a problem. For all these reasons, I highly recommend this company.

text: While I appreciate the flexibility and coverage of Pets Best, as well as the ease of submitting and monitoring claims, I'm extremely disappointed in the excessive wait times and illogical process for deciding premiums. It's taken months for claims to be completed and many of my responses went unreplied to. My premiums were dramatically increased for a pet with no claims outside the yearly check up, and if that continues every year, the insurance price will soon be unmanageable. I expected premiums to be based on age categories, not increased dramatically each year.

text: I would say a year ago I would have given them five stars. I always feel their reimbursements are fair. I'm not sure why the other reviewers felt there was a problem with that. You get back what the policy you picked stipulates. I have had some appeals and after the appeals I get either a great answer or a reimbursement. I actually feel they paid for things that they could have easily denied. They have dropped to four stars because of the reimbursement wait time. I have a current appeal due to a mistake ON MY VETS part (not PetsBest) and the rep told me via phone to expect an answer in six months. That seem really excessive.  As stated by others and even PetsBest themselves if you know you have growing pains then a response to this should have already occurred. Otherwise I would still recommend them. It makes me wonder if there is a problem within the company.

text:

We can live with the nitpicking, that was expected but it too countless emails and calls.  Regretfully the pandemic the nation was hit with exacerbated an already defined slower process. Final results were ok but if I had not been a pain in their *** I suspect it would be extended for months. I can't say in the end I did not get paid but they tried.

Customer service is friendly and efficient but other than that I would no longer recommend Pets Best to anyone who asks my opinion on pet insurance. The premiums go up exponentially every year. They tell me it's because my pets are older... they are not puppies anymore but at 5 years old (when the premiums really started to increase) I would not call that elderly. It's almost not affordable anymore even with modifying my policy every year to cover less and less. 
Claims used to be fairly quick and easy (submit online, hear back within 2-3 weeks). However, now it is taking months to get a claim processed. I am not sure what happened with this company but I wish I had researched more before signing on with them. Now I'm "stuck" with them because any condition my pets have now will be considered a pre-existing condition and won't be covered.

The one time I needed to use the insurance after waiting several months for them to process the claim they denied it. It was not a pre existing condition. It's sad to pay out all this money each month,  and have a claim not covered for things like a broken tooth my dog had fixed. When I called them and told them I wanted to cancel they didn't seem to care. They wouldn't look into anything. title: Pets Best is the real deal

text: I am a customer that has been loyal for many years with my pets.  I faithfully paid my premiums on time every month for years, never really using the benefits.  I submitted a claim for over $480 for my pet who we suspected had cancer.  Vet confirmed no cancer and did bloodwork and a biopsy.  I submitted my claim two days later.  After about a month, I followed up to see what was happening, as my claim said t was received and not processed.  I called customer service and the rep said all she could tell me is that we received it and could not say when it was going to process.  I was not happy with that answer and wanted to speak with her supervisor.  I had to leave a voice message and when the supervisor called me back, I got that it could be into April as they are behind in proceeding the claims.  Upset, I said so you can’t tell me if the claim will be processed and when.  I explained that I had been a long-time customer and if I was not able to pay my premiums for a few months that they would not keep me as a customer.  She still said she could not tell me anything else.  Mind you that I submitted the claim well before the corona virus caused companies to close and work remotely.  This agency needs to start with training their customer service and supervisors how to deal with customers-especially ones that have been loyal for years and have paid their premiums on time.  I really am not a fan of companies that act as it they are doing you a favor as the customer when it is our premiums that allow them to have jobs in the first place.  At the very least, they could have reassured me that it would be processed and I would have an idea as to how much, if any was approved.  As of now, I don’t feel as if Pets Best values me as a customer so I will be cancelling my policies effective immediately and taking my business elsewhere.
title: Dissatisfied and Unhappy Customer

I've paid more out of pocket PLUS the deductibles PLUS the portions not covered PLUS the monthly payment. The 1 time I have been reimbursed, it wasn't fully reimbursed and it took over a month to receive just partial payment. When I called to smooth this out, the lady did nothing to resolve the mistakes made on their end and instead kept apologizing in the oddest way. I thought maybe she was confused that my pet had died and I had to ask her why she was apologizing, it was an uncomfortable phone call. title: I submitted a claim for my dog on…

text:
Just 2 stars. I wish I can rate more then 2 ... I lost my buddy in April last year, painful loss for my entire family. He was covered by Nationwide (former VPI) health insurance and they do have max payoff coverage. When we rescued new pup I stated shopping around and got blinded by all good reviews and promised service. Sure enough I was on a cloud after they processed all our beginning claims in 2-4 days paying 90% as they promised. Now I back to reality - all they do ON TIME is grab your insurance payment. Everything else? Well , my last 5-6 claims delayed 15-20 days and most changed from Medical claim to Wellness claim , sure enough Wellness claims not paid because max amount already paid. I guess time to go back to Nationwide or shop around...
PS. Only real best part - phone consultations with vets , if you need urgent vet care or opinion, they really great helping you, thank you at least for that.
title: My honest review of PetsBest

text:
I'm convinced all these 5 star reviews are fake. 

This company has denied all but one claim by trying to say it was a preexisting condition. They will label ANYTHING they can as a preexisting condition just so they won't pay it. They literally told me "A lot of people get denied."

The first claim they denied is because they said that "the vet used the exact same medication to treat a UTI previously so your claim is denied now because he has a stress induced cystitis flair up."

The UTI was treated with an antibiotic and a pain killer. The cystitis a month later was treated with a pain killer so they called it the same. The vet even noted in their medical record the second one was due to stress. 

I let that go but I shouldn't have. 

A few months later, out of the blue, my same cat got blocked and I had to rush him to the vet. 

They found it was just a mucus plug. They flushed it out and had him stay in the hospital for 3 days. They prescribed him Prazosin just in case for when he went home. 

**PRAZOSIN IS COVERED IN PETS' BESTS OWN LIST OF MEDICATIONS - NO WHERE DOES IT SAY ON YOUR PAPERWORK THAT A NEW MEDICATION WILL BE DENIED FOR BEING RELATED FOR A SUPPOSED PRE-EXISTING CONDITION.** My cat has never taken this medication before!

This all came to about $1780. 

I paid $800 to the vet up front to the do the procedure and the prescription, and the vet filled out a reimbursement form for the balance because THE VET said "He had not be hospitalized before, nor had a plug before so they shouldn't have a problem reimbursing this."

It took over 30 days for any of these claims to be looked at.

LO AND BEHOLD, TODAY, EVERYTHING WAS DENIED. They told me it was a preexisting condition all because it related to the same body part. 

Yes. 

First they tell me it's because the medication was the same, now they're telling me it's because it's the same body part. 

Then they tell me if I want to dispute it, it'll take AN ADDITIONAL 60 DAYS TO BE REVIEWED. 

YES, 90 DAYS TO GET A YES OR NO. Meanwhile you're expected to make monthly payments and pay the vet because they will not wait long for their money. 

DON'T END UP LIKE ME! I'M POSTING MY REVIEW EVERYWHERE SO PEOPLE CAN SEE. I'VE COMPLETELY WASTED MY TIME AND MONEY ON THIS COMPANY.
title: YOU'RE BETTER OFF PAYING OUT OF POCKET

I would be interested in knowing if this "imbalance" has ever been addressed by your company.

title: I am glad I have finally been…

text: Going to the vet the day after getting insurance shouldn’t be considered a pre-existing condition. I got the insurance 12/29/19 and went to the vet on 12/30/19 and she got a prescription because she threw up in the car once. Obviously I want to do what’s best for my dog but I had no idea that I’d never be able to get that covered by accepting that prescription as motion sickness would forever be a “pre-existing condition” I almost wish I hadn’t brought it up at the vet as we’ve never used the prescription and now I’ll never be able to get it covered even though my coverage was “active” the day I took her to the vet. But because it was within the 14 day waiting period, she can now NEVER have Cerenia covered her entire life. I get not covering it, it was within the waiting period, but it will never be covered her entire life. We can hope she grows out of it but that’s just an absurd policy. I’ve cancelled my pet insurance and will get some elsewhere. The person on the phone said there was nothing I could do and didn’t care I was cancelling. They should at least teach their employees to have some empathy and understand that it’s an unfortunate situation. After cancelling, then someone else from the company started responding to my chat texts (which I couldn’t initially get through because I received a message that they were closed even though it was during their business hours so I then called to talk to someone instead) and she wasn’t caught up on the case at all. Such poor communication all the way around and honestly a ridiculous policy. I was given the prescription for something after I had purchased the insurance, it was just during the “waiting period” which I thought was for accidents or illnesses. I didn’t realize prescriptions were part of that as she isn’t officially diagnosed with anything, we were just being preventative for the future. It’s been two months, which is approx the time it takes to get your claim processed, and I’ve never even used the prescription. I’m aware this will be a pre-existing condition for any pet insurance company I move to, but I’d rather be with any other company after this poor experience. The easiest part of this was cancelling the plan, they didn’t care and sent the email ASAP.
title: I wouldn’t recommend

text: So far my experience with Pets Best Health Insurance has been very good.  I have 3 golden retrievers insured and had one of those "crappy" years that it just seemed like it was one thing after another.  Once my deductible was met, Pets Best started paying out.  I haven't received my check yet, I'd recommend signing up for their direct deposit option (I need to do that) to speed up the process.  The only issue I've encountered so far is getting notices that my vet hadn't responded to messages asking for records, although there are notes on my pets records indicate that they were sent.  I reached out to my vet, got the records myself and sent them and voila, we were good to go.
title: So far my experience with Pets Best has been good.

text: I currently have three K-9 kids and lost my fourth K-9 kid (Sarah) to cancer in 2018.  If it weren't for Pets Best, I would not have been able to support Sarah and give her the necessary care to fight the dreaded disease.  We fought the cancer for three years and her quality of life was good until Sarah told me it was time to send her to the Rainbow Bridge.  I attributed her beating the life expectancy for bladder cancer (6 months) because of Pets Best's support.   I will never be without pet insurance, and I've been with Pets Best for 13 years.
title: Good to Have Pets Best Watching Your Back

title: Thank you Pets Best for taking good…

text:
I used to love Pets Best - they were efficient and prompt in processing claims, 5 days or less and the money would be back in my account!  Their rates were reasonable and they were helpful when discussing claims.

Not anymore!  They are the worst insurance company I have ever dealt with!  Once a claim is submitted it takes over 30 days to get reimbursed!  I'm still waiting for payment on a claim I submitted in January 2020 (it's mid-February!) and there is no information as to why, other than "we experienced growth and are putting procedures in place to compensate". . . . they have been saying the same thing for over 2 years!!  Really?!  What does that say about management that can't get their teams up and running for over 2 years!?

I hope you never have to file an appeal!  There is no way to track it! No updates or even mention of the fact that it is under an appeal process in the claims portal and no way to know what is happening.   Why isn't this information posted in the claims section of  the portal??  And all of this for care that I have paid for over 7 years and when I finally need it I'm out of pocket for over 4 months!  I followed the policy rules for coverage and yet my claim was denied and I had to file an appeal. Oh yes, they will say that they needed more information from you, then from the vet, but no one every called or emailed me to ask for that information and my vet spoke to them and submitted a letter and then all of a sudden they need more records, so you are back to square one in the process!! Evidently there is no concept of an "ongoing case" and "supplementing documents". 

Nope - you are kicked out until the information you didn't know about is somehow produced, then they start all over at square one with the appeal process. Unbelievable!!  Now my appeal is going on 4 months and I'm out of pocket over $700 for covered care!!  It is coming to the point that my dog will be deceased before I ever receive any reimbursement and I cannot afford additional care without being reimbursed!!  

So much for their claims "With any pet insurance policy from Pets Best, you can rest assured that you will receive exceptional coverage, personal customer service, and fast and accurate claim processing."  And their claim to prevent economic euthanasia - not here!!
title: I used to love Pets Best -- Not anymore!

text:
I am so disappointed with Pets Best;they sold me a policy in bad faith. I was deciding between PB, and Trupanion. When I spoke to the PB representative, I explained that my puppy had 2 issues, that cost a lot of money, and that is why I wanted to get pet insurance.  I was upfront about every detail; I was told that as long as it doesn't happen again, in the first 3 days, after signing up, we would be covered.  Unfortunately he had to have surgery within the first month, and they denied my claim, stating something that was never sent to me, until after I signed up with them.  
One of their selling points was that they settle all claims, within one week; it took months for the first claim.  Then they said, that the first claim can take longer, but all claims after will be with 1 week.

I asked why they didn't pay a different claim, which they said was direct deposited (I never gave them my bank info, or signed up for direct deposit (another lie).  I have one more pending claim, from 1/12, which is going on 5 weeks; still haven't heard anything.

I emailed them, outlining all the above, in great detail, and asked what they are going to do, to restore my faith in Pets Best. GUESS WHAT - NO RESPONSE .  They haven't paid one single claim, but they had no problem billing my credit card, for the 2nd payment.

I also told them to listen to their phone recording, so they can hear exactly what I disclosed, and the reply I got, from their representative. I write a lot of GOOD reviews; this is not the norm for me, to complain about a company. This is justified.
 STAY AWAY FROM PETS BEST
title: I am so disappointed with Pets…

text: I highly recommend Pets Best. We had multiple claims for our one and a half year old dog who became ill and needed lots of testing and treatment, including a several nights' hospital stay. Pets Best responded quickly to our claims (in some cases saying they needed a little more time, but they kept us posted, which I appreciated), and they covered everything that our benefits policy said they would. It was a really smooth process from start to finish, and we received checks within a few weeks of submitting our claims. Also, several times throughout our dog's illness I called Pets Best with questions, and I always got a person on the phone--not a series of automated questions!--who was helpful and friendly. When we thought our dog might need surgery, someone helpfully talked me through the pre-approval process.

I submitted a claim on Jan 11th. Had to submit clearer photos and receipt again on the 13th (after I called to confirm status, NO ONE reached out saying I needed anything). I get a random email on the 24th stating the generic "We are experiencing longer times for claim processing". How much freaking time do you need? You sure aren't delayed in taking your payment every month. 

I call again today Jan 31st for a status up. They say now the processing times is 30-40 days out.

text:
Before this past month, we were highly satisfied with PetsBest and I went so far as referring others to this company for their pets.  Our previous claims' turnaround time was 2-7 business days, for 2 years.  Imagine my surprise when a window of more than triple that appeared, after a 20% increase in our premium the month before.  The LiveChat feature also appears to be down at this time (perhaps due to the overwhelming number of clients in the same position).  Please tell me when we can expect a return to normalcy and fast processing by your company.  And if the answer is unknown, you will continue losing customers.

P.S. I'd rather receive no reply than a copied and pasted:
We apologize about the delay. Your claim and your pet are important to us. This isn't normal for our company to take this long, and I promise it is not intentional.... etc.
title: Recent claims issues

text:
UPDATE: They always reply "we are growing so fast, that's why claims are taking so long to process". You know what fast growing companies do to solve that problem? They HIRE MORE PEOPLE!!! You have been peddling this lie about growing so large since November 2019. Are you telling me you haven't been able to hire any additional people since that time? PetsBest are LIARS and fraudsters. 
--------

Awful, awful, awful. I signed up with the promise of fast claim processing. Several months into our policy we finally had to file a claim. It's been 32 days and last week they said it would take 45-55 days to process. Today they said it would be 45-60 days. When I check in next week will it be 45-65 days?

They say they can't process claims fast enough because they are "growing so fast" - well then they should have the resources to hire a couple more people to process claims.

Like others, I would love to change carriers but because of pre-existing condition rules, that would not be possible at this point.

Do the best for your pet and AVOID Pets Best.

But as the year comes to a close, i am watching my bank account dwindle as Pets Best sits on my claims for weeks. I don't know if it's an end-of-the year thing or a new management thing but i hope it gets resolved soon. I have stopped recommending Pets Best to anybody who will listen. title: The worst

text:
we recently moved to the US from another country. Took out cat insurance for our cat - took one of the most expensive policies so the only thing that wouldn’t be covered were pre-existing conditions and routine checks. Our claim was denied because “Additional information was required to process this claim. After numerous requests, we were unable to obtain records from your veterinarian. Your claim
can be reviewed upon resubmission of the claim with required medical records.” My issue with this is that we were not once contacted by Petsbest. I reached out to them on a chat since it took a long time for my claim to be processed. They said they needed my to send as much information about my cat’s medical history (which was in another country up til now) so I did and sent them everything immediately via email. I never got a reply and asked them for an update a couple of weeks later and they said they were sorry for the delay and will get back to me ASAP - which they didnt, I just got this denial. What is really wrong is that they send the denial THE DAY AFTER they took my payment for the next month, which seems really wrong. I also feel that they should not trick people into buying insurance and AFTER paying for several months telling them it could be an option that they cannot insure their pet. This should be checked or confirmed before having people pay. So I have not ONCE been contacted by Petsbest but they do denial my claim because they tried contacting us numerous times? It is impossible that they tried to reach our vet since they do not have her contact info. Communication is REALLY bad here and I would advise anyone to look elsewhere for pet insurance.

EDIT: Reply to Petsbest reply:
We were not once contacted by Petsbest so I do not know how they can state "we request". I reached out to them on multiple occasions myself since it took them a long time to process my claim. During a chat I explained them that I would send them all information that I have, which I did. After that I sent a follow up email and they said they were working on my claim. Not ONCE have they requested more information or did they even request contact info for our previous vet. They are a lazy company and they do not communicate with their customers ... They prefer to leave the customer hanging for +- 2 months and then, without any sort of communication or cooperation from their side, deny the claim.
title: Really bad experience

text: I recently filed a claim with Pets Best Insurance. They denied my claim, stating there was a 14 day grace period for injuries. My dog injured her leg approximately a week after the policy went into affect. I look at my policy that they sent me and it clearly states a 3 day grace period for injuries. I was seeking reimbursement for the pain medication prescription, which was also covered under my policy. They denied my claim. There was no disputing this claim, as the girl just kept reading me obviously a written denial letter. Nothing but a scam insurance company. They gladly accept your monthly payments, but when it's time to pay a claim, they find every excuse to get out of paying a claim. Wish I had read the Yelp Reviews on this company before purchasing insurance, they only have a 2 star rating, I wouldn't give them that much credit!!
title: Terrible pet insurance

text: Honestly, if I could give 6 stars, I would!! title: My dog has been on a plan with Pets…

text:
******************************************Edited************************************

My November claim showed a processing time of 20 days.  My most recent claim shows a processing time of 30 days. THIRTY DAYS. Not quite the 2-3 days as promoted on their own website!!!!

I will keep updating my reviews in hopes to keep others from falling for the false claims (no pun intended) made by this company:  

"We apologize about the delay. Your claim and your pet are important to us. This isn't normal for our company to take this long, and I promise it is not intentional. We have experienced an overwhelming amount of growth in our business that was not expected and are currently processing more claims than we could have ever anticipated. I understand this is not your fault, but we are working really hard to get back up to speed, and we appreciate your business as we work towards that goal."

If this statement were true, this lame and patently false canned message would have disappeared months ago. They are not working hard to get back up to speed, they are not hiring new employees. They are trying to save costs. As for the recent 5 star two day claim processing time, I call bullcrap. They are planted reviews to try and bring the rating up. 

This business was bought out by Synchrony. Synchrony is NOT in the insurance business. They are a financial service company. They offer retail credit cards and not surprisingly, pet care credit. Synchrony doesn't give a rats butt about anything but taking your money and then dragging their time when paying out claims. 

____________________________________________________________________________

What happened? Greed?

Before 2019, claims processing took 2-3 days MAXIMUM. Now it's up to 20 days. What's up with that? The main reason we started with Pets Best over 10 years ago was because of the turn around time and excellent customer service. Now it seems like the company just wants to hold on to your money and make interest on it instead of focusing on customer service. 20 days for a routine claim???? 

When it's time to insure a new pet, you can bet your bippy that we will NOT be going with Pets Best. 

Hopefully the employees are at least getting raises with some of the money they are keeping to accrue interest.
title: What's up Pets Best?

text:
Very disappointed with the service of claims. As others have stated it takes them forever to process a claim and do not follow up with you on the status. My first claim for routine visit was processed very quickly, however, my second claim for testing to diagnose a possible kidney problem is taking forever. I too had problems chatting on line with someone so I called to get the status of claim. I was told it was taking longer than usual because of the amount of claims and that it would probably take another 5 days. After 5 days heard nothing and when I checked the status online it said waiting for vet info. They never informed me of needing additional information and this was after they had the claim 2 to 3 weeks. I figured I would give it a couple of days to get. I called again for status and asked if they had received info needed and was told not yet. Contacted my vet and they had no record of receiving a request so they emailed me my cats medical records and I forwarded them to Pets Best. I called next day to see if it was received and they told me I used the wrong email. While the person was on the phone, I emailed again and they confirmed they received and they would review and have the results for me in 10 days. I said it takes 30 days to review a claim for a pet? A human being gets faster results. Was told if a routine office visit the claim is processed quickly. If claim is not for routine visit it takes longer to review medical records. Need to make sure it's not a pre-existing condition. My cat is 2 years old and received him from a shelter at 7 weeks. The shelter certified his health condition before they released him. Well it's been 5 or 6 days and have heard nothing. Emailed claims and asked for a status and no response. Do you think I'm a little perturbed or alot perturbed? 

Updated. Pets Best needs to read their comments on their home page why fast claim processing is important. It states claims are processed within 7 to 10 business days. Does not mention a difference between routine and medical issue claims. It also goes on to say imagine if you paid two thousand for the visit and it took long to get the claim processed. Additional costs can occur for the owner due to interest on charge cards and financial hardships due to checking account  balances. Seems false and misleading information being provided by Pets Best.

Updated: it has now been 38 days and nothing from PetsBest. As you read the comments from PetsBest it could take up to 40 days to process a claim. Now they tell me 45 days. Seems because they needed medical records for additional testing to confirm if my cat had stage 2 kidney disease my claim was pulled from the process and I'm starting all over again. Contacted BBB and unfortunately they said there was nothing they could do if this is company policy. I also spoke to a manager who promised she would pull my claim and try to expedite as a "favor for me", but all she did was lie. She has done nothing to assist with this issue. According to her they use no tracking system for claims. They do not keep records of what date claims are received but they take them as them are received,  where you fall in the process for claim being processed so they can tell you there are 30 more before yours, how many claims they have but I was told thousands of new claims were received, they cant track how old your claim is from the date received, etc etc etc. A business that has no tracking system of their claims is bad. They dont seem to track them from what they call routine visit claims and medical claims and they consider testing as medical even though my cat had tests done for his yearly physical and it had been reviewed and closed in a timely manner. This claim is just a continuation of those tests but he has a serious medical claim according to the information provided to the BBB. If I could give a negative rating I would. Claim is supposed to be completed by end of this week. Let's see if that happens. I dont put much faith into anything they say or do.

text:
We are generally "ok" with Pets Best time to process claims and our receipt of claim payments.

We are not "ok" and do not like Pets Best policy provisions regarding the processing of charging us coinsurance costs BEFORE our Deductible is fulfilled for the year.  All this does is lengthen the amount of time it takes to fulfill our Deductible and therefore costs us more money out of pocket.  

When researching our concern, we found that the policy provision language in our documents are vague in regard to clearly communicating the timing of when coinsurance is to be charged to us (i.e., charging coinsurance during the dime we are filling our Deductible or only after we have fulfilled our Deductiible).  When we brought this up to the company via their Service Department, the Department obviously did not care.

If we had realized Coinsurance was to be charged at the same time that the Deductible was being fulfilled WE WOULD HAVE NOT PURCHASED THIS PLAN.

text:
As my family just passes the one-month mark of losing our dog, Ovie, I wanted to take a moment to thank Pets Best Insurance for all that you had helped us with concerning his care.
Here is a synopsis of Ovie's last year of life.  Early September 2018, we noted that Ovie was having trouble seeing.  Our local vet diagnosed him with diabetes & diabetic cataracts during an after-hours call.  And you were there to help cover the costs.  Later that month he found his way to UW Veterinary Care’s ER because of his extensive eye irritation (& ultimately blindness) that his local vet was not treating.  He then became a patient of UW Veterinary Care’s ophthalmology department.  And you were there to help cover the costs.  We changed veterinary clinics & continued to adapt to our new way of life.  And you were there to help cover the costs of insulin, syringes, testing supplies & medications.  In January 2019, our new vet determined that Ovie was not responding appropriately to Vetsulin.  She was uncomfortable converting him to NPH insulin & we were referred to UW Veterinary Care’s internal medicine department.  We began seeing them in March 2019.  And you were there to help cover the costs.   During his first internal medicine appointment, an ultrasound was completed due to his frequent diarrhea.  That ultrasound found that he had a liver mass.  Initially, we were resistive to putting Ovie through further interventions, as he had two past TPLOs prior to being covered by your company as well as a neck injury.  I worried about him being a high surgical risk due to his multiple co-morbidities.  Also, I didn’t understand that the type of cancer they suspected was growing inside his liver was hepatocellular carcinoma.  Nor did I understand that this type of cancer can be curative with surgical intervention.  After much reading & discussion with UW Veterinary Care’s oncology & internal medicine departments, we came to realize that no intervention was as much of a death sentence as potential surgical complications.  I called your company to discuss what would be covered concerning surgery & possibly chemotherapy if they found metastases.  I will never forget how kind your representative was.  Her first statement to me was “I am so sorry Ovie is going through this”.  She assured me that his insurance plan would cover his care at his chosen 80% reimbursement.  We elected to have a liver lobectomy performed.  The week we were supposed to be having his surgical consult in June 2019, Ovie developed a GI bleed that required hospitalization.  He required multiple blood transfusions.  And you were there to help cover the costs. Come July 2019, we were moving forward with the liver lobectomy.  The liver lobectomy was successful & the tumor was resected with good margins.  We breathed a sigh of relief & focused on post-operative care.  Unfortunately, one week into recovery, Ovie developed pancreatitis.  He required numerous rehospitalizations.  Ultimately mid-August 2019, it was found that in addition to pancreatitis, he had a large liver abscess that required surgical intervention.  The abscess culture grew a multi-drug resistant E.coli that would require four weeks of subcutaneous antibiotics.  And you were there to help cover the costs.  After these long hospitalizations, we thought we were on the right path to recovery.  Unfortunately, by late August 2019, it was found that his liver infection was more extensive post abscess removal & now was growing a more virulent form of multi-drug resistant E.coli.  UW’s internal medicine team broke the news to us that Ovie would never recover & that further efforts would be medically futile.  We were never able to stabilize him enough to bring him home to pass away.  Instead UW Veterinary Care’s internal medicine veterinarian compassionately euthanized our Ovie on August 24th.  And for one final time you were there to help cover the costs. 
In total, Ovie’s medical care, medications & supplies cost nearly $50,000 for the last 10 months of his life.  We cannot thank you enough for helping us make possible to have Ovie as long as we did.   Your company made it so we could focus on him not money.  For this we will be eternally grateful.
title: No one could ask for a better pet insurance company!

text:
We've been with Pets Best Pet Insurance since 2010. We been paying $267.00 a month since Dec 2018. Now our dog's got cancer and there is a maximum per-incident in the benefit.

- Wish I had read the reviews on Yelp 1st -
I agree with Yelper Moo M of Pullman, WA . It is disheartening  the maximum per-incident claim maximums compared to the other Pet Insurance on the market.

Both my sisters are with Pets Best base on my recommendation. As soon as I realized there is a "maximum per-incident" in the benefit. I call them and they both are now with a Pet Insurance company that have "UNLIMITED per-incident " in the benefit  and lower monthly fees.

Hope this review will help someone else from making the same mistake I did.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
REPLY: 10/07/2019
I just logged into my Pets Best Pet Health Insurance account.
My account shows.
BENEFIT PLAN
$2,500 Per-Incident Limit
$750 Per-Incident Deductible
80% Reimbursement
So why do I have a $2,500 Per-Incident Limit if you NO longer offer per incident plans?
title: BEWARE of "maximum per-incident"

text:
I enrolled my rescued puppy with Pets Best insurance hoping to have peace of mind while learning how to be the “mother” of a dog for the first time.
The dog is in good condition and happy.  However, in the process of getting him neuter, the Vet fund a growth in his collar area. Initially, before the dog was insured, there was no issue with this growth, we did not even notice it was there. At that point, and after the deadline to submit claims for accidents or illness, the growth presented bleeding and needed attention before the neutering process.  I decided to take care of this surgery first and sent the growth to pathology to be analyzed.  Results were fine, he was cancer free and a happy puppy again.  I submitted claims for surgery, pathology and medicine and Pets Best denied my claims stating that this was a pre-condition of the dog.  I am paying 65 dollars every month to feel safe with my dog and after 3 months I ended up paying insurance plus Vet bills.  The costs double. Therefore, I canceled my policy with Pets Best and did not have a good first insurance experience.

text: My experience with Pets Best had up to now, always been excellent.  Therefore, I expected the same when I filed my latest claim this month.  I was still OK when about 5 days later I received an email stating that there was a delay in getting to my claim and that Pets Best strives to have claims resolved within 5 days but there was a higher than average volume of claims which was slowing things down.  So now that it has been 2 more weeks from that email, I called Pets Best to see what was going on.  The representative who took my call stated that my claim was undergoing a review process and the time frame is 30-40 days!!  OK, this is news to me.  I did not get a satisfactory answer upon further questioning.  I received responses such as:  "...maybe for cancer conditions there are a finite number of reviewers and this might be what the hold up is...", and   "...all I can say is there is a 30-40 day pre-processing time which means you may not hear anything until Sept 11th to Sept 21st".   When I asked how long it would be AFTER the "pre" review/processing before I would know about my claim being resolved, I was told between Sept 11th and Sept 21.  That doesn't make sense because that is supposed to be the PRE-review/processing time, so how could the real review/processing time be completed at the same time as the PRE-review/processing time?  My opinion of Pets Best has gone down more than a few notches.
title: Speaking in circles

text:
When my 7 year old dog jumped off a high bed in the spare bedroom, she injured herself. The vet said it maybe, note maybe, a sign of disc generation. No x-rays were taken, just a maybe. But because maybe the injury was due to disc generation, Pets Best refused to pay out as maybe she would not have injured herself if there was maybe no disc generation. Of course, maybe there is no disc generation and she just jumped off wrong, but they'd rather go with the, maybe the injury would rather go with the option that saves them from paying out. Of course dogs get more frail as they get older, and will get injured easier, it does not make it any less an injury. So be sure to only insure young animals, of course, if they are too young, maybe they wouldn't have gotten hurt if there bones were stronger. You never know.
---
Firstly, if it is as you say that the reason the claim was not paid out because her injury was not one of the 8 VERY specific types of accidents my dogs have insurance for, then why blame it on possible disc degeneration when you first told me you won't cover  the claim?
Secondly, I wish you made the policy as clear cut and simple as your above explanation, then I would not have gotten the mistaken impression that my dogs have insurance against accidental injuries. I realize now that the way it is worded, they are not covered for most of the types of injuries I thought of when purchasing the insurance. But my bad, I should have read the contract better.
Thirdly, don't say you give us peace of mind. My dogs only being covered for 8 types of injuries when there are so many ways they can get injured, does not provide me with peace of mind. I'm opening a saving account where I will deposit the money I would have paid to you and start building that. That way, regardless of the injury, and whether there may be other factors at play or not, they are covered - THAT is peace of mind - just so you know.
title: Old dogs' injuries don't count, they're old + response to insurer's reply

text:
This is a HORRIBLE company. I signed up for them early on May 9 because my dog's previous insurance associated with her vet's office was too expensive. Of course, the moment this previous policy expired, something cut her paw while on a walk. She had to be taken to the vet the same day that I signed up for her new insurance policy with Pets Best. I had no idea if I would be needing them or not, but I was hoping that no matter what she would be covered that day. I got my bill at the end of the day and told my vet about the new policy and they gave me the documents to submit for a reimbursement. I filed a claim and TWO MONTHS LATER, I am still getting the runaround. I emailed the company and they rather rudely said that my policy didn't actually take effect until THREE DAYS after May 9. So I said that was not transparent of them and they condescendingly explained to me "how insurance works" and said some policies don't take effect that day. Being a grown woman, I told them I understood that and that I was simply telling them that that isn't transparent because if that was in the front facing message or the main message given to me the day I signed up, I would have canceled it. I'm canceling my policy just for the sheer fact that the person emailing is rude. Go anywhere else, I know I am.

*Response to comment* No, you are not transparent. You cannot provide proof that these policies are FRONT FACING for new customers because they are not. I have proof of that. Furthermore, you cannot find me in your system because I canceled policy due to the extreme ridiculousness of your customer service.
title: This is a HORRIBLE company

text:
When I first started using Pets Best I was quite happy with them.   I have three Olde English Bulldoggees that each have their own issues when it comes to their health.   

Our male has had skin issues his entire life, so I have not tried to file a claim with the insurance company when it comes to his skin flaring up.   Several months ago, he was diagnosed with a double ear infection.   His ears were cleaned out and he was put on meds to help clear up the infections.   While I was at the vet, they informed me that they had a new shot that they could give him to help with his skin issues and allergies that he suffers from.   I decided to try it to see if it would help his allergies.   In the meantime, I sent a claim into Pets Best for his ear infections.   The receipt from the vet also included the meds given to him for his allergies.   Pets Best denied my claim.   I appealed the claim by sending in all information requested by Pets Best including the original invoice, the appeals form and a letter from my vet stating that the ear infections were NOT caused by his allergies.  Pets Best denied the claim again, stating they never received the letter from the vet.   

Again, I appealed the denial, and again I submitted the paperwork required - the original invoice, the appeal letter and the letter from my vet.   This time I requested confirmation that all was received and that if they didn't receive the letter to let  me know.  I never heard anything back, until today.   A letter came in the mail and denied our claim AGAIN!!!

Let me just say, that I am extremely happy that I had decided to cancel my policy effective July 1, 2019 and switch carriers.   I am very disappointed in the service that we have received and will NOT recommend this company ever again.
title: Disappointing Experience

text:
Horrible company. Their policy clearly states that a pre-existing condition is one that occurred in the 12 months prior to the policy issuance. I purchased a policy for my Dog in February 2019. The only thing that happened in the 12 months prior was a ACL replacement (TPL). When he was younger he did have skin allergies, but they were controlled with immunotherapy prior to 2014. In May he had a mysterious skin infection. They denied $435 of his treatment and accepted $22 towards deductible and said it was pre-existing. They tried to tell me how they did accept some on the phone. This is hilarious. These guys are clowns. In no way is it pre-existing as he has not received any treatment for skin related issues since prior to 2014. I will be reporting these scam artists to the state insurance board. They are not to at all trustworthy.

Update: In response to Pet's Best. It is clearly stated in your policy documents, which I have since forwarded on the the insurance board, "A. PRE-EXISTING CONDITIONS: In determining which Conditions are Pre-Existing, we look at the 18 months preceding the Policy Effective Date and exclude any Conditions that were Present during that period."

Update 2: Actually the policy is not clear. I only typed the first paragraph because I do not have time to waste retyping the whole policy. And it was not a chronic condition. It was completely cured before the end of 2014 from immunotherapy. Besides the skin infection that he just had was not definitively linked to allergies. It is of unknown origin.

Its great the responses Pets Worst is giving because it shows their true nature and how they will shaft you too.
title: Update: Pets WORST Health Insurance

text: be careful, do not take this insurance, they don’t pay anything they will find many reasons not to pay you, they will not give you a clear answer about the reason for the refusal

text: I looked at this company for pet insurance because there was an advertisement for plans as low as $6 a month for cats, $9 a month for dogs.  I know that "as low as" means there will be a larger price, but it should be a price within reason of the bottom price.  I requested a quote for accident and illness for one of my cats, I decided against wellness coverage, and the quote was $58 a month!  $58 is a huge increase when compared against the advertisement of "as low as $6 a month".  I put in my other cat's information and his was $53 a month.  Those are ridiculous quotes for one extremely healthy cat and one cat whose only issue is arthritis.
title: Quote was ridiculously high, 10x advertised amount

text: When we first started the insurance and filed a claim or 2 there were no problems. Recently I filed a claim and eventually got an email that they are sorry for taking so long (not a problem). Then I recently received an email saying they had to contact our vet for info & history on our dog. I responded to there email that I had put in the comments on the claim that the visit was for our dog and cat, however there was no charge for our dog the charge on the bill is for our cat (a follow up visit). They never responded to the email reply, then I sent them an email using there "contact us" email explaining it all again. Again they never responded. I tried their live chat, that went nowhere so I finally called, canceled the claim and our insurance. No one could give me a reason of not responding to my emails even though they claim they have wonderful customer service. Also I just found out they are not one of the 2019 best rated pet insurance companies.
title: They don't like emails?

text:
While I was meeting my deductible they were average in processing claims and being reasonable. The moment my deductible was met they were impossible. They were asking for information that didn't exist and even when I and both vets were prompt with getting them the information they wanted, they closed the claim and I had to email and call three times to get them to reopen it. Then they denied the claim even though they had approved the exact same issue when I was still meeting my deductible and there was no imminent payout. 

Here is what unfolded....

April 2 - Claim sent and confirmation received from Pets Best
April 9 - Apologies from PetsBest for the delay via email
April 17 - Email to me that Vet 1 has not provided the last 12 months of records. 
April 17 - I called Vet 1 and they told me that they had sent over the records on April 12th.
April 23 - I got an email from Pets Best that Vet 1 has not provided the last 12 months of records. 
April 24 - New email to me to request for records from Vet 1 dating June 1 to present. 
April 24 - I replied back that we have not been going to Vet 1 since May 2018. I also called the Vet 1 and they called Pets Best to say the same thing.
April 26 - I got an email from Pets best saying that the claim is closed because despite multiple attempts you could not get the records requested. Both Vet 1 and I had communicated with PetsBest that there are NO Additional records to be sent because the dogs have not been to VCA HOLLY ST since mid 2018!
April 26th - I called to communicate to PetsBest that the vet and I had both sent information about this and I was told that the email was just automated and that it had not actually been closed and that you had received the information from me and the VCA vet. 
April 29th - I get a phone call from Pets Best saying that the case has indeed been closed and the only way to have it opened is to have VET 2 send the last 12 months of records! When I asked if pets best had even contact VET 2 the answer was no.

They then denied the claim a week later saying that it was because of an observation about the dogs anatomy and they have a right to deny it now even though they paid for it before!

I am currently in the appeals process but am not optimistic based on the above. I will be taking it up with California Department of Insurance.
title: PetsBest - Just Time Wasting and Frustration

text: I knew after my last cat who died from cancer and all those vet bills I should look into pet insurance for my next cat.  Well I opted for two kittens and immediately I searched for pet insurance. I was skeptical, I admit.  I found pets best and they seemed to provide more than some others like the wellness program. I signed up. A few days later I take the kittens to their first vet appointment and submit a wellness claim. That was Tuesday, it's now Friday of the same week and I already have my reimbursement in my bank! I am absolutely thrilled! Unless something drastically changes going forward, I am sold, convinced and no longer skeptical. Love pets best!
title: Love PB

text: My french bulldog Charlie throughout all 4 years of his little life has had numerous illnesses. This past January 2019 he was diagnosed with a UTI (very rare for male dogs but that’s our luck) so after receiving treatment I decided to obtain pet insurance. This past February 209 I joined Pets Best insurance, their rates were the most reasonable and the deductible wasn’t absolutely outrageous. A few weeks later after obtaining the insurance Charlie was diagnosed with another UTI. I submitted multiple claims as we’ve had multiple revisits for check ups, urine testing, ultrasound, the works. I received notification that NONE of the services would be covered and NONE would go towards my deductible for my plan because it’s all being considered a “pre-existing” condition. I treated his UTI in January based off the antibiotics prescribed by my vet and his symptoms were completely gone when I joined the company’s policy. The policy didn’t go into effect for 7 days after obtaining and we were WELL beyond the 7 days. So for all you pet parents out there thinking about getting insurance; DO NOT go with Pets Best. I feel trapped now because anything we are currently doing for him won’t be covered by another company.
title: Not Covering New Illnesses

text:
Thank God, I haven't had to use my pet insurance yet for my healthy amost 7 years old Bolognese who come from a good healthy lineage and a pure breed.
Charlie is laid back very sheltered and an indoor pet, but he likes his walks.

I do agree with all the reviews that the customer service staff are very courteous and nice a couple of times I did call.

HOWEVER, the reason I'm giving PBI 3* because the premiums keeps going up every year eventhough we never had to make any claims yet. Charlie's premium keeps going up because of his age and more claims from other sick and accidents prone dogs was the answer given to me when I called in to ask why the premium keeps going  up.

In my opinion, that isn't fair at all to healthy dogs with zero claims so far.
I think like good grades students are given a discount on their car insurance premiums, healthy dogs should also be given a discount too for zero claims.

I hope PBI is going to consider that, and not punished all healthy pet owners. Thank you.
title: 3* for rising premiums fir a healthy and zero claims pet.

text: I would have never anticipated writing a negative review for Pets Best Insurance.  When I first got my policy for my English Mastiff, the annual fee was $476.16 (2016-2017).  Mines was a modest policy - $200 deductible, 80% reimbursement, and $5000 annual coverage.  The first year was a rough year for my dog and I took that policy right up to the $5000 annual coverage.  The service during that first year was so phenomenal that I wrote a fabulous review for Pets Best and continued the accolades by suggesting this pet insurance to anyone who would listen. The next year, the policy went up to $631.23 (2017-2018).  I assumed such a large jump was due to the amount I had claimed, but was told that was not the case.  The representative was extremely nice and explained the process.  She stated that during the puppy stage, the policy is normally higher and once he passes the puppy stage, the cost will decrease to be followed by an increase when he becomes a senior and his health is anticipated to decline.  I was fine with this explanation because it made sense.  The next year, my policy went down to $607.94 - just as the rep had predicted (2018-2019).  Imagine my surprise when I received my most recent policy renewal to a tune of $1003.71 (2019-2020).  When I called to get an explanation, the responses were just not acceptable.  The dog is 3 years old and in great shape (that is past the puppy stage, right?).  BTW, we filed no claims because there were no emergencies or big ticket items that required action.  So, "zero claims" for the policy period 2018-2019 and the reward is a policy increase of $395.77.  Thanks Pets Best!  Just don't buy the reasoning of he is still in his puppy stage where he is curious and still getting into things - when he is between the ages of 4-6 the rates will go down - after age 6 the rates will go up because he will be considered in his senior years.  Oh, okay.  Well, I have wasted enough money and time.  Needless to say, this policy will not be renewed.  This is so disappointing  and sad at the same time.  Makes me wonder what has happened to such a great company?
title: Extremely Disappointed!

text: We have been customers of Pets Best Insurance for 10 years and unfortunately my dog has been unwell for many of those years. Pet's Best will do everything they can to raise our rates and avoid payment for illnesses that cannot be 100% traced back to an illness. I have had over 90 claims (many of which were denied payment) in 10 years and when it really counts, they refuse to pay for anything else because in their words, every condition the dog now has can be traced back to his diabetes, which he got AFTER we purchased pet insurance. If you are looking for a pet insurance company that will not dupe you when it is truly needed and when a pet is truly ill, look elsewhere. There are other companies that do not have maximum payouts - when a pet gets sick the whole point of insurance is to help pay for the illness. Pet's Best (at least when I signed up) never intended to pay beyond the first couple of thousand of dollars even though my premium went from $30 per month to over $90 per month when i finally had enough. They refuse to cover anything else yet charge more and more for coverage. It truly is a shame that they really don’t care about an animals well being they only care about coming out ahead.
title: Premiums go up and benefits go down...

text: I will be updating this review in about 30 days after my appeal and will be changing my stars from 2 to either 1 or 5. My dog had a scare last year that was either sago palm toxicity or trauma leading to liver damage, they never really found out why.  Either way, I got pets best before his final follow up with his vet in which he had a mass on his head that may/may not be removed, other than that he had a clean bill of health. Ten days later I went to a different vet for a second opinion on the mass, and they told me they thought it would resolve, but if it needed to be removed it would be about 40% less than my other vet, but also that he now had an ear infection. He was treated for the ear infection and it resolved.  I didn't submit that to pets best because I knew the mass had been there for a couple months now. Two months later he has another ear infection that developed an aural hematoma requiring surgery.  They told me that since the original ear infection fell 2 days within the 14 day window that they were considering it pre-existing. I told them the definition of the word "pre-existing" is that it was there prior to me getting the policy, which it clearly wasn't since he had an exam with a vet the day after I purchased the policy. So at this point pets best has two options: do the right thing and reimburse me because the condition was indeed not "pre-existing" per the definition of the word. Or, they can use the loophole in their contract to deny the claim. I'll update after the appeal of the claim.
title: I will be updating this review in about…

text:
After getting my new puppy I spent a few days looking at several pet insurance companies. Ultimately I decided on Pets Best due to a combination of reasonable rates, wellness add-ons, and reviews. It's still a little early to tell, but it looks like I may have made a bad choice. Easily corrected by moving to a new insurer when my policy renews at the 1-year mark. 

16 days into my new policy, I took my new puppy in for his first check-up and to get shots. At the time, I also had the doctor look at his eyes which had been a little red. The doctor determined it was conjunctivitis and put him on an ointment. I submitted a claim and it was denied because sickness coverage doesn't begin until 14 days after you start your policy. I took my pup in a week and a half later because the redness didn't clear, and was again denied because the symptoms "started" before the coverage period. 

First of all, I'm not sure how they determined when the symptoms started. All I submitted were the receipts and they assumed it started before the 14-day mark. Secondly, this is not the kind of behavior I want out of my insurance company. If they keep denying claims over assumptions and other stipulations, I won't be renewing with them.
title: Its only been a month, but so far it appears they will do everything they can to deny claims

text:
I have been with Pets Best since 2011, when I adopted Cotton,  a former puppy mill resident, who had several litters of mini-Schnauzer pups over 5-6 years.  Not knowing how her health would progress, I looked into pet insurance.  Cotton was diagnosed with Diabetes Insipidus.  Later, she was diagnosed with disc issues, eventually resulting in paralysis in her hind legs.  In 2014, I also adopted another of my fosters, Precious, a 4 1/2 lb. Chi/Peke, & added her to my pet insurance.
As with everything else, the cost of pet insurance has risen.  There generally is a discount with two or more pets. Precious current monthly insurance is now $90.58, increased from $72 last year, both having a $100 deductible.  Buying insurance is always a gamble - “Will I need it?”  I am glad that I purchased pet insurance.  Great help when a major issue occurs.  Found it’s easier paying monthly rather than having to pay thousands at one time when an unexpected emergency occurs.

text:
Where do I start? If I could give less than 1 star I would. Well, my experience with this company was fine as long as I was paying my monthly dues and had no claims. 

I’ve had nothing but problems this year with them and denying claim after claim. 

I found out they needed medical records from my dogs past vet visits. We’ve taken our dog to numerous vets to try to figure out his issues. We got on the track of food allergies and did extensive testing for this. The current vet put him on a special food so it won’t trigger his immune system (this is what the vet told us). 

Ok, that problem solved. He did fine on that food until he got an infection and was put on antibiotics. This was August of this year (2018). He’s been back numerous times for itching, licking, etc. amoungst other non allergy issues. The claims were getting denied  left and right. They denied the whole claim, what was thought to be allergy related or not. I finally contacted them and asked what the problem was for these getting denied. They were STILL wanting medical records. I asked them if I needed to go get them and submit them and was told over and over they would get them to just give the name of the vet office and they would take care of the rest. I was told after one phone call what vet records they were missing so I went to the vet and got them myself. When I called to find out who to send them to, they said they had those, they needed another vets records. WHAT?!?!?!? I was beyond frustrated by this. I asked what they needed to get these claims taken care of because this had been going on for 4 months and was unacceptable! 

They finally informed me that the vets notes pointed toward his allergy problem. I informed them that he had preexisting FOOD allergies and now we were looking at environmental allergies. I asked if they lump them together because in my mind, they are two completely separate issues. They said they are different but the vets notes are too vague. They don’t specify which allergies the vet is talking about. Well, looking at the treatments we’ve been trying, it should be pretty clear we aren’t working on a food allergy.

Long story short, still no resolution and now I’m working on appealing this. If you have A LOT of fight in you, go with this company. They will DEFINITELY give you a run for your money (pun intended)!
title: RUN! RUN AWAY FROM THIS COMPANY!

Always unable to resolve my claims.

I have four dogs. My oldest is going to be 6 in December. I’ve always had my dogs on insurance and I’ve never had such an issue getting claims resolved. They’re always unable to obtain the necessary information from my Vet, yet no other insurance company has ever had an issue.

Obviously they’re unwilling to put in the work to retrieve the information they need. They just give up. On top of that, there are no additional phone calls or notifications that the claims are going to be closed. They just close them and then of course I have to go through a phone call that takes way too long and an entire process in order to get them reopened. 

Now, they need some sort of itemized receipt for recent services. I don’t understand why I have to do something I’m paying them to do. I completely regret switching from Figo. 

I’m 4.5 months pregnant, work full time and also go to school full time, did I mention I have 4 dogs? I don’t have time to be on the phone with them or help them do what they’re already paid to do.

text: Their appeals process treats you like a criminal and is extremely slow. We've filed an appeal which is now taking over a month to undo their improper rejection of my dog's surgery.  I have multiple dogs and we decided based on our history with our oldest English bulldog we should invest in some insurance for our youngest English.  She started favoring her back left leg and we took her into our vet who determined she has a strained/damaged cruciate ligament which he believed would develop into a full tear if left untreated.  So we scheduled surgery only to receive a rejection notice from Pets Best a few days before taking her in. It was rejected because they said it was a pre existing condition before insurance was established.  I called to ask for further explanation and was told 2 years ago we text(sent a text message via personal cell phones) a vet saying our dog's leg seemed hurt and before bringing her in; did they think it was worth the visit? Texts ended with "just watch her for a few days and if it progresses bring her in".  Then unbeknownst to us the vet added this record to our youngest pup's file claiming it to be a cruciate ligament injury.  No exam, no official consult and no further treatment after text.  The kicker being this was our eldest dog's paw the text made no claim to which pet (we have 3 total)...  Now we've appealed with a letter from the vet admitting the record was attached to the wrong dog and in error.  It's been about a month under appeal now.  I called today because as predicted by the vet I believe it is a full tear now.  Scheduled surgery but it'll be 2 weeks of my dog suffering before they can fit her in... Now I'm told they've requested my other dog's complete medical history before they'll process my appeals claim.  So I've waited a month just to be told we need to submit an unrelated dog's complete medical history for a text which we never followed up on and a diagnosis that was not correct or confirmed.  One, why did no one call or email that they needed more information rather than making us wait?  If I hadn't called would this still not be processed? I asked to speak with a claims processer and was told they're too busy dealing with appeals(so apparently they have a hefty rejection work load), then I asked to speak someone else (anyone) and was rudely told no one else can do anything.  They've literally treated my wife an I like criminals trying to cheat the system.  Honestly a random text from 2 years ago was not in my memory until it was being quoted to me on the phone.  I'm more upset because not only is it unrelated but they never physically saw a dog.  Now I feel like a terrible pet owner because I've made my poor dog wait during this appeal for absolutely no purpose. I absolutely hate this company and my family's experience with them.
title: This is NOT OKAY!!
