text:
We had switched from TruPanion to Petsbest when we moved to FL, because they offered lower premiums and mostly the same type of coverage.  
We made 1 claim since we joined PetsBest, and it was declined because according to them, they were unable to get the Vet record from our previous Vet in NJ. We called the vet ourselves and got the records in a few minutes!
We then sent the records to PetsBest and after a couple of days they claimed they did not receive them and that they also needed the doctor's notes.  Again we had to call the Vet ourselves, doing their job for them.
After this, the claim was still denied, because they said they needed additional information from the vet in FL!
We canceled the policy and went back to Trupanion.

10/11/18 update:
In response to the reply below.  It is simply inconceivable that the records that PetsBest was "unable" to get from the previous Vet, we got ourselves in a 5min call. Additionally, every time we provided the requested documents ( again, doing their job for them) an additional set of documents was requested in order to process the claim. It just seems that the company just wanted to deny the claim no matter what we did.  In the end, we provided everything they requested, said that they would continue to process the claim regardless of our cancellation, and when I called today (after 3 months) to get an update, they provided the same response of not being able to process the claim due to not being able to receive all the documents.
Again, would not recommend ever!!
title: Would not recomend

text:
Terrible value for money. Basic items not covered for a heavy monthly premium.

Whilst I appreciate the response it should be pointed out that for $2 more per month I got vaccinations and spaying covered, albeit I can’t claim them because of Petsbest policies.

As you can see from the representatives refusal to understand the gripe, continuing to respond for responses sake this isn’t a company I would ever partner with again.

$51 a month doesn’t get you coverage for a single vaccination during the life of a 6 month old puppy. Whether they believe the policy documentation to be clear or not isn’t the customer issue. The policy structure is bad value for money - that is the dissatisfaction and surprise.

I really do not need another corporate defense statement so please, there is no need to defend a position I’m no interested in. I wish to warn others about my error, when paying $51 a month you do not get basic vaccination cover - they are monthly add ons.

I’ve found an insurer that doesn’t do this.
title: Terrible value for money

title: I have submitted several claims for my…

text:
Has your puppy ever had diarrhea? Heaven forbid that it has had it (once) before purchasing pet insurance from PetsBest. We purchased (10/9/17) pet insurance 6 weeks after getting our first dog (11/29/17-seems like a pretty reasonable time to acquire it) and filed our first claim with PetsBest after bringing our dog in for diarrhea for a second time (1/12/18), once prior to having PetsBest.  They applied that visit toward our $200 deductible so they didn't technically have to reimburse us for anything yet. We then brought her in for the 3rd time for diarrhea on July 23 (7/23/18), roughly 6 months later.  We submitted the claim and were denied as it was deemed a "pre-existing condition." A few things are wrong with that: 1. Diarrhea is a symptom, not a condition. 2. No vet has ever diagnosed her with Chronic Diarrhea. 3. Their policy defined a Chronic Condition as one that cannot be cured but only treated and managed- which Layla's diarrhea has since been cured and is defecating perfectly fine and has been for quite some time.  Moral of the story...PetsBest is GREAT until you are actually benefiting from pet insurance.  If you have EVER been to the vet before purchasing insurance, beware, because they will find any way possible to tie those previous vet visits to "pre-existing" conditions in order to avoid having to reimburse you.  They will gladly take your premium payments, but be warned, they will fight you on paying out.  They do have an appeals process, but that too, is a joke. PetsBest reviews PetsBest's decision and then if you make it to round 2 of their appeal, PetsBest sends your appeal to a "third-party" (that they contract) for another review.  When questioned about possibly submitting the appeal to an independent third-party, they said that "this is how it is typically done" and couldn't provide further information. Its a joke. I cant wait to see the BS they spew in their response. *waits for the copy and pasted response, subbing pets name, from their customer service team*



IN REGARDS TO THEIR REPLY:
Looking at our Claims, exactly 2 claims mention anything in regards to gastro issues.  All other mentions of gastro issues were essentially questions from the vet, wondering if her issues got better.  None of those questions were billed or charged for but were simply conversations with our vet. All of the other referred to issues weren't anything that PetsBest was responsible for reimbursing for, but direction as to how to proceed from our vet and we were there for other issues and happened to have the conversation while we were already there for unrelated issues, again, not adding to any other expenses incurred by PetsBest. There is no indication of the symptoms getting resolved because we haven't taken our healthy dog to the vet since.  She was on medication (antibiotics) for 10 days following the first vet visit. Your argument would be valid if you had paid for any of those instances.  Only once did we receive antibiotics (billed towards our deductible) and canned food (not covered by PetsBest) resulting in PetsBest denying all responsibility to reimburse us. Thanks for your reply but it doesnt fit in this situation.
title: Has your puppy ever had diarrhea?

text: HORRIBLE! The worst experience i have ever had with an insurance company. When I adopted my pup she had a free month of insurance with AKC and then I switched to your insurance and she had a minor issue with possibly swallowing something that caused loose stools and I called my vet and she went on flagyl.  She then improved . When I saw my vet a week later  she was fine and got her shots. Then the following week she started having loose stools and could have been a reaction to the shots, but it continued for  a few weeks so my vet wanted to rule out anything serious. My pup then saw the specialist and had ~ $700 worth of tests which ruled out cancer, EPI etc. and possibly might be an allergy to chicken which is in everything pup's eat even her heartworm pills. To make a long story short your insurance won't cover anything related to her diarhea which is outrageous. She was a 2 1/2 month old pup and they have sensitive tummies so to call this pre- existing condition is BS!

text:
This company is complete butt!!! if you get a rescue dog or if you get your dog when they are older!!! They won't even cover diagnostics fees!!! Let alone a $5,000 surgery that my girl needs for her Knee! Because its now considered a pre-existing condition although I've had this insurance for 5 months!! and if something happened to my other girl's knee it also wouldn't be covered! Don't bother with this company and just go to Hartville pet insurance! They don't consider things to be a pre-existing condition if it's been healed for 180 days and they only have a 14 day waiting period vs Pets Best 6 months! They are about the same price and Hartville has better coverage!

@petsbest I've already talked to a customer service representative when you guys would not cover her diagnostics fees spent an hour on chat with them! If you want to look into it, my policy number was 104020585. I will not waste any more of my time with petsbest by calling you! Because at the end of the day you won't cover my girl's knee and I have to spend $5,000 out of my pocket for this surgery when she had your companies insurance!

text:
First let me start off and say Pets Best is awesome! From initial enrollment to processing of my claims, you name it. I have the illness, accident and wellness plans for my furbabies. While I did not utilize the accident or illness plans (and I always hope not too!!!), I have utilized the Wellness Benefit for the yearly evaluations, vaccines, heartworm and flea/tick preventions and submitted them the same day for processing. It was super easy, took a picture of the invoice, uploaded on the website - through the app, DONE!! 😃 In less than 24 hours (actually it was less than 12 hours), they processed my claim, provided me with an EOB (Explanation of Benefits) and it will be directly deposited in my bank account of record. I never saw such wonderful and compassionate service! Vets bills are not cheap. Any help you can get is wonderful. Knowing they process these effectively so you can provide the best care for your furbabies is such a relief and provides peace of mind. 

I greatly encourage anyone looking for pet insurance for their furbaby, who is a part of your family, look no further than Pets Best. And I can say their prices are reasonable. I was able to insure my 10 year old doggie, with no problems. Knowing I have that for her and my other furbabies, that I can provide care to them, with no issues or concerns, provides me with such relief! I am their mommy, so I want to give them the very best care when they need it, without the worry of finances. 

Thanks Pets Best! You guys are AWESOME! 🐾🐾🐾🐾🐾 (5 paws!)

Jennifer and her furbabies - PA
title: Awesome services

text: As an insurance agent, I feel morally obligated to urge anyone reading this to NOT purchase from Pets Best. I have had MUCH better luck with Figo (and I can't even sell policies for Figo since my company is contracted with Pets Best).  In my personal opinion, this  company has got to be the WORST pet insurance company on the planet.  After my claim was denied, I reviewed my policy and the "What's not covered? See a FULL list here". No where was it mentioned that this was an exclusion (infection post de-claw). They blew my concerns off on the phone and I subsequently filed a small claims case. Their lawyer argued that Pets Best is not an insurance company, but rather a third party that sells for other insurance companies. Their customer service is completely useless as well. Again, please DO NOT purchase from them.

text: My dog has had an gastrointestinal condition for the last 3 years. She at times just refuses to eat. It was recommended by our Vet that she have the NutriScan test done to see what food sensitives she might have. The test cost $280-$300 and it is recommended that you have it done yearly. We are so lucky that Pets Best Health Insurance covers the cost of this test!! Our dog was found to have several food sensitivities one being egg. Which is found in so many foods and treats. Removing this from our dogs diet along with several other foods has really made a difference!! We are on our 3rd year with Pets Best and have just enrolled our new Puppy. text: I not only WOULD recommend this company, I HAVE recommended Pest's Best to everyone who has asked me how my cat is doing.  I enrolled her in Pet's Best in 2014, when she was in great health.  Early this year, she was diagnosed with hyperthryoidism, which can cause degeneration of kidneys and other internal organs.  Treatment choices included 2x/day medications for the rest of her life, which would only hold the illness at bay (similar to injections for diabetes), or treatment with radioactive iodine (I-131).  The latter treatment was expensive, but cures the illness.  It also requires pre-treatment x-rays and full bloodwork panel.  Pet's Best honored the I-131 and pre-treatment tests without question.

text: I have been with Pet's Best for eight years and liked them until I recently submitted my first serious claim.. They used some tricky math to swindle me out of $300 on the claim.  The policy description says they pay 70% after a $1000 deductible, but in fact they apply the deductible to their 70% share, reducing the effective payment to about 65%.  I told them I thought this was unconscionable, and their reply was "this underwriter calculates it that way."  I would have given them fewer stars, but their customer service folks are very nice and they did process my claim quickly.  But the policy description is misleading at best.
title: I felt cheated by the way my payment was calculated

text: Before getting our French Bulldog puppy, we looked long and hard for a good pet insurance company that we could trust, as French Bulldogs often have well-known (and costly) health issues. Being able to pay bi-annually was a great bonus, too. Submitting a claim is extremely easy and hassle-free, requiring very little added effort from me, other than submitting a simple receipt and seeing the funds hit my account just days later. Little did we know, our poor baby would break both elbows at just 4 months old. THANK GOD for Pets Best! The surgeries and long hospital stays were so expensive, but Pets Best alleviated a lot of the cost for us and we couldn't be more thankful. In the days after his surgeries and into his recovery, submitting the 40+ pages of hospital bills to Pets Best was so, so simple and we received our claim literally just days later, which was such a relief in a very stressful time. I recommend Pets Best to all of my friends and family who are looking for a great company that provides easy, uncomplicated insurance for their furry family members!

text:
I had gotten pet insurance on my cat, Angie, back in Oct 2013, more as a 'just in case' than as a necessity. I had to take Angie to the vet late May 2015 for what I thought was a routine checkup. It turned out to be a bit more than that. The bill came out to be a hair over $300; I'm on a fixed income & that was a pretty big chunk. I had also noticed in the vet's office a notice that stated if I did not turn in the insurance paperwork at time of the procedure, they would refuse to complete it. I called Pets Best on 06/01/15 in a bit of a panic & spoke with a lovely young customer service rep (whose name I forgot to write down) and she calmed me down, assuring me that all I had to do was to print out a claim form & complete it, attach the vet bill, mail it to them & that they'd do everything possible to maximize the payout on the claim. I did that, calculating that I would receive a $150 reimbursement & prayed for the best.  Imagine my surprise & relief when I checked my checking account 10 business days later & saw that Pets Best reimbursed me $150.00.  I was relieved and grateful at their prompt handling of the claim.

My experience with Pets Best Health Insurance has been great. I'd change vets before changing pet insurers - and I REALLY love Angie's vet!
title: Good Company, Great CSRs

text:
Having been in the health insurance business, as a broker, for 40 plus years I was a bit apprehensive about pet insurance.  To sum up my opinion, I wish the health insurance carriers I represented were as efficient, caring and customer friendly as Pets Best.

text: I have had Pets Best insurance for 5 years. Fortunately for me my dog has been healthy. I have been very satisfied with my coverage and customer service. I would recommend company to anyone.
title: Satisfied

text:
I love this company! We have had a policy for two years now and although it is cliche, my only regret is not getting a policy sooner. We purchased our policy after paying $5,000 to fix our dogs leg. Pets Best was recommended to me by a friend and had very competitive rates but also great coverage. Remember you get what you pay for.
A year after having our policy our vet told us that we need to do some mass removals and lab test. Cost? $1,800. I sent in information to PetsBest and their claims department sent me approval right away for the procedure. We would have done the procedure with or without our pet insurance, but being able to get the majority of the cost covered allowed us to do it right away and not worry about such and unexpected financial impact. After the procedure I submitted my invoice online and had my claim processed and money in my account within 24 hours. The customer service rep that helped me on my 1st claim couldn't have been better to work with.
About a year later we made our 2nd claim. Our poor pup's other rear leg blew out just playing in the backyard. She wasn't doing anything out of the ordinary and all of the sudden she wouldn't put weight on her leg. We knew right away from our previous experience that surgery was inevitable. We received our vet quote, just under $5,000 for this time around. I contacted Pets Best again and they told me everything I should get from the vet to file a claim after surgery and informed me about what may be and may not be covered. They made it easy to understand and I was sure it would be covered. AND IT WAS! I send in medical records and the invoice using their online claim form and submission process. Within 2 days Pets Best paid 80% of my dogs surgery expenses, less annual deductible of course.
Customer service, fast turn times, and their integrity is what makes Pets Best an exceptional company. For those "money" people out there, the money Pets Best has paid in claims is equal to several years of my monthly premiums.
My dog is now half dog, half machine but she will walk almost as perfectly as before for the rest of her life and be as happy as can be. I will spend the rest of my life recommending this company to anyone who will listen.
title: MAHALO NUI LOA Pets Best!
